Branch News
Ethical Finance Week

Ethical Finance week is kicking off on Monday 1st February. We’re planning a number of events including a film night and presentations from the Glasgow Credit Union and PCS Credit Union. If you have ever wondered how banks use our money, and would like to be sure you are supporting ethical causes, do come and join one of these events.
AGM

The Annual General Meeting for the Ofgem PCS Branch will be coming up at the end of February, where all  Branch positions will be up for election. Members interested in taking a BEC position, pleasedo feel free to come and speak to anyone currently on the BEC! Follow these links for role profiles <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D21e35e91d1%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C6167d4388dc24443c4b608d8beb2d986%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637469022681290466%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=I1vHST%2FwdvrYQs4p7jCTvyrbZqHsQgAFMswSw%2FWSYME%3D&reserved=0>  and a nomination form <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3De3cd08db30%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C6167d4388dc24443c4b608d8beb2d986%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637469022681290466%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=9x9gHvf5cKRO9p1FQrhK6rUKCNJifGK%2FYzSvp1yI8sc%3D&reserved=0> .
Campaigns & Events
Supporting NHS staff

We are gathering messages of support for our NHS staff to hopefully raise any morale we can for our healthcare heroes. Messages will be sent to a Glasgow and London Hospital. If you would like to contribute a message please email it to pcs@ofgem.gov.uk <mailto:pcs@ofgem.gov.uk?subject=Message%20for%20NHS%20staff>  by the end of today! And in these times please stay home, if you can, to support our NHS workers.
Meetings and events
PCS Scotland Online Pay Rally: Friday 29th January, 12 - 1pm

In November, the UK Government announced yet another a pay freeze for civil servants. We are inviting members to get involved in the PCS pay campaign to challenge the government’s proposed freeze, by attending PCS Scotland’s lunchtime meeting on Zoom <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D4b9a8d2289%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C6167d4388dc24443c4b608d8beb2d986%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637469022681300455%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=96FWdnm6TXOWAQR9mbNeProbrMXwKMCgtHWtTmIyCsk%3D&reserved=0> .

At this meeting, members will hear an update on pay from the General Secretary, and will also have the opportunity to hear from PCS Parliamentary Group Chair, Chris Stephens MP, who will discuss how we can pressure the government to scrap the pay freeze.
Glasgow Town Committee 2021 Meeting, Wednesday 27th January
The Glasgow Town Committee will be holding our first Town Committee meeting of 2021 on Wednesday 27th January 2021 4:30pm-6:00pm
This is open to all reps, activists, advocates, and members in and around the Glasgow area. To attend this meeting please email alex@pcs.org.uk <mailto:alex@pcs.org.uk>  for the private zoom link.
Points for discussion are:

PCS Scotland Black Members Network Meeting

Co-conveners of the network, would like to invite all PCS Black members in Scotland to the first network meeting of 2021. The meeting will be on Thursday 28th January. As members may be aware PCS subscribes to the notion of Political Blackness and applies to people from African, Asian, South American and Middle Eastern Diasporas, including people of dual heritage. If you are unable to attend this meeting but are interested in the network, please let us know. To confirm attendance and receive the Zoom link please email pcsscotlandbmn@gmail.com <mailto:pcsscotlandbmn@gmail.com>  or ruby@pcs.org.uk <mailto:ruby@pcs.org.uk> .

29 January Pay Day rally [OFFICIAL Internal Only],"Dear members,

This Friday we are organising a number of pay day events across all PCS regions. (Yes, I know our pay day was last week, but bear with me :)). These events are the next step in our ongoing campaign for better pay, following on from the debate we secured in Parliament on the 14th of December last year*. The events are set up as online rallies, one for each PCS region, with some keynote speakers. This is an opportunity for you to express strength of feeling about the erosion of your pay, ask questions about the campaign directly to next members of the National Executive Committee, and hear from members elsewhere in the civil service about their experiences.
Glasgow

The Glasgow rally will be held from 12:00 to 13:00 via Zoom. You need to register for the event by emailing scotland@pcs.org.uk <mailto:scotland@pcs.org.uk>  and letting them know which branch you are a part of (we’re PSg - Office of Gas & Electricity Markets. Our branch code is 140112). You will then receive the Zoom details to let you join the call. Keynote speakers are Mark Serwotka, our very own general secretary, and Chris Stephens MP who chairs the PCS Parliamentary Group in Parliament.
London

The London rally will be held from 13:00 to 14:00 via Zoom. You will need to register using this online registration form <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fforms.office.com%2FPages%2FResponsePage.aspx%3Fid%3DHD356aYQmEmp-KwjTvDiV-RgbGdvV8xLiUrIitT3jZNUQ05ET0ZQQlJKSjlNWlcwVEUwR1pBVzVTWC4u&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C84ed9c9584f9406201bb08d8c15ce394%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637471951986360153%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=Feg37PFabZZdCbRcnI0kPTBQ0oumZSutQBnYOJPQM30%3D&reserved=0>  (here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fforms.office.com%2FPages%2FResponsePage.aspx%3Fid%3DHD356aYQmEmp-KwjTvDiV-RgbGdvV8xLiUrIitT3jZNUQ05ET0ZQQlJKSjlNWlcwVEUwR1pBVzVTWC4u&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C84ed9c9584f9406201bb08d8c15ce394%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637471951986360153%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=Feg37PFabZZdCbRcnI0kPTBQ0oumZSutQBnYOJPQM30%3D&reserved=0> ). While not required, you can provide our branch details so HQ can work out who has been attending. (Wwe’re PSg - Office of Gas & Electricity Markets. Our branch code is 140112). You can also use the form to submit questions in advance, if you have any. Keynote speakers are Fran Heathcote, President of the National Executive Committee, and John McDonnell MP, who was previously chair of the PCS Parliamentary Group.

More information about the events and the pay campaign is on the PCS website here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.pcs.org.uk%2Fnews%2Fjoin-our-big-payday-zoom-rally&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C84ed9c9584f9406201bb08d8c15ce394%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637471951986370146%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=vXMTOenNWLR%2FCW8PwfKGgv2mE21wY6hqVOd1lMN4n9c%3D&reserved=0> .
Cheerio,
Frank

column1: Branch News
Future of Work Project

On Tuesday Ofgem laid out their plans for changes to the way we work once we return to the office. In the Show and Tell (if you missed it can be viewed here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dae95f8814b%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C9017cedbcce346b7a29d08d8c3a670de%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637474466944847855%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=nGJvGc7apbWV5%2FH8ZdZLuwnPjnzuS6fugLcdiLrhjrw%3D&reserved=0> ), Ofgem laid out their position that working from home will continue 3 or 4 days a week even after we can return to the office. They have based the descions on the future of work survey carried out in July 2020. Because Ofgem has decided not to rerun their WFH survey, we're now doing it instead, we have put together an initial survey, here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3De9b84cd7e8%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C9017cedbcce346b7a29d08d8c3a670de%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637474466944847855%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=DtU9sLTD2LYU48R8L80ArZ2ydTX2R4N625MbrBePEpw%3D&reserved=0> . We encourage members to complete the short survey and forward this to non-members in their teams.
Ethical Finance Week

Ethical Finance week is kicking off on Monday 1st February. We’re planning a number of events including a film night and presentations from the Glasgow Credit Union and PCS Credit Union. If you have ever wondered how banks use our money, and would like to be sure you are supporting ethical causes, do come and join one of these events. Find out more in Wire Article <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dec4ca5c8e7%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C9017cedbcce346b7a29d08d8c3a670de%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637474466944857851%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=WyVwyrT%2B34s9Au18l8cSYDoVMnHOdbAo4gjx%2BlETkTE%3D&reserved=0> .
AGM

The Annual General Meeting for the Ofgem PCS Branch will be coming up at the end of February, where all Branch positions will be up for election. Members interested in taking a BEC position, please do feel free to come and speak to anyone currently on the BEC! Role profiles are here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D7b8872afd1%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C9017cedbcce346b7a29d08d8c3a670de%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637474466944857851%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=7n0k64CggxKv%2BPEIdd8fLno3SSa6calY%2BjKpaY20gAI%3D&reserved=0> , and a nomination form is here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dadddc77ca4%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C9017cedbcce346b7a29d08d8c3a670de%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637474466944867840%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=4ZYOXTRSIc1etgwQQSoKijgS78%2Ff4fdR%2F5l0%2FqL7LiE%3D&reserved=0>  for you to peruse.
A message of thanks from Clara Paillard, from the PCS culture Group
Members raised £160 for the PCS Culture Group Strike Fund through their GoFundMe collection (it’s still open!). We got this thank you message from Clara Paillard in the PCS Culture Group:
Thanks so much for your donation to the PCS Culture Group hardship fund! This is very appreciated. Follow us on Twitter @PCSCultureGroup and Facebook PCS Culture Group. Solidarity!""
Campaigns & Events
PCS Scotland Online Pay Rally: Friday 29th January, 12 - 1pm

In November, the UK Government announced yet another a pay freeze for civil servants. We are inviting members to get involved in the PCS pay campaign to challenge the government’s proposed freeze, by attending PCS Scotland’s lunchtime meeting on Zoom.

At this meeting, members will hear an update on pay from the General Secretary, and will also have the opportunity to hear from PCS Parliamentary Group Chair, Chris Stephens MP, who will discuss how we can pressure the government to scrap the pay freeze.
If you’d like to attend, please email scotland@pcs.org.uk <mailto:scotland@pcs.org.uk>  to get the zoom link.
Supporting NHS staff

We are gathering messages of support for our NHS staff to hopefully raise any morale we can for our healthcare heroes. Messages will be sent to a Glasgow and London Hospital, next week. If you would like to contribute a message please email it to pcs@ofgem.gov.uk <mailto:pcs@ofgem.gov.uk>  by the end of today! And in these times please stay home, if you can, to support our NHS workers.

We have have received a few submission since we first put the call out last week, read them here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D319da093b0%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C9017cedbcce346b7a29d08d8c3a670de%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637474466944877835%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=V0VZ28jETtCgzIiI7zfDCX5XVEIMujKISjiPMN36tsA%3D&reserved=0> .

PCS Movie night - Ethical Finance,"Good afternoon everyone,

As part of Ethical Finance Week <http://ofgemintranet/SpecialismsAndGroups/Groups/Unions/Pages/PCS-Ethical-Finance-Week.aspx>  we are hosting another PCS movie night! :) We have found a good 20 minute overview of ethical finance, its challenges and what options are out there for individuals. As before, we will use the movie as a starting point for some discussion afterwards, for example about what ethical finance options people might already be using or be familiar with.

The documentary is available on YouTube here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3D9o1SKOpaQ_8%26t%3D1014s&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cee4fa7ebd52e4a444cd208d8c6abc35d%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637477788304610214%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=ijloEkMnzF%2Fv4%2BXlkQ6cTwkU%2BFimjbfv%2Bp8dVOav0nc%3D&reserved=0> .
Timings
17:00 – 17:15: Time for people to arrive
17:15 – 17:45: Watch the documentary
17:45 – 18:30: Discussion
Hope to see you there!
Cheerio,
Frank

PS. Of course, it helps to actually have money when looking to invest it ethically. That is why we’re asking Ofgem to guarantee all staff are paid at least the Real Living Wage. PCS Annual General Meeting,"Dear members,

Lockdown or no lockdown, it is the season for the PCS annual general meeting (AGM). This year the AGM is scheduled for 25 February, from 15:00 to 17:30. We are still bolting down the agenda, but wanted to mark the date in your calendar. Items that will feature are:
-      Presentation of the annual report and the accounts.
-      Election results for elected positions on the branch executive committee.
-      Discussion of any motions submitted.
A template to submit motions is attached.
If you are unsure about how to stand for election, nominate someone or submit a motion, please contact myself or one of the other reps, and we’ll be happy to help out.
Cheerio,
Frank

Wallace Collection urged by PCS to call off redundencies

Since the announcement that the renowned Wallace Collection has received a grant of £205k from the Weston Culture Fund, PCS is calling for the Wallace collection to immediately withdraw the threat of redundancy from our members in the library and archive. PCS continues to oppose all compulsory redundancies across the culture sector and will campaign vociferously against this attack on our member and branch secretary. Nominate yourself as a delegate to upcoming TUC conferences

Each year the TUC run conferences for Black, disabled, LGBT+, women and young workers. Due to the ongoing impact of Covid-19, this year the conferences will take place entirely online, and for the first time, there is no limit to the number of attendees. Victory for H&M producers in India

After an eight-month struggle and international solidarity campaign, the Garment and Textile Workers’ Union (GATWU) has signed an agreement with H&M supplier Gokaldas Exports that recognizes the union and reinstates all the 1,257 workers – mostly women - who were fired. Reducing your hours working part-time

On the all-staff call this week, a colleague asked about taking up a 20-30 hour contract and taking a pay cut so that they could spend more time with their family and less time working. Many people find part-time working great for their work/life balance.

There aren’t a set number of 20-30 hour contracts, and you can actively ask to change your contract and work part-time if you’d like. Do make sure to discuss this with your line manager first as you can only make one formal request for flexible working each year.

The form is here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D76e6b4cf2c%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C1d2477b2ee334c9c5b3808d8d3fb4b22%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637492423558716152%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=pbSAW9BtQuikJMlu5f2bRTqqhUAEwD%2FwwcRe81aVJBg%3D&reserved=0> , and notes here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Da558873c5e%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C1d2477b2ee334c9c5b3808d8d3fb4b22%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637492423558716152%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=CI8QFGvi4P%2BPb5lNVsVx6i%2FeXpHiiNgOYX4hT2E9wE4%3D&reserved=0>  (Ofgem treats a request to work part-time in the same way as a formal flexible working request). Your pay, pensions contribution, and holidays will be calculated pro-rata based on your hours worked. Any change to your contract is permanent, so you can’t automatically switch back, but it’s worth discussing these kind of details with your manager prior to submitting the form.

Fair Pay for British Council Workers

Following a year when the British Council faced the largest crisis in the organisation since its inception, it wasn’t until December that the British Council was refused additional funding to give staff any sort of pay increase or performance payment in 2020. PCS lands 'crushing' victory on redundancy payment cap

In November 2020, the government imposed legislative regulations setting a cap of £95,000 on redundancy payments in the public sector. PCS, along with other unions, lodged proceedings with the High Court in order to get the legislation quashed. In what marks a further crushing legal victory for PCS over the government on behalf of our members, the government has now confirmed that they intend to revoke the legislation. Read further here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dfa1616575b%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C1d2477b2ee334c9c5b3808d8d3fb4b22%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637492423558746134%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=XuI9kv0xAB00HvMax4BM4yj10P59GTWYoPhjoeNMFSw%3D&reserved=0> .
PCS activist wins employment tribunal claim against DVSA

Paul Williams – a member of the union’s NEC who had 38 years as a civil servant, won his case at the Driving and Vehicle Standards Agency (DVSA) after a Nottingham ET concluded that his employer had tried to stop him carrying out trade union duties. PCS general secretary Mark Serwotka said the case demonstrated some of the most appalling anti-trade union practices he’d seen, and thanked Paul for his dedication to the trade union movement. Read more about this case here.

Reducing your hours working part-time

On the all-staff call this week, a colleague asked about taking up a 20-30 hour contract and taking a pay cut so that they could spend more time with their family and less time working. Many people find part-time working great for their work/life balance.

There aren’t a set number of 20-30 hour contracts, and you can actively ask to change your contract and work part-time if you’d like. Do make sure to discuss this with your line manager first as you can only make one formal request for flexible working each year.

The form is here, and notes here (Ofgem treats a request to work part-time in the same way as a formal flexible working request). Your pay, pensions contribution, and holidays will be calculated pro-rata based on your hours worked. Any change to your contract is permanent, so you can’t automatically switch back, but it’s worth discussing these kind of details with your manager prior to submitting the form.

PCS Payday rally,"Dear members,

Our campaign for fair pay <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.pcs.org.uk%2Fnews%2Fpcs-steps-up-pre-budget-campaign-on-pay&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C327979e8301f41de942f08d8d7f443dc%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637496791428105497%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=Ze8Tevc4zMjNNxWkGAcorOclS%2FEppLbhTtHD7SILDe8%3D&reserved=0>  continues to power forward. We are marking the impact of the enduring pay caps on civil servants and other public sector workers on pay days. For February we are holding an online rally on Friday 26th, from 16:30 to 17:25. We will be joined by Apsana Begum <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.theyworkforyou.com%2Fmp%2F25914%2Fapsana_begum%2Fpoplar_and_limehouse&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C327979e8301f41de942f08d8d7f443dc%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637496791428115497%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=31bYfuXeuzZ6qUKXNtNL%2Fv%2Bk2PyU%2BhU6oTzowl0r0QE%3D&reserved=0> , Labour MP for Poplar & Limehouse, which is the constituency that Canary Wharf is in. We also expect to have either our general secretary Mark Serwotka or president Fran Heathcote attending to give an update on the pay campaign, and answer your questions.

We are also asking you to make a sign or poster explaining why you need a pay rise, or support our campaign for fair pay. On closing the rally, we will do a screen capture of all the members holding signs to show the support for the campaign.

Some of you may be from branches that have other workplaces than Canary Wharf. Members who don’t work at Canary Wharf are equally welcome. Canary Club reps, please share this invite with your branches.

column1: The rally will be hosted via Microsoft Teams using the link below.
Background to our pay campaign

Civil Service pay has been capped ever since the financial crisis in 2007. Although we were promised at the last election that austerity was over, the Government intends to announce a new public sector pay freeze in response to the coronavirus pandemic. This could set the scene for another decade of pay ‘restraint’, with wages falling behind inflation year on year resulting in real term wage cuts. Before Christmas, PCS successfully got over 100,000 signatures for our Parliamentary petition, forcing a debate in Parliament. Building on this success, our pay campaign now powers on, together with other public sector unions and the TUC. With borrowing costs still at historic lows and the economy needing a boost to avoid a prolonged recession, we think not austerity, but investment in workers, society and public services <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.pcs.org.uk%2Fnews%2Fpcs-mythbuster-number-3-%25E2%2580%2593-the-country-can%25E2%2580%2599t-afford-a-pay-rise-at-the-moment&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C327979e8301f41de942f08d8d7f443dc%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637496791428115497%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=9HxBiDj0T3T%2B8MuyyhpCS4mW9%2Bko2T5SHGtNAzFYGuI%3D&reserved=0>  is the way to move on from the pandemic.
Cheerio,
Frank

Re: Racism & Intolerance: Changing Attitudes in the Workplace course - please register asap if you would like to do this ,"Hi All
There are places available on the Racism & Intolerance course delivered by CONEL college, could you please promote this event with the branches that you are working with .
This is a short course delivered over two days starting at 10 am - 12.30 on Tuesday 9th March and concluding at the same start time on Tuesday 16th March

Online registration: Racism & Intolerance: Changing Attitudes in the Workplace <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcsunion.force.com%2Fpcsdigital%2Fs%2Fevents%3FeventId%3Da1H2p00000AS9CuEAL&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C47be5341337c4c5a195108d8da3e20a4%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637499307765927829%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=PZQcsxew3JRmN2OHY6UUTyjVlvvX9yiC8aNGUI563ms%3D&reserved=0>  (login to PCS Digital required)
The deadline for submitting applications is Friday 4 March 2021.

Trade unions have traditionally played a vital role in defending our communities from hate speech and actions, and in campaigning for fairness and equality. This workshop utilises materials developed by the TUC and anti-racism organisations to help build your confidence in challenging far-right ideas, and helps you tackle difficult conversations, as well as giving practical campaigning tips.

Please note once PCS has selected you to attend this course you will be required to complete a CONEL college application form to enrol with the college. This form requires a valid document number for residency in the UK, either a UK passport/Birth Certificate or Visa number
Lois

PCS Pay campaign - Things you can do [OFFICIAL Internal Only],"Good morning everyone,

Apologies for the separate email, but following our payday rally last Friday, there are two actions you can take to support the PCS pay campaign ahead of the budget announcement. But as the announcement is on Wednesday, I couldn’t hold off until the newsletter. I hope you don’t mind.

column2: TUC pre-budget rally: On 2 March the TUC and Labour’s Anneliese Dodds will be presenting a ‘Workers’ Budget’ as an alternative to the Government’s Budget on 3 March. The Workers’ Budget will focus on decent sick pay for all, pay rise for key workers and safe workplaces. The link to sign up is here: Rally for a Workers’ Budget | TUC <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.tuc.org.uk%2Frally-workers-budget&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cb0a3b13cac6b4ea0087908d8dcc8abc2%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637502101731036133%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=GjJpK0pUTG6aK4WuV0kVIf3BRxEG8T7YngjkslifQZM%3D&reserved=0> . Other speakers will be the TUC’s Frances O’Grady and our very own general secretary Mark Serwotka.

PCS e-action: We’ve launched an e-action to ask the Chancellor to scrap the pay freeze from the budget. We want as many members as possible to email the chancellor ahead of Wednesday, so please circulate widely. The link to the e-action can be found on this page here: Email Sunak to tell him scrap the pay freeze | Public and Commercial Services Union (pcs.org.uk) <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.pcs.org.uk%2Fnews%2Femail-sunak-to-tell-him-scrap-the-pay-freeze&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cb0a3b13cac6b4ea0087908d8dcc8abc2%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637502101731046128%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=qZKcznFhETBQ0E1xLYqEpvZ7hVuDlxVXkwTENR0do7U%3D&reserved=0> . A prewritten email is available, but feel free to edit it to suit your own style, as long as you keep it civilised.

Annual General Meeting (AGM) readout
Last week we had our Annual General Meeting for 2021. We had almost 40 members there, which was a great turnout. Hopefully when we do it again next year we can do something social after ??
Main takeaways from the AGM:

column2: We confirmed our new branch executive committee, and you can find the new composition on the Wire here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D6e6b755f45%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C1bc8cb0338c348d33f7708d8df1f0e2b%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637504671813249880%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=44th%2Fqp5CqX95eU4FVV%2FWcGbmb0dmH%2FURK4YqtNcqXg%3D&reserved=0> .

We agreed to create a network of reps for each directorate and portfolio in Ofgem. If you’re interested in becoming the representative for your directorate or team, get in touch with Frank. As we’re just setting this up this year, we plan to confirm reps on a ‘first come, first serve’ basis.
We also agreed to put a motion to our national conference, which is later this year, to affiliate PCS to the 4 Day Week Campaign.

There was a lot of debate on whether to change our ‘open door’ policy for personal support (on the Wire here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D0eea7f7707%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C1bc8cb0338c348d33f7708d8df1f0e2b%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637504671813249880%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=YleN5khrToGhKjjXENl%2BPQ7uxu7rggNn7WfBW8OveC0%3D&reserved=0> ). The AGM was just as split as the BEC, so instead of making a decision at the AGM, we will now consult the whole branch. So watch this space!

column1: Update on the Real Living Wage Petition

As some of you know, we believe that Ofgem ought to ensure that all our colleagues are paid enough to at least cover the cost of living, especially in these uncertain times. We found that lots of you are strongly supportive of our proposal, and over 270 of you have signed our petition. We have now formally petitioned <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D47afd90e7c%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C1bc8cb0338c348d33f7708d8df1f0e2b%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637504671813259872%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=g0HOCuzMXICyjvbtbI9Q5Sn1ZHHKFIN4QryfI6ng6r4%3D&reserved=0>  Ofgem and Jonathan Brearley asking that ExCo take action on this matter as soon as possible. It is not too late to support us however! If you agree Ofgem should pay the Real Living Wage, you can still add your name to the petition <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D94e792c764%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C1bc8cb0338c348d33f7708d8df1f0e2b%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637504671813269867%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=qAn5%2FI914R15%2Fgr6clFyKYZhmq%2Fb8C2HY2wyvGAXbto%3D&reserved=0> .

Campaigns and news
E-action to scrap the pay freeze

Our members are particularly concerned about the effect that a further pay freeze will have on their living standards as they have been subject to various forms of pay restraint for over 10 years. We call upon the government to scrap the proposed pay freeze on the civil service and ensure the Treasury funds a fair pay rise for our members. We have launched an e-action <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D40cefc12b1%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C1bc8cb0338c348d33f7708d8df1f0e2b%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637504671813289855%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=aVV3QW1eqlW574kkaVZDEnmIpNnIggcrdP8FpTgNXdA%3D&reserved=0>  so our members and supporters can email Sunak to show support towards scrapping the freeze.
Celebrating success at the Wallace Collection

The library and archives at the Wallace Collection in London were threatened with closure as part of cost-cutting measures being considered by senior management at the museum. PCS and other museum professionals set up an online petition <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3De0b88ce83e%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C1bc8cb0338c348d33f7708d8df1f0e2b%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637504671813289855%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=an6jBDmBsmYOhtorB54qN074EUS4MrfNAdJlvx3Svwo%3D&reserved=0>  on Change.org which attracted 29,382 signatures and played a substantial part in persuading the director and senior management against closing the archive and library. A huge success and thanks to all who signed, you can read further about this here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dd44395f064%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C1bc8cb0338c348d33f7708d8df1f0e2b%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637504671813299851%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=UXbnDehgxL1fq23ypGes8Z1Y6BH8FuPgBTHbA7laMsw%3D&reserved=0> .
HMRC members overwhelmingly back pay and contract reform deal

The largest membership engagement (82.4%) in a group ballot in the Union’s history: 79.6% of PCS members in HMRC have voted overwhelmingly to support the pay and contract reform offer, negotiated by PCS in the department. The huge ballot turnout was in support of the 3-year deal which is worth an average 13%.You can read about the details of the offer and more here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Da975e5b45c%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C1bc8cb0338c348d33f7708d8df1f0e2b%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637504671813299851%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=q8k5LI4wBiuM%2BND7RRwtupurlh1GpM7pZI4vnJTMHcs%3D&reserved=0> .
Events and Meetings
Racism & Intolerance: Changing Attitudes in the Workplace Workshop

Trade unions have traditionally played a vital role in defending our communities from hate speech and actions, and in campaigning for fairness and equality. This workshop delivered by CONEL college utilises materials developed by the TUC and anti-racism organisations to help build your confidence in challenging far-right ideas, and helps you tackle difficult conversations, as well as giving practical campaigning tips. The course is available for London Ofgem staff and is delivered over two days between 10am - 12.30pm on Tuesday 9th and 16th March. Click here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dee31ba10f0%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C1bc8cb0338c348d33f7708d8df1f0e2b%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637504671813309838%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=w1orfZLUICTXsf4dGC5ggtVRgFsIhIGuaBFqiicmSbI%3D&reserved=0>  to register online.
Women's History Month 2021 A Better Future For Women

Members can register for this year’s TUC Women’s Conference <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D328010b908%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C1bc8cb0338c348d33f7708d8df1f0e2b%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637504671813309838%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=dyuo0MC5VOKCEC6Lw%2F2tWpSpN3IN99FdjNiX96ATsDw%3D&reserved=0>  on 3-5 March. The conference is online for the first time; you do not have to attend for the full three days. It is an opportunity to hear speakers on a variety of topics, sign up for various sessions and, hopefully, feel able to take that step to becoming more involved in union activity and supporting and uplifting other women.

To round off Women’s History Month, there will be a PCS event on Zoom on 30 March, from 6.30 – 7.45 pm, entitled Celebrating Women, Past, Present and Future. More details to follow. This event will be chaired by Zita Holbourne, PCS national vice president.

PCS Social Drop-in,"Dear members,

On 17 March it has been a year since we started working from home. It has been a long year, and clearly we aren’t out of the woods yet. While not an anniversary we want to celebrate, we did think this was a good moment to bring back the PCS drop ins we had during the early phase of lockdown. Some of you will remember that we set up recurring meetings just for people to have a chat and stay in touch with each other. A year on, there’s probably still value to this, maybe even more than before. So in true Marvel style, we’re going for a reboot.

To make things a bit more interesting, someone from the branch executive committee will be along to give an update on what we’ve been up to, and answer any questions. For this event, we’ll likely cover the annual general meeting and our latest meeting with Ofgem. But we’ll be happy to answer any other questions you might have as well, though remember this is not a suitable forum for any personal matters.
Other than that, this is an opportunity to (re)connect with your fellow members and have some social chat. There may even be games, or another impromptu quiz, who knows! ??
Hope to see you there,
Frank

Branch News
Join our 1 year anniversary of WFH drop in session

To mark one year of working from home, we’re holding a session on Wednesday 18th March at 12:30 – 13:25 for members to get together and (re)connect. We’ll also have someone from the BEC give an update on what we’ve been up to and to answer any queries. Feel free to come along with some lunch and we will look forward to seeing you. You should have received the skype invite from Frank or feel free to get in touch if you haven’t received it.
Approaching end of tax year – claim the working from home allowance

As we approach the end of the financial year, if you haven’t already now is a good time to think about claiming the tax relief for working from home – which is set at £6 a week. You can complete this process online here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3De9e8c8ae99%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C057be46b9000489761bb08d8e4b796c8%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637510824453923073%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=4xcJSMD3w27B%2BnbgQqbWJ8YCRFNa5YmZ0g7jMtKCJNY%3D&reserved=0> .

Campaigns and news
Pay campaign update and E-action

The Cabinet Office are due to issue pay remit guidance on 31 March, and the PCS are keeping up pressure through the ongoing pay campaign. You can read more about this in the story on the PCS website <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Da89d5e8d6a%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C057be46b9000489761bb08d8e4b796c8%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637510824453933074%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=lfzVyeIAQdpurldlHVnwRJ2EGPwwY9VVgl6wJJbMPyw%3D&reserved=0> , and sign the e-action here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3De84e4bd679%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C057be46b9000489761bb08d8e4b796c8%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637510824453943064%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=NXj4FnfDQ50yqHtahKAPjeJtkfX4MdfmU6y5fldz7Ww%3D&reserved=0> .
Events and Meetings
Scottish TUC Black Workers' Network Meeting 6pm Tuesday 16 March

The STUC Black Workers’ Committee have organised a Black Workers’ Network Meeting for Tuesday 16th of March at 6pm.The network meeting is open to all Black, Asian and Minority Ethnic Workers across Scotland, including those not already in a Trade Union. For more details and to register for the Black Workers’ Network meeting please follow the link <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D4ac090b566%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C057be46b9000489761bb08d8e4b796c8%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637510824453943064%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=NqGV621FsBZuJdGCry%2FGxkfmjGeOsiRAHW0bYS5cwS0%3D&reserved=0> .
Women's History Month 2021 A Better Future For Women

To round off Women’s History Month, there will be a PCS event on Zoom on 30 March, from 6.30 – 7.45 pm, entitled Celebrating Women, Past, Present and Future.  More details to follow. This event will be chaired by Zita Holbourne, PCS national vice president.
LGBTQ+ History month

February was LGBTQ+ History month, and Scope have published a blog looking at the experiences of disabled LGBTQ+ people throughout history. You can read and learn more here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D1132c49ddb%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C057be46b9000489761bb08d8e4b796c8%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637510824453953059%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=%2BHi15lSaMnD2TYskuc6QWlGkIVMJAfZwp7rPhOXuerk%3D&reserved=0> .

PCS Pay Day rally,"Dear Member,

We are continuing our series of pay day rallies as part of our campaign for fair pay <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.pcs.org.uk%2Fcampaigns%2Fsupport-the-pcs-national-campaign%2Frestore-fair-and-equal-pay-for-all&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Ce207bdc22ca94ccae8af08d8e85eb0c2%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637514840725666319%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=7SauDQ2rgsDyTrkNiyz%2ByBfatrZWRH0dHMD81KU8kH8%3D&reserved=0> , and against the public sector pay freeze. That is why on 31 March, we are holding a joint event with other unions who are also fighting for fair pay. You can hear experiences from a healthcare worker, British Gas employee and shop worker, alongside one of our own members. This event is part of our push for a joint union campaign for pay at the Trade Union Congress (TUC). But while co-ordinating at the TUC is important, what is really vital is building alliances at regional and local level between workers from across all unions.

So come along to show your support for our pay campaign, hear experiences from workers from other sectors, and find out what our next steps are. Our pay day rally on 31 January had over 100 activists and members at it, but we are looking to do even better this time round! You can register for the event here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fforms.office.com%2FPages%2FResponsePage.aspx%3Fid%3DHD356aYQmEmp-KwjTvDiV-RgbGdvV8xLiUrIitT3jZNUM0FCUU01TDAxRjY1SVpJNDgzNVpURzJTMS4u&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Ce207bdc22ca94ccae8af08d8e85eb0c2%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637514840725676313%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=Dgs9l8nYVeiQmy8AVp7da8m6z3dp1FI0fae3ZjJsW%2Fg%3D&reserved=0> . You will then be sent a link to attend the event via Zoom.

The more people take part, the stronger we are. So register for the pay day rally here (Online Register 31st March Rally <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fforms.office.com%2FPages%2FResponsePage.aspx%3Fid%3DHD356aYQmEmp-KwjTvDiV-RgbGdvV8xLiUrIitT3jZNUM0FCUU01TDAxRjY1SVpJNDgzNVpURzJTMS4u&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Ce207bdc22ca94ccae8af08d8e85eb0c2%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637514840725676313%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=Dgs9l8nYVeiQmy8AVp7da8m6z3dp1FI0fae3ZjJsW%2Fg%3D&reserved=0> ) and come along!
Cheerio,
Frank

PCS Pay Day rally - Glasgow,"Dear Glasgow members,

The recent announcement of a further pay freeze for civil servants has come as a slap in the face after over a decade of continued pay restraint in the sector. The PCS campaign to pressure the government continues, and it’s important that we keep the momentum and energy going!

Not only do Civil Servants deserve a fair pay rise, but further pay austerity makes no economic sense. Putting money in the pockets of public sector workers, who will spend that money in the private sector economy, will help the country recover economically post-Covid.

In Glasgow, the Town Committee are holding an event on pay day Wednesday 31st of March from 1pm – 2pm with PCS National President Fran Heathcote and Chair of the PCS Parliamentary Group and Local MP, Chris Stephens. We encourage all of you to come along to bolster our campaign, to hear from Fran about the next steps for the campaign, and hear from Chris how the PCS Parliamentary Group is making the case for fair pay in Parliament.

This event clashes with the other invite we sent round earlier, which is the London & South East event. That’s the advantage of having a branch with two offices, you get to pick which rally you like most ?? But that does mean you have to choose which rally to attend. If you want to register for this one, you can do it using this EventBrite link: https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/pcs-glasgow-town-committee-rally-for-fair-pay-tickets-145502131793 <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.eventbrite.co.uk%2Fe%2Fpcs-glasgow-town-committee-rally-for-fair-pay-tickets-145502131793&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C9f44cf617d904176ec4508d8e9640546%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637515963081812853%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=zaPaj1swY8W%2BTrCQ1hMEbEX8v7TNEQrqpUb8my%2Bsw90%3D&reserved=0>
Cheerio,

Privatisation does not work: End privatisation at the Imperial War Museum

For 7 years the IWM has outsourced the visitor & security services which has clearly failed. It does not work for the public, for the workers or for the museum collections.  Workers have endured mismanagement, as well as payroll and pension administration problems and it is not cost effective to privatise this service. Read more here and sign their petition <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Da979f520a9%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Ca19a32e893194312aa3208d8ea21de5b%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637516778495120792%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=wEBI0Ohjj2WN4waqbsNdEqeUbZlbKaIxuDTOwAfy3lk%3D&reserved=0> .

Saturday 20 March is United Nations Anti-Racism Day

Stand Up to Racism (SUTR) and the TUC are marking the international day of action with online rallies and other events to unite people across the world against racism, Islamophobia, antisemitism and fascism. Institutional and structural racism is still endemic in our society. The murder of George Floyd and the disproportionate number of black deaths as a result of the Covid pandemic has brought the fight against racial inequality back into the spotlight. Real Living Wage Campaign - Update [OFFICIAL Internal Only],"Dear member or colleague,

We want to give you an update on where we are with the campaign for a Real Living Wage at Ofgem. You are receiving this because you are either a PCS member or have signed our petition (or both). It has been a while since we started the petition and published something on the Wire, so we owed you an update.
What has happened so far?

Negotiations with Ofgem are ongoing, but we have not made as much progress as we’d like. While Ofgem has made some positive noises, there have been no concrete steps towards getting all staff on at least the Real Living Wage. This is despite our estimate that the extra cost to Ofgem would only be about £14,000/year. The lack of progress is particularly concerning because once we enter the next financial year, Ofgem will be more severely constrained by the new public sector pay freeze.
What are we asking Ofgem to do?

We think it is still possible to get all staff on the Real Living Wage if Ofgem act quickly. There is no obstacle to offering new starters a starting salary at the Real Living Wage level, even if the formal band minimum remains lower. We know this because it has been done before. For those colleagues already with us on less than the Real Living Wage, we have asked Ofgem to use the advancement process to raise their salary to at least that level.

We have twice written to Jonathan Brearley directly to make sure this issue is given the attention it deserves, and to stress that we think that paying the Real Living Wage is essential if Ofgem wants to be ‘the best regulator in the world to work for’. We have attached both letters to this email so you get to see what we have done on the basis of your signatures. We will keep you updated when we hear back again from Ofgem.

PCS member, but not signed yet? If you are one of our members but haven’t signed yet, don’t worry, you can still do so here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdocs.google.com%2Fforms%2Fd%2Fe%2F1FAIpQLSdmkoixSK0WUk2pQRsuzZJIggC3dL8Xj-LyCN9Twt9tstxPtQ%2Fviewform%3Fusp%3Dsf_link&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cf7dbcfa8f5664d177af108d8ed5d3774%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637520334174404732%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=dhs8J7edrSRm%2FKC%2FdIXB4gPV%2Bt5YV234T9bvUJWipjg%3D&reserved=0> . We are still adding your signatures to the petition to keep the pressure on Ofgem. And get your colleagues to sign too!

Signed the petition, but not yet a member? Great that you have signed our petition! We have some information on the Wire <http://ofgemintranet/SpecialismsAndGroups/Groups/Unions/Pages/PCS.aspx>  about who we are and what we do, and you can also always email Frank Hemmes with any questions. Ofgem cancels gym subsidy with no consultation

Ofgem have announced today that they are stopping the gym subsidy arrangements that many staff enjoyed. This decision has been taken outwith the ongoing review of pay and benefits and without any consultation with the Union. We’ve already had a number of staff getting in touch about this, and we will raise this issue with HR. We’d also recommend that staff who are affected by the announcement message HR directly about this decision, copying in Stephanie Broadribb, Interim Director for Corporate Services.

Victory for Shrewsbury 24 as Court of Appeal clears convictions
The Court of Appeal has overturned the convictions of 14 men sentenced for their involvement in pickets in 1972.

In June 1972, trade unionists called the UK's first-ever national builders' strike in protest against pay, unjust employment practices and dangerous conditions on sites. Trade unionists who picketed during the national builders' strike were then charged with offences including unlawful assembly and conspiracy to intimidate. Lawyers for the so-called Shrewsbury 24 had argued the destruction of witness statements made their convictions unsafe. Read more about this monumental success story here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3De9033129b4%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C6874489a57d548f984e708d8efb11ff1%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637522891327675921%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=QOSuvGscgLzorvaV1wkVBN3LRkfCxZgLFy5%2FbCUPA9I%3D&reserved=0> .
PCS statement on the policing bill

The right to free speech and peaceful protest is the lifeblood of a healthy democracy. Yet, a government which says it stands for freedom and democracy proposes giving the police and the home secretary unprecedented powers to criminalise people standing up for social justice. The police, crime, sentencing and courts bill, if it becomes law, will give senior police officers and politicians major new powers to restrict the democratic right to protest and to curtail freedom of expression. It will give members of PCS and other trade unions cause for concern. Read the full statement here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dba3f1905da%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C6874489a57d548f984e708d8efb11ff1%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637522891327685919%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=cKo4ypXBuuvWwKUL4xQmIAzfEzZaD6ygS0TL%2BfRHxIM%3D&reserved=0> .
Successful PCS campaign saves Art Library jobs

After a successful campaign by PCS, including an Early Day Motion and petition which reached over 10,000 signatures, the Victoria and Albert Museum has confirmed that the 20 staff at the National Art Library, within the museum, are no longer at risk of imminent redundancy. This is a great success and more on this can found here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D24e52bb22c%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C6874489a57d548f984e708d8efb11ff1%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637522891327685919%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=R%2Bo31xs%2BC2%2BUCQoykFZrOVorq5jpI0neCiSE963DHXY%3D&reserved=0> .

column1: Branch News
Results of PCS survey on Ofgem’s working from home plans

Shortly after Ofgem's announcement that working from home become the 'new normal', PCS ran a survey open to everyone to get feedback on Ofgem's plans. We received 213 responses from both members and non-members. We think this demonstrates the strong desire of staff to give input on the plans, which also come through in the finding that only 28% of respondents thought Ofgem consulted adequately before making the decision.

We have shared detailed results with Ofgem, but we believe everyone is entitled to get the main findings. Unfortunately our slot on Future of Work Show & Tell last week was cancelled, so instead we're sharing our findings here.

Please see the full article here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D2b16b1fb0c%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cd8d26c2950534f3374dc08d8f5198849%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637528837314435840%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=4DhDbdG9wPQfUMJzYryLKg1NOWQoIXlnOSHxF%2BiIzAM%3D&reserved=0> .
Help former member Merlijn: donate to the Riders Roovolt strike fund

Deliveroo’s imminent stock market flotation stands to make its CEO £500 million overnight. But the riders doing the real work earn less than the minimum wage, are at the whim of Deliveroo’s algorithm, and don’t get sick pay. Deliveroo’s working conditions have been well documented in this excellent piece <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D2f02d86224%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cd8d26c2950534f3374dc08d8f5198849%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637528837314435840%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=%2FYSzUZjyJJy6%2FVuQwx6Nix43uXRfcStCWf94upsTWXo%3D&reserved=0>  by the Bureau for Investigative Journalism.

Former member Merlijn Kersten who left Ofgem and now works for Deliveroo is asking for our help to bolster the strike hardship fund for the IWGB’s ‘Riders Roovolt’ campaign. Donating to the strike fund means riders can stand up for their rights and demand better working conditions and pay.

Many of us have likely used Deliveroo while stuck at home, so why not make a donation next time you think of ordering takeaway? We are again collecting as a branch, to show what we an achieve collectively. You can make your donation here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D88e5a3a644%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cd8d26c2950534f3374dc08d8f5198849%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637528837314445837%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=LOZi4BKSSY%2BYh6nQWG7NRTcucOLsbACgOpALIMRtz3U%3D&reserved=0> . A note for Glasgow-based LGBT members!  Nominations need to be in by 6 April
We are invite delegate nominations for the PCS delegation to the 2021 STUC LGBT+ Workers’ Conference.

Due to ongoing coronavirus restrictions, the Conference be taking place as an online event for 2021, with the regular mixture of discussions, guest speakers and workshops which bring together LGBT+ workers from across Scotland to focus on improving LGBT+ equality. The 2021 STUC LGBT+ Workers Conference will be held across the weekend of Saturday 22nd and Sunday 23rd May, beginning on the Saturday morning and concluding by lunchtime on the Sunday. A delegation meeting will take place prior to the Conference to support delegates, with additional support available via PCS Scotland and Proud, PCS’ LGBT+ members group, throughout the duration of Conference for those successfully selected to attend. Nominations are open to all Scotland based LGBT+ members. If you wish to nominate, please email your name, membership number and a supporting statement (max 200 words) on why you would be interested in attending to scotland@pcs.org.uk <mailto:scotland@pcs.org.uk> , using subject ‘STUC LGBT+ Nomination’ for no later than noon on Tuesday 6th April. Successful candidates will then be notified thereafter. PCS recognises that attending the LGBT+ Workers Conference online may be difficult for some members, particularly those who may not be out in their home environment. If you are interested in attending but may require reasonable adjustments, please include this information with your nomination for us to consider and review.If you have any questions regarding this briefing, or any of PCS’ LGBT+ equality work, then you can contact PCS Scotland via the address above, or Proud at proud@pcs.org.uk <mailto:proud@pcs.org.uk> . All contact will be treated in strict confidence.
Campaigns & Events
Support fellow PCS members at the DVLA

PCS members at the Driver and Vehicle Licensing Agency’s Swansea office will be taking strike action from 6 to 9 April to force management to better protect workers from Covid. At the moment, workers are still required to come into the office, leading to 600 Covid cases on a staff of 6,000. The site was officially designated an outbreak zone in December after a spate of new infections.

Workers don’t get paid when on strike, so to help them avoid financial hardship while taking action, PCS members get paid from our strike fund. PCS has a general strike fund, but individual contributions can either be used to top up standard strike pay, or reduce the claim on the overall fund.

Secure the Workers’ Stories Project’s legacy

The Workers’ Stories Project is a Scottish project documenting the experiences of ordinary workers during the Covid-19 pandemic. With a year passed since the start of Lockdown 1, WSP is looking to give their collection of workers’ stories a permanent online home, as well as creating a touring exhibition. This will ensure that the perspectives of workers on the pandemic, and how they personally experienced it, will not be forgotten.

We would like to make the donation as a branch to show the power of collective action. Cheerio,
Frank

column2: Branch News

column1: Results of PCS survey on Ofgem’s working from home plans

Shortly after Ofgem's announcement that working from home become the 'new normal', PCS ran a survey open to everyone to get feedback on Ofgem's plans. We received 213 responses from both members and non-members. We think this demonstrates the strong desire of staff to give input on the plans, which also come through in the finding that only 28% of respondents thought Ofgem consulted adequately before making the decision.

We have shared detailed results with Ofgem, but we believe everyone is entitled to get the main findings. Unfortunately our slot on Future of Work Show & Tell last week was cancelled, so instead we're sharing our findings here.

Please see the full article here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D2b16b1fb0c%26e%3Dc73198a51c&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C21b08a01fe624e9589bf08d8f8d9cd59%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637532961668283138%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=bGpG48ZoQ68BvruCI2s%2BneuN2WMn%2BynjUcsqctMVse8%3D&reserved=0> .
Help former member Merlijn: donate to the Riders Roovolt strike fund

Deliveroo’s imminent stock market flotation stands to make its CEO £500 million overnight. But the riders doing the real work earn less than the minimum wage, are at the whim of Deliveroo’s algorithm, and don’t get sick pay. Deliveroo’s working conditions have been well documented in this excellent piece <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D2f02d86224%26e%3Dc73198a51c&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C21b08a01fe624e9589bf08d8f8d9cd59%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637532961668288120%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=IxauPtz3M5JeFGJTCZ2QhwVmj9P8pcLHSl0kOVg%2BSXI%3D&reserved=0>  by the Bureau for Investigative Journalism.

Former member Merlijn Kersten who left Ofgem and now works for Deliveroo is asking for our help to bolster the strike hardship fund for the IWGB’s ‘Riders Roovolt’ campaign. Donating to the strike fund means riders can stand up for their rights and demand better working conditions and pay.

Many of us have likely used Deliveroo while stuck at home, so why not make a donation next time you think of ordering takeaway? We are again collecting as a branch, to show what we an achieve collectively. You can make your donation here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D88e5a3a644%26e%3Dc73198a51c&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C21b08a01fe624e9589bf08d8f8d9cd59%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637532961668298105%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=jaL%2FnCJGGuBDRe6G0YrvLxYtw2TFcM%2FqxBvVzq%2BRTxk%3D&reserved=0> . If you prefer to donate directly though, you can do that here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Df8cf1d7908%26e%3Dc73198a51c&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C21b08a01fe624e9589bf08d8f8d9cd59%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637532961668303096%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=WtCPRhuT3xAGxjADnyKsefpAxu6Mv%2F66IDR9zM3y358%3D&reserved=0> .
A note for Glasgow-based LGBT members!  Nominations need to be in by 6 April
We are invite delegate nominations for the PCS delegation to the 2021 STUC LGBT+ Workers’ Conference.

Due to ongoing coronavirus restrictions, the Conference be taking place as an online event for 2021, with the regular mixture of discussions, guest speakers and workshops which bring together LGBT+ workers from across Scotland to focus on improving LGBT+ equality. The 2021 STUC LGBT+ Workers Conference will be held across the weekend of Saturday 22nd and Sunday 23rd May, beginning on the Saturday morning and concluding by lunchtime on the Sunday. A delegation meeting will take place prior to the Conference to support delegates, with additional support available via PCS Scotland and Proud, PCS’ LGBT+ members group, throughout the duration of Conference for those successfully selected to attend. Nominations are open to all Scotland based LGBT+ members. If you wish to nominate, please email your name, membership number and a supporting statement (max 200 words) on why you would be interested in attending to scotland@pcs.org.uk <mailto:scotland@pcs.org.uk> , using subject ‘STUC LGBT+ Nomination’ for no later than noon on Tuesday 6th April. Successful candidates will then be notified thereafter. PCS recognises that attending the LGBT+ Workers Conference online may be difficult for some members, particularly those who may not be out in their home environment. If you are interested in attending but may require reasonable adjustments, please include this information with your nomination for us to consider and review.If you have any questions regarding this briefing, or any of PCS’ LGBT+ equality work, then you can contact PCS Scotland via the address above, or Proud at proud@pcs.org.uk <mailto:proud@pcs.org.uk> . All contact will be treated in strict confidence.

column2: Campaigns & Events

column1: Support fellow PCS members at the DVLA

PCS members at the Driver and Vehicle Licensing Agency’s Swansea office will be taking strike action from 6 to 9 April to force management to better protect workers from Covid. At the moment, workers are still required to come into the office, leading to 600 Covid cases on a staff of 6,000. The site was officially designated an outbreak zone in December after a spate of new infections.

Workers don’t get paid when on strike, so to help them avoid financial hardship while taking action, PCS members get paid from our strike fund. PCS has a general strike fund, but individual contributions can either be used to top up standard strike pay, or reduce the claim on the overall fund.

We are again doing a branch-wide collection, and you can make a donation here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D6de3e4c561%26e%3Dc73198a51c&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C21b08a01fe624e9589bf08d8f8d9cd59%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637532961668308086%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=%2BJ8FccxvuwqTT3%2FxjfJjCT2klHwygXn0xe6J9BspxkI%3D&reserved=0> . Secure the Workers’ Stories Project’s legacy

The Workers’ Stories Project is a Scottish project documenting the experiences of ordinary workers during the Covid-19 pandemic. With a year passed since the start of Lockdown 1, WSP is looking to give their collection of workers’ stories a permanent online home, as well as creating a touring exhibition. This will ensure that the perspectives of workers on the pandemic, and how they personally experienced it, will not be forgotten.

We would like to make the donation as a branch to show the power of collective action. column1: Branch News
Glasgow gym subsidy decision under review
At the all staff call last week, it was announced the decision to scrap the gym subsidy for staff in Glasgow is now under review. A minded to decision is expected by 19 April.

We wrote an article on the Wire detailing how disappointed members and staff who enjoy the subsidised gym membership were at the sudden decision. We also see this episode as an opportunity for Ofgem to engage in meaningful consultation with PCS and staff moving forward. This is supported by 96% of the 82 respondents to our survey on discounted gym memberships who felt Ofgem should have fully consulted on this change.

The Wire article can be found here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dbeb521f55f%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C42994bb3c87c4f6fa3e208d8fa8fea12%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637534843318638421%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=z7FBty%2BFK4hCOlTaqrWluUQBPGomYWNz76zJKEZPU0U%3D&reserved=0> .
PCS Ofgem submits 4 day week motion to conference

Isn’t it great to have these four day weeks? What if every week was like this? Hopefully one day we will get there, and we are doing our bit to make it happen. At our Annual General Meeting we decided to submit a motion to the PCS annual conference that would affiliate the whole union to the 4 Day Week Campaign <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D0ee07ec24b%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C42994bb3c87c4f6fa3e208d8fa8fea12%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637534843318638421%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=icfM5OCT14c9yRD8SAgMaYUgiNtqw67nSijc2AQ9LuQ%3D&reserved=0> . Now we just have to wait to hear back if the Standing Orders Committee will put it on the agenda. So watch this space!
WFH Survey results are out

As Ofgem wasn’t willing to survey staff again about our preferences for continued WFH even post-pandemic, we decided to do it ourselves. Unfortunately our spot at an all staff call fell through at the last minute, but instead we have put our headline results on the Wire (here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D21fd4cb35a%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C42994bb3c87c4f6fa3e208d8fa8fea12%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637534843318643410%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=X7B03qV2BtUO38I35ntVZhD7T%2F%2BqX8slUFnlNFaIwDU%3D&reserved=0> ). Generally staff are positive, want maximum flexibility, but Ofgem must also guarantee the right for people to work from the office if for whatever reason they’re not keen or able to WFH. We have shared the detailed results with Ofgem, and expect these to inform the concrete arrangements that will eventually be put in place to manage the new working practices.

Help former member Merlijn: donate to the Riders Roovolt strike fund

Deliveroo have suffered a shaky start to their stock market debut. Shares plummeted after investor concerns over worker rights. This led to Goldman Sachs buying £75m in Deliveroo shares to prop up the IPO price. Deliveroo’s working conditions have been well documented in this excellent piece <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D278f8d792d%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C42994bb3c87c4f6fa3e208d8fa8fea12%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637534843318648398%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=MIKfsoiL3I1ba428Q1cj41cqSvLVZAIsTixKM%2BHWuiE%3D&reserved=0>  by the Bureau for Investigative Journalism.

Former member Merlijn Kersten now works for Deliveroo and asked for our to bolster the strike hardship fund for the IWGB’s ‘Riders Roovolt’ campaign. We are collecting as a branch, to show what we can achieve collectively. You can make your donation here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D9b880f60d8%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C42994bb3c87c4f6fa3e208d8fa8fea12%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637534843318653391%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=6XGiAWPNNsKDGRzMWr3UhfODZwtGVXCnTbg31zS7wc4%3D&reserved=0> . If you prefer to donate directly though, you can do that here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D36eef63695%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C42994bb3c87c4f6fa3e208d8fa8fea12%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637534843318658386%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=KJQVqg%2BigwesyehzjXwc39F6FKNbuelcD9aW4FnPsnw%3D&reserved=0> .
Support fellow PCS members at the DVLA

PCS members are over half way through their strike at the DVLA in Swansea. By all accounts, the strike is going well. DVLA has the highest number of cases of any UK workplace and is a risk to the community. You can watch the brilliant PCS rep Sarah Evans talk about the strike here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D1305e4dacf%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C42994bb3c87c4f6fa3e208d8fa8fea12%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637534843318663375%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=EzV2ffZBOMquX6aBIINgcSYLINcRkRubTIvKzvWLCI0%3D&reserved=0> .

Secure the Workers’ Stories Project’s legacy

During the course of the pandemic, essential workers have kept our society going. They have cared for us, put food on our tables and ensured our communities can get through this together. The Scottish Workers’ Stories Project is all about honouring and giving voice to these heroes.

We would like to make the donation as a branch to show the power of collective action. Update from the Branch Exec Committee (BEC): The transformation programme

This week, we met with Ross McNaughton and the transformation programme team. Per the recent gym debacle, we made it clear that we want to ensure members are consulted on the benefits package review and HR policies review that the transformation programme are undertaking. But what does that actually mean?

We discussed an approach to policy reviews. Imagine a chart with importance on one axis and level of change on the other axis. Any changes the transformation team propose will fit in one of the four quadrants, necessitating different levels of engagement with PCS. We’ve asked for a full categorisation of all policies for review and agreement of clear processes for consultations.

The transformation team have informed us that they are prioritising review of the flexible working policy, bullying and harassment policy, and the change pool policy. We expect to see detail coming through on these, and will keep members abreast.

We’ve also published our monthly update on The Wire. <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Db441dcd71f%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C59f50a7e491c47a1eb7208d9002307bb%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637540972727822081%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=JkL8CfejqLw1jmRxWRy4Tv6PlFZd%2BijObjxlbFo2Y14%3D&reserved=0>  Please encourage your colleagues who are not members of the Union to have a read and learn about the things we have achieved over the last month.
