Petition to end race discrimination in the culture sector and reinstate sacked activist Amanda Walker

The PCS union Culture Group is demanding that the culture sector eliminate all forms of racial discrimination and for Historical Royal Palaces to reinstate our Equality rep, Amanda Walker. In 2017, Amanda made history by becoming the first Black female Warden at the Tower of London.

As a PCS union rep in her branch at Historic Royal Palaces, Amanda was deeply involved in the fight to end discrimination and bullying at her workplace Hampton Court Palace. Through her activism she directly challenged patterns of systemic discrimination and favouritism within the palaces which was exposed in the Guardian in March 2021 <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D8a269d9a44%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C59f50a7e491c47a1eb7208d9002307bb%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637540972727842058%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=zZOi6xrqiwJSvXpp%2BiGpXb63njb1%2FENKM9dN9abAIZA%3D&reserved=0> . Amazon Waged a Brutal Anti-Union Campaign. Unsurprisingly, They Won

There was hard news from Alabama last week, after attempts to unionise Amazon workers failed. Ahead of the ballot, tactics used by management included texting workers  several times a day to urge them to vote no, papering the facility’s bathroom stalls with anti-union flyers, and getting temp staff, ineligible to join the union to wear “vote no” swag. Made in Bangladesh Film Screening and Q&A

If you wear clothes you may be interested to learn the workers making your clothes are not necessarily safe at work. On the 8th anniversary of the Rana Plaza disaster No Sweat are hosting a screening of “Made In Bangladesh” with a Q&A with the director on the 25th April. (tickets and further info here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dc3b3dd6cbe%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C59f50a7e491c47a1eb7208d9002307bb%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637540972727857017%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=rcBa9witQiAI%2FEAGCwE74fw7PglJ%2FCCkCwTKe9iUsOw%3D&reserved=0> ).

The film is a timely portrayal of a garment worker in Bangladesh fighting for justice. Based on the life of Daliya Akter, a garment worker who escaped child marriage and went on to lead a trade union fighting for workers' rights in the capital Dhaka, this film shows garment workers not as passive victims of the sweatshop system but active participants in the fight for better working conditions and better lives.

International Workers Memorial Day - Scottish Trade Union Congress event,"Dear members,

28 April marks International Workers Memorial Day,  the day the international trade union movement joins together to remember those who have lost their lives because of their work. Think for example of workers killed in unsafe garment factories <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fen.wikipedia.org%2Fwiki%2F2013_Dhaka_garment_factory_collapse&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C7e1dd46ee5904b3fb15508d90582a15c%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637546880881047362%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=HsGkzCcyOk8U11YfFM3AnFMgUk9oHHjQjKIbcLJCMDI%3D&reserved=0> , or as a result of exposure to toxic chemicals <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Frealkochfacts.com%2Fsnowzilla-reading-the-devastating-story-of-how-the-kochs-business-practices-hurt-real-people%2F&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C7e1dd46ee5904b3fb15508d90582a15c%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637546880881047362%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=CZASrqzIOQHkr8zsMqpyxUO28YrsuUq68r52WJunZNY%3D&reserved=0> . IWMD also offers a time to renew our focus to protect workers from the harms they face because of their work. That is the reason this year’s theme is “Health and Safety is a human right - let’s make it a reality.”

Like last year, this year's memorial will take place during the Covid pandemic which has disproportionately impacted those in precarious work such as taxi drivers, carers and cleaners. There will be a minutes silence on 28 April at 12:00 noon and we hope you can join in.

There are also events put on by trade unions across the UK. For colleagues in Scotland, there is an Scottish Trade Union Congress (STUC) event from 11:00 to 12:00. It features STUC General Secretary Rozanne Foyer, speakers from other unions and experts and campaigners on health & safety. For more information and to register, see here: https://www.eventbrite.co.uk/e/stuc-international-workers-memorial-day-commemoration-tickets-151068125831 <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.eventbrite.co.uk%2Fe%2Fstuc-international-workers-memorial-day-commemoration-tickets-151068125831&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C7e1dd46ee5904b3fb15508d90582a15c%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637546880881057357%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=CTMX7gLtuF19qYluLLZ2wP3gAjhEtKNytnPwBbb2t5M%3D&reserved=0>
Cheerio,
Frank

Branch News
Office Risk Assessments

Health and Safety is the theme of the week it seems. We were last provided with the office risk assessments for review in September 2020. Our Health and Safety representative has been querying how up to date and robust the office risk assessments are, given that a single document has been drafted to cover all three office sites. Knowing the considerable differences in sites and their management, this continues to be a concern for us. We welcome your thoughts and any experiences you might be able to share from working in the office during lockdown.
Come to conference!

There is still time to register for the PCS National conference! This is a brilliant learning opportunity for aspiring activists and a great place to pick up ideas for things we might be able to push for at branch level. Email Laura Hutton to add your name!

Statement on the government’s Commission on Race and Ethnic Disparities report
PCS rejects the report of the Commission on Racial and Ethnic Disparities.

PCS General Secretary, Mark Serwotka, has signed the TUC’s letter <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D26a4a6bbac%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C961b74be6b8f4f89e03c08d9059eb5d6%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637547003699189179%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=OnU3GRRkE8qV%2F%2B56eMBOFAHqCP4YXb4Q9sSk8lE8BaM%3D&reserved=0>  to prime minister Boris Johnson on behalf of PCS and fully endorses the criticisms it contains that the commission has not recognised the institutional and structural racism that exists in the UK, in both the labour market and wider society. You can read more about PCS’ response here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D30cf881aee%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C961b74be6b8f4f89e03c08d9059eb5d6%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637547003699189179%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=GzbPymyDsqLF0IMkLxjj4wtm3xg3BGwARnIABSxFYrs%3D&reserved=0>  and read the report here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D93c8a84f29%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C961b74be6b8f4f89e03c08d9059eb5d6%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637547003699199174%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=k3Re406bnzeW3VEwRwYV0uJMjIbt3zYc0n3xOvtVxlc%3D&reserved=0> .
PCS members to take further strike action at the DVLA over health and safety.
PCS has today notified the DVLA of its intention to take a further four days of strike action from 4 to 7 May.

This latest period of strike action follows the successful walkout during 6-9 April <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3De1cc07469c%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C961b74be6b8f4f89e03c08d9059eb5d6%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637547003699199174%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=Wa%2BPtIWt43Uh9PTVFDs8%2B97wCiZ0Ai3uKBJyFdwOCXg%3D&reserved=0> , where over 1,400 PCS members took strike action over health and safety concerns at the DVLA sites. Over 2000 staff are being made to attend the site daily. PCS will again be asking all staff who are being made to go into work to take the action. This is in a bid to get the DVLA senior leadership to take health and safety concerns seriously and reduce numbers on site.

International Worker's Memorial Day 2021
Wednesday 28th April 2021
11am-12noon
Below is a link to the Eventbrite invitation to this year’s Scotland-wide International Workers Memorial Day online event. The event is jointly organised by the STUC and Scottish Hazards.

Our theme for this year’s IWDM is: Health and Safety is a human right - let’s make it a reality. With speakers from trade unions and the wider health and safety community. Every year more people are killed at work than in wars. Most don't die of mystery ailments, or in tragic ""accidents""; they die because an employer decided their safety just wasn't that important a priority. International Workers’ Memorial Day (IWMD) commemorates those workers.

Sign up here to join the STUC International Workers Memorial Day Commemoration <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D2ed3883411%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C961b74be6b8f4f89e03c08d9059eb5d6%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637547003699209168%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=39NjP48slbHd9HOF%2FGySRO0V2hQf6guxuaBaf8Px%2F50%3D&reserved=0>
Made in Bangladesh Film Screening and Q&A: This Sunday

If you wear clothes you may be interested to learn the workers making your clothes are not necessarily safe at work. On the 8th anniversary of the Rana Plaza disaster No Sweat are hosting a screening of “Made In Bangladesh” with a Q&A with the director on the 25th April. (tickets and further info here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Da7548b5eec%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C961b74be6b8f4f89e03c08d9059eb5d6%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637547003699209168%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=lyrbamBjuxAfcGu1%2F%2F0JBm8WKAZBjEjp9BqZzO6osdI%3D&reserved=0> ).

The film is a timely portrayal of a garment worker in Bangladesh fighting for justice. Based on the life of Daliya Akter, a garment worker who escaped child marriage and went on to lead a trade union fighting for workers' rights in the capital Dhaka, this film shows garment workers not as passive victims of the sweatshop system but active participants in the fight for better working conditions and better lives.

column1: Branch News
Covid support network

We got a bit bored of waiting for Ofgem to sort this out, so Patrick and Cheral have now decided to move forward with the Covid support network ourselves. The network is for people personally impacted by Covid, either because they contracted it themselves, or their direct friends or family did. The first gathering is on Thursday 13 May 11:30 – 12:30. If you want to come along, contact Patrick or Cheral.
COVID Vaccine Sick leave

For all colleagues and managers, if you/your team member experience vaccine side-effects this should be logged as COVID related leave in My HR, if you have any questions about this feel free to contact pcs@ofgem.gov.uk <mailto:pcs@ofgem.gov.uk>  or your union rep.
Health & Safety

We are engaging with Ofgem Estates on the risk assessments for the offices, as we are nearing a possible return. We want Ofgem to produce tailored risk assessments for each office, especially in light of the differences in ventilation. We also plan to make contact with the PCS branch at the Health & Safety Executive, who we’re likely to share part of the floor in 10SC with.
Reminder: Come to conference!

There is still time to register for the PCS National conference! This is a brilliant learning opportunity for aspiring activists and a great place to pick up ideas for things we might be able to push for at branch level. Email Laura Hutton to add your name or read here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D812942b432%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C340bf0617dd14d8f35fb08d90afec9d5%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637552911712062215%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=5IbAvr2LJ%2FJNCGl9QfhdDxrETkzF01aOOxM5SWXTkQ0%3D&reserved=0>  for further information.
Workers' Stories workshop - A reflection

The Worker’s Stories Project is a great Scotland-based project aiming to document how workers experienced COVID-19. Equalities Officer Cheral poignantly recounts her experience of a Worker’s Stories Project photography workshop in this wire article <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dd6187e8bb3%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C340bf0617dd14d8f35fb08d90afec9d5%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637552911712072215%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=AVLgM6DvwaCbRXGmLPfNv%2FY2R66tPfrMoTic7KXOlGI%3D&reserved=0> . Do let her know if you like any of the photographs and feel free to tweet any of your own to us @PCS_Ofgem ??.
Campaigns & News
39 Convicted Post Office workers have names cleared

Judges have quashed the convictions of 39 former postmasters after the UK's most widespread miscarriage of justice. They were convicted of stealing money, with some imprisoned, after the Post Office installed the Horizon computer system in branches which was found to be a flawed system. Campaigners including trade unionists fought a long and hard series of legal battles for compensation in the civil courts and you can read on about this here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dca7990c598%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C340bf0617dd14d8f35fb08d90afec9d5%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637552911712072215%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=VSskIDI2JFo7mBe6b2CO2RZ8pdDToum7Uu9ZNgSOiaA%3D&reserved=0> .
Have your say in your union

PCS is a democratic, lay-led union. As a member you can decide who represents you, who leads the union and what policies it adopts. You can influence PCS itself by taking part in nominating members who want to stand in elections, and then voting at all levels – from branch and group committees to national structures. Read more about the National and Group executive committee’s elections here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D7eb43a77c1%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C340bf0617dd14d8f35fb08d90afec9d5%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637552911712082204%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=c9MHVJT2DG5TmqaQUJn6oTW5MGVDNIhIssse%2BNa7zO8%3D&reserved=0> .
Events
PCS Black members to discuss Sewell Report

PCS has rejected the findings of the commission in which we believe evidence for institutional and structural racism has been ignored. On Thursday 6 May 12pm - 1.15pm, there will be a PCS Black members’ meeting organised by the PCS national black members committee (NBMC) to discuss the Sewell Report (please see the PCS statement) issued on 31 March. For more information read here. <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dd43b67f0e0%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C340bf0617dd14d8f35fb08d90afec9d5%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637552911712082204%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=ONzEoExw2vp5duh7jrWoBeADkoKE9Q07vsr96l3e30g%3D&reserved=0>  If you are a PCS black member and would like to attend, please register on the Eventbrite page <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D8b963c51e2%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C340bf0617dd14d8f35fb08d90afec9d5%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637552911712092199%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=iSyBwDnDi0ZRxecTo4X1MP3utrjN5hRwSF5Hq8M4ueQ%3D&reserved=0> .
Jobs, Rights, Climate - Rebuilding stronger and fairer

Tonight at 7pm on Facebook live there is a free event with Ed Miliband MP, Labour’s business secretary, in conversation with Unite Union’s Steve Turner, about how we step up to meet the climate change challenge, and deliver decent jobs for our communities. You can watch live or catch up later from this page <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D31b394961f%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C340bf0617dd14d8f35fb08d90afec9d5%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637552911712092199%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=F0h1cci8WcjS%2B0iLa21Oz%2B3FT%2BtH%2BkKxSpDpQrYtwrM%3D&reserved=0> .

column1: Branch News
Bye bye Wire, hello censorship
<https://mcusercontent.com/5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd/images/7000ab43-22fc-6598-871a-a74ce5a4d13c.jpg>

Was it something we said? We’re not sure, but as of yesterday Ofgem has decreed that we are no longer to use the Wire for dastardly deeds of propaganda such as, ehm, celebrating May Day or campaigning for a Real Living Wage. After enquiring why our latest Wire articles had mysteriously vanished, we were told that “in line with other government departments”, our Wire days are now over. Even our back catalogue of articles isn’t safe, and is soon to be purged. Clearly we’re not happy about this and we’ll be making our displeasure known to Ofgem. But in the meantime, we will have to think about alternative means of communication. Not just with you, but also with colleagues who aren’t yet members. We’ve put a little survey together to see what you think might work, so it’d be great if you could click below to complete it:

Tell us how you'd like to hear from us! <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D87a064bc7c%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cf9de640a39df4e15bb4208d9108b3293%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637559012312433018%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=%2BQmWcr7WvU%2Be4ZMVcVVdcZUuHoY5EA61burvOBrmvsU%3D&reserved=0>
In the meantime, we have included the April update we had planned to publish below, for your perusal:

We hope you all enjoyed your May Bank Holiday, don’t forget this was brought to you by the labour movement. To see what other things collective action can bring you, have a look at our download for April below:

column2: Transformation Programme: Through our regular meetings with Ofgem, we now engage directly with the Transformation Programme. We will soon be provided with a matrix of priority outputs as part of the TP, and we expect to get early sight of the findings of the McKinsey review that will be shared with staff this month.

IWMD: On 28 April we held a minute’s silence as part of International Workers Memorial Day, to commemorate all those who lost their lives at work due to unsafe working conditions. Read Patrick’s, our H&S rep, speech here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dd96ef957af%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cf9de640a39df4e15bb4208d9108b3293%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637559012312433018%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=CxGmGEMRZMMprjrmQgc7Mx7oB6ingbkbV9yrJjUTtTE%3D&reserved=0> .

Living Wage: We are now waiting to find out what can be done within the Treasury Remit for this year. Regardless, our petition <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D59c26fac8b%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cf9de640a39df4e15bb4208d9108b3293%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637559012312443011%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=h6KmuhV5GPXoaCx3Ko1O41TV9H8kpG1vbdvHYflxFQk%3D&reserved=0>  remains live while this campaign continues.
Gym subsidy: We actually didn’t get round to publishing the results of our gym subsidy survey in April. We had put it online and planned to link to it here, but hey, censors gotta censor.

DVLA Strike Fund: We contributed £115 to the strike fund of our members in the Drivers and Vehicle Licensing Agency, who are taking action to make their workplace Covid-safe. The DVLA office in Swansea has seen 600 Covid infections, making it one of the worst impacted workplaces in the country.

column1: Reminder: Covid support network

We got bored of waiting for Ofgem to sort this out, so Patrick and Cheral have now decided to move forward with the Covid support network. The network is for people personally impacted by Covid, either because they contracted it themselves, or their direct friends or family did. The first gathering is on Thursday 13 May 11:30 – 12:30. If you want to come along, contact Patrick or Cheral.
Campaigns & News
Treasury trying to steal pension improvements and reduced contributions

Many PCS members will be angry about the possibility that reduced pension contributions of at least 2% and improved benefits could be snatched away at the same time that many of them face a further pay freeze, also imposed by this government. There has been unjustifiable government interference in the pension valuation and cost cap processes in recent years. PCS will be urging members to support our campaign against these outrageous acts in the months ahead read further here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D0b0f7ccccf%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cf9de640a39df4e15bb4208d9108b3293%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637559012312443011%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=26DFAjYMJIWJAX7BuMXmYAP6%2F1mSJF30cKQD%2BAATJHY%3D&reserved=0> .
NEC support for DVLA branch on strike

Over 3,400 PCS members in the Driver and Vehicle Licensing Agency (DVLA) are in dispute over health and safety concerns after being forced to work on site during the pandemic. DVLA sites in Swansea have recorded more than 600 Covid cases and a fatality, the largest outbreak of Covid in any UK workplace, with the contact centre being declared an outbreak site by Public Health Wales last December. Last week the National Executive Committee (NEC) met and agreed to give full support to the DVLA Branch taking strike action this week. A donation to the hardship fund of £10,000 was agreed. Read on here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D7ea232d43b%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cf9de640a39df4e15bb4208d9108b3293%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637559012312453005%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=SmEADfbd82%2Fb5exMq0O1tOFrgJDUYQKgHlxy%2BwDzzzY%3D&reserved=0> .
Have your say in your union

PCS is a democratic, lay-led union. As a member you can decide who represents you, who leads the union and what policies it adopts. You can influence PCS itself by taking part in nominating members who want to stand in elections, and then voting at all levels – from branch and group committees to national structures. Read more about the National and Group executive committee’s elections here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D801e939ff3%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cf9de640a39df4e15bb4208d9108b3293%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637559012312453005%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=ovs8KgF4i07nZJxq2sQKXJbva7SjljATkhcREPWFO%2Bs%3D&reserved=0> .

column1: Mental Health Network event

Our friends in the Mental Health Network (did you know Cheral is a Mental Health Champion?) are excited to invite all colleagues to what promises to be a fascinating event on Friday the 14th May marking Mental Health Awareness Week covering topics that are so important to all of us in this exceptional time. Our response to Ofgem's decision to ban us from the Wire [OFFICIAL Internal Only],"Dear members,

I hope you are all enjoying today’s all staff call right now. I’ve just heard that Ofgem is keen to ‘have the conversation’ with staff. We as PCS are of course keen to be part of that conversation, which is why we have been surprised and disappointed at Ofgem’s decision to remove our access to the Wire, and delete some of our recent articles. We already mentioned this in last week’s newsletter, but today we have formally conveyed our concern over this decision to Ofgem, and asked for our Wire access to be reinstated. Our letter to Ofgem is attached.
Of course, this is not directed at our colleagues in Comms, and we appreciate the assistance they have given us over the years with getting our message out there for all of Ofgem’s staff.
If you have any questions, do get in touch.
Cheerio,
Frank
Branch organiser

#SpyCops inquiry - How police infiltrated the trade union movement,"Dear members,

We’re pleased to invite you to another PCS Movie Night! This time we will be looking at the ongoing #spycops inquiry, which is looking at police infiltration of left wing organisations, including trade unions. The inquiry has just finished it’s second phase, and more information can be found here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.ucpi.org.uk%2F&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C81919dd2283c4e176e1b08d9149c6c02%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637563484341591597%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=R0L8HuE7bx6fcEsezdaFoO%2FiqQCzN2TgPLMLhWu3mbw%3D&reserved=0> .
Programme for the evening:

column2: We will screen a short video with testimony from people personally impacted by police infiltration. We’re still deciding what a good video us, but as usual we will share the link on the day so you can watch it directly on your own device.
PCS’s very own Lois Austin, who works for the London & South East regional office as an organiser, will talk about her personal experience with the inquiry.
There will be opportunity for questions at the end.

column1: Branch News
Donation to IWGB’s Riders Roovolt strike fund

Following calls in previous newsletters to contribute to a strike fund for Deliveroo riders demanding better pay and working conditions, we are proud to have sent £110. Striking always has a financial cost and especially so for those in low pay, precarious work. This is another example of the collective power of us as a branch. See the tweet of the week above for how these contributions and shows of solidarity are greatly received.
We’re looking for a London-based Health and Safety Rep!

The pandemic has forced health and safety further up the agenda after decades of neglect. We are still looking for a London-based Health and Safety Rep. You would be working with a number of other motivated health and safety reps across PCS and Canary Wharf. If you would be interested in helping improve and protect the health and safety of your colleagues, please get in touch with Patrick Gould, our Glasgow-based Health and Safety Rep to find out more!
Eid Mubarak to Muslim colleagues
During these very difficult times, we wish a very Happy Eid to all colleagues celebrating. We hope you can enjoy some time with your loved ones safely.
Campaigns & News
PCS reacts to Queen’s speech

The Queen’s speech was heavy on rhetoric but thin on concrete proposals that can bring the government’s “levelling-up agenda” into being. The much anticipated Employment Bill was a glaring omission and with a 0% pay rise confirmed for civil servants, the failure to recognise the efforts and struggles of working people over the last year in particular is hard to swallow and will require action. You can read PCS statement on the Queen’s speech here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Da8cb601159%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C54b0959a624d4bc8f34e08d9161bee03%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637565131510462110%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=HF3iSkonUonR%2BDU3QB4Wf926NLhwRHv8bDdWCcp9X90%3D&reserved=0> .
PCS Ofgem solidarity with Sheikh Jarrah

We are saddened by the events in Sheikh Jarrah during this holy month and are showing solidarity to all victims of these tragedies. We oppose the continued occupation and daily breaches of human rights for refugee families who face eviction from their homes as stated by the UN human rights office. For further information on the recent events and their historical basis, see this article in The Conversation.

PCS Movie Night: #Spycops Inquiry

We’re pleased to invite you to another PCS Movie Night! This time we will be looking at the ongoing #spycops inquiry, which is looking at police infiltration of left-wing organisations, including trade unions. column1: Branch News
Weekly update from the Branch Exec Committee (BEC):

Health and Safety has been high on the agenda this week with the approaching return to offices. Our excellent Health and Safety rep, Patrick Gould, raised the point that the existing office risk assessments are not site specific, and following consultation with HSE, concluded that this does not meet the required measure of “suitable and sufficient”. We’ve raised this with Estates and asked that they update the risk assessments, and are pleased to report that Estates are going to do just that. Thanks, Patrick!
Reminder: We’re looking for a London-based Health and Safety Rep!

The pandemic has forced health and safety further up the agenda after decades of neglect. We are still looking for a London-based Health and Safety Rep. You would be working with a number of other motivated health and safety reps across PCS and Canary Wharf. If you would be interested in helping improve and protect the health and safety of your colleagues, please get in touch with Patrick Gould, our Glasgow-based Health and Safety Rep to find out more!

Over 3,400 PCS members in the Driver and Vehicle Licensing Agency (DVLA) are in dispute over health and safety concerns after being forced to work on site during the pandemic. DVLA sites in Swansea have recorded more than 600 Covid cases and a fatality, the largest outbreak of Covid in any UK workplace, with the contact centre being declared an outbreak site by Public Health Wales last December. Last week the National Executive Committee (NEC) met and agreed to give full support to the DVLA Branch taking strike action this week. A donation to the hardship fund of £10,000 was agreed. Read more here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D3666078174%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cb07ce236ff08469340a008d91ba7faae%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637571230548615711%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=YUDV0w0ePwQctdooFVey77p%2BOhqxfFwSh9rPK88MNLk%3D&reserved=0> .

Facebook Live event to commemorate the murder of George Floyd

The Facebook Live event organised by the PCS national black members’ committee (NBMC) will reflect on the recent court trial verdict, as well as looking at the rise of the global Black Lives Matter movement.  It is a public event and all are welcome. The event is on 26th May from 6.30pm to 7.30pm. Find out more here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D244a902b5e%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cb07ce236ff08469340a008d91ba7faae%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637571230548615711%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=BdJDjPzG8BjH4XrNXKScDj9UKXJTzQ1A%2B4Q%2FR4tMhMM%3D&reserved=0> .
TODAY: PCS Movie Night: #Spycops Inquiry

We’re pleased to invite you to another PCS Movie Night! This time we will be looking at the ongoing #spycops inquiry, which is looking at police infiltration of left-wing organisations, including trade unions. The inquiry has just finished its second phase, and more information can be found here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3De6335ff1b4%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cb07ce236ff08469340a008d91ba7faae%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637571230548625706%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=OMbrNJF6PTlRmIODw3osJRKFzu4j69%2BxaTLscBDKRjM%3D&reserved=0> .
Programme for the evening:

column2: We will screen a short video with testimony from people personally impacted by police infiltration. We’re still deciding what a good video to use, but as usual we will share the link on the day so you can watch it directly on your own device.
PCS’s very own Lois Austin, who works for the London & South East regional office as an organiser, will talk about her personal experience with the inquiry.
There will be opportunity for questions at the end.

PCS Canary Wharf - Payday event,"Dear members,

We are continuing our series of pay day rallies as part of our campaign for fair pay <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.pcs.org.uk%2Fcampaigns%2Fsupport-the-pcs-national-campaign%2Frestore-fair-and-equal-pay-for-all&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C0c427076ae6244c2006208d91c6df941%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637572081031652917%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=JpcrX7wtj6Xct7AadhBKtT64QhaIRcmZs5ppWAEXZyo%3D&reserved=0> , and against the public sector pay freeze. The next event, which is open to all branches with members in Canary Wharf, is on Friday 28 May, 12:00 to 13:00. We are very pleased to welcome PCS President Fran Heathcote, who will explain our current campaign strategy and specifically touch on the new sectoral pay claims that we have launched this year.
So come along to show your support for our pay campaign, and find out how sectoral bargaining will work.

Mandating meeting,"Dear members,

We’re now into June, the sun is shining, summer is starting and with the vaccine roll-out progressing, we may even be able to enjoy the great outdoors. Alas, Summer is also the season of the grand PCS Conferences, where delegates from all across the union get to set policy and strategy for the next year. Unfortunately for yours truly and Laura, who will be representing you this year, Conference will not take place in sunny Brighton, but instead be a virtual affair. So more Zoom for us.

Regardless of means and methods, when we speak and vote at Conference we have to make sure we represent your views. You are therefore invited to our mandating meeting. The purpose of this meeting is to discuss the motions proposed to conference, and instruct Laura and myself how to vote.
Intermezzo: How does Conference work?

Conference takes place each year. All branches can propose motions, though not all of them are selected from the agenda*. At conference, branches get a number of votes based on the number of members they have. Ofgem gets 1 vote.

There are two parts to conference, the National Conference, which is for all branches in PCS, and Group Conferences. Each PCS branch is in a Group. Usually this is done by department, e.g. all HMRC branches will be in the HMRC Group. For us it is a bit different. Ofgem is in the ‘Public Sector Group’, which is essentially the bucket with leftover branches that don’t fit anywhere else. We keep such auspicious company as the Church of England and Health & Safety Executive.
National Conference is on 13 and 14 June, and Frank will be representing us. Group Conference is on 10 June and Laura will represent us.
How does the Mandating Meeting work?

The number of motions on the agenda for both conferences is too large to discuss all of them. Therefore, the BEC has reviewed the agendas and has highlighted motions that we think warrant debate. We have also indicated how we intend to vote if we receive no other instructions from members. The agendas for the Group Conference and National Conference are attached. We have also attached our review of the National Conference agenda. Our review of the Group Conference agenda will follow shortly. The National Conference motions we recommend for debate are: A9, A10, A13, A16, A22, A23, A25, A26, A30, A31, A34, A38, A63, A64. However, you can ask for any motion to be discussed at the Mandating Meeting.

To help us organise the meeting ahead of time, please use this form <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdocs.google.com%2Fforms%2Fd%2Fe%2F1FAIpQLSdzzLb80s6qgoDQ71r9kgvrSA7qYUwTAn-dKowOzoDnPKoAfQ%2Fviewform%3Fusp%3Dsf_link&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cc1d75f61c634438a065e08d925d4adae%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637582417946973113%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=hlSlY48yCU6ZBuk40WHAt2bFAillphQ1gJLnt9Y3Vy4%3D&reserved=0>  to indicate which two motions for either conference you most want to discuss. We will then work through them at the mandating meeting in descending order.
If you cannot attend the meeting, please email any views to Frank Hemmes.
*NB: You will find that unfortunately, our motion to affiliate to the 4 Day Week Campaign was not included on this year’s conference agenda.
Cheerio,
Frank

Update on our Wire ban [OFFICIAL Internal Only],"Dear members,

You will remember that on 11 May we wrote to Ofgem expressing our concern and disappointment in their decision to remove our access to the Wire. Unfortunately, but not unexpectedly, Ofgem was not moved by our representations and have reiterated their arguments. Arguments which, in our view, have very little merit. We have responded to Ofgem’s latest, but do not expect to make much progress in getting them to change their mind at this time. Ofgem’s correspondence from both HR and Comms in relation to this issue is attached, our latest reply is included below.
“Good afternoon Rachel,

Thank you for the email in relation to PCS Union’s existing pages on the Wire.  We remain disappointed at Ofgem’s decision to remove our access to the Wire, in particular in light of the significant change programme that Ofgem is about to embark on, and PCS’s role in representing staff interests during this time. With regards to the limited rationale provided, we note that:

column2: Alignment with other parts of the Civil Service is not in and of itself a reason to change the previous arrangement, given that Ofgem clearly has discretion in this area. We therefore assume that there are other motivating reasons why alignment is, at this point in time, Ofgem’s preferred option.

While we acknowledge that the facilities agreement provides for the use of physical notice boards in the office, the facilities agreement predates the Pandemic and the Transformation project. With staff now continuing to work predominantly from home, these boards are clearly of reduced utility. We would argue that with most staff now interacting digitally, the Wire is a de facto staff notice board.

column1: Nonetheless, while we remain unconvinced of the reasoning, we note that senior decision makers in comms do not appear inclined to engage directly with us or to reconsider their position. In the interest of good and open communication and of the existing relationship between Ofgem and PCS Union we would appreciate it if key decision makers would attend a Joint Negotiating Committee to better set out their arguments and to engage in dialogue with us about a decision that clearly has a significant impact on the Union and our ability to function in Ofgem.
Kind Regards
Flo Silver”

This means that instead, we need to start thinking about other ways to communicate with you, but importantly, also with our non-member colleagues. So we want to know what you think would be effective alternatives to the Wire. You can help us by letting us know via this Google Form here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdocs.google.com%2Fforms%2Fd%2Fe%2F1FAIpQLSe3yjqSU8R1N184GrbV1ekPVwG98yP-JOkUAnGe6TMhgkzsFw%2Fviewform%3Fusp%3Dsf_link&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C3056af904327416c3f5908d925dff186%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637582466942095746%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=lDXJxBGZ8%2FgaiJWUTWMrIg2oiU0hOXF2mn%2BPAcUg%2F5k%3D&reserved=0> .

This doesn’t mean we won’t try to lift this censorship in the future, but for now we do not have a way to compel Ofgem to do this. However, if you wanted to help, we would encourage you to write to askjonathan@ofgem.gov.uk <mailto:askjonathan@ofgem.gov.uk>  and make your concerns known.
Cheerio,
Frank Hemmes

column1: Branch News
What’s on with Ofgem
The next Joint Negotiating Committee meeting (our monthly meet with Ofgem) is soon. We have put a lot on the agenda, including:

column2: Pay: We will set out our markers for the pay negotiation based on the Treasury Remit. This includes raising the issue of a Real Living Wage at Ofgem.
Return to the Office: We’ll seek an update on Ofgem’s plans and progress on the tech necessary to facilitate office working.
Comms: We’ve asked for Comms to explain their reasons for kicking us off the Wire.
Risk Assessments: We asked for an update on the office Risk Assessments by Friday 4 June. So we will either discuss them, or their absence, at the JNC.

column1: Reprioritisation of union work

You will have gathered from the newsletter and our other communications that there is a lot going on right now: pay negotiations, Transformation Programme, PCS Conference, censorship. The BEC is committed to dealing with all of this, but it has unfortunately meant that we have deprioritised some other work that had come out of our Annual General Meeting. So for the moment, we are pausing our work on:

column2: Consulting on our approach to new members seeking casework support.
Running a campaign on workload and work/life balance.

column1: If you have any concerns about this, do let us know. If you want to help us so we can do and achieve more, come and speak to Laura or Frank.
Campaigns & News
Ministers scupper DVLA deal

PCS members at DVLA thought they had reached a deal with management on enhanced Covid safety in what is one of the worst hit offices in the UK. Yet at the last minute, DVLA management reneged on their promises and took their deal off the table. Which means members at DVLA are back on strike. Workers on strike don't get paid, so we’ve set up another paypal pool <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D588d9d6f75%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C18cea25de3f94fe2fbb408d926a77e0e%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637583323522518543%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=ef9G%2BI0yWFw0z%2FWQ0Z%2BQpx8WRY%2FO4NKVwKNjuM%2FeCro%3D&reserved=0>  so you can contribute and support members who are striking. More information is available here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D247a2ca51c%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C18cea25de3f94fe2fbb408d926a77e0e%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637583323522528545%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=FtS0SzNLLQggflJr8lN7DCK3pnGhZ%2B%2F2cS%2FIImGqi6g%3D&reserved=0> .
Campaign for a four-day week - WHO report

This week, the World Health Organisation published analysis <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Db4aeb85543%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C18cea25de3f94fe2fbb408d926a77e0e%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637583323522528545%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=JZcYBoshwqyx%2Bs0j8xD4%2FcKjHiuueHNhUZ3uspWgy%2Bw%3D&reserved=0>  from across the globe revealing that long working hours lead to deaths from heart attacks and strokes – 745,000 in 2016, to be precise. This thought-provoking article <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Df7c293542f%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C18cea25de3f94fe2fbb408d926a77e0e%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637583323522538866%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=I9YoZXW6if6%2B5pEkOcaMhm7rQFX2lqp8Gv5LQMejnVA%3D&reserved=0>  considers this report further.
Events
Help us prepare for Conference

Conference season is now fast approaching with our ‘Group’ conference on the 10 June and the PCS main conference on the 13 and 14 of June. At both conferences we will vote on proposals for union policy and strategy. This isn’t a matter of personal preference of our delegates, but instead we represent you as the branch. So come along to our ‘mandating meeting’ on Monday 7 June to tell us how we should vote. Details on how this all works is in the invite you were sent this week.

Mandating meeting,"Update: BEC recommendations for both the National and Group conferences are now included (on separate tabs) of the attached spreadsheet.
Dear members,

We’re now into June, the sun is shining, summer is starting and with the vaccine roll-out progressing, we may even be able to enjoy the great outdoors. Alas, Summer is also the season of the grand PCS Conferences, where delegates from all across the union get to set policy and strategy for the next year. Unfortunately for yours truly and Laura, who will be representing you this year, Conference will not take place in sunny Brighton, but instead be a virtual affair. So more Zoom for us.

Regardless of means and methods, when we speak and vote at Conference we have to make sure we represent your views. You are therefore invited to our mandating meeting. The purpose of this meeting is to discuss the motions proposed to conference, and instruct Laura and myself how to vote.
Intermezzo: How does Conference work?

Conference takes place each year. All branches can propose motions, though not all of them are selected from the agenda*. At conference, branches get a number of votes based on the number of members they have. Ofgem gets 1 vote.

There are two parts to conference, the National Conference, which is for all branches in PCS, and Group Conferences. Each PCS branch is in a Group. Usually this is done by department, e.g. all HMRC branches will be in the HMRC Group. For us it is a bit different. Ofgem is in the ‘Public Sector Group’, which is essentially the bucket with leftover branches that don’t fit anywhere else. We keep such auspicious company as the Church of England and Health & Safety Executive.
National Conference is on 13 and 14 June, and Frank will be representing us. Group Conference is on 10 June and Laura will represent us.
How does the Mandating Meeting work?

The number of motions on the agenda for both conferences is too large to discuss all of them. Therefore, the BEC has reviewed the agendas and has highlighted motions that we think warrant debate. We have also indicated how we intend to vote if we receive no other instructions from members. The agendas for the Group Conference and National Conference are attached. We have also attached our review of the National Conference  and Group conference agendas to set out how we propose to vote, and which motions we recommend for debate. The National Conference motions we recommend for debate are: A9, A10, A13, A16, A22, A23, A25, A26, A30, A31, A34, A38, A63, A64. The Group Conference motions we recommend for debate are A12, A14, A15 and A19. However, you can ask for any motion to be discussed at the Mandating Meeting.

To help us organise the meeting ahead of time, please use this form <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fdocs.google.com%2Fforms%2Fd%2Fe%2F1FAIpQLSdzzLb80s6qgoDQ71r9kgvrSA7qYUwTAn-dKowOzoDnPKoAfQ%2Fviewform%3Fusp%3Dsf_link&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C7eddcfec86e44bbdd37808d926a82962%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637583326297565475%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=OGZgGvR1d%2FQnZpOaXHwEmlbdqMAkQ%2Fs8jo4SSu%2Bh6tU%3D&reserved=0>  to indicate which two motions for either conference you most want to discuss. We will then work through them at the mandating meeting in descending order.
If you cannot attend the meeting, please email any views to Frank Hemmes.
*NB: You will find that unfortunately, our motion to affiliate to the 4 Day Week Campaign was not included on this year’s conference agenda.
Cheerio,
Frank

PCS World Refugee Day event,"Good morning members,

June 20th is World Refugee Day. World Refugee Day is a UN designated international day <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.unhcr.org%2Fuk%2Fworld-refugee-day.html&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cee671f79d2434ce8183808d92b2691c0%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637588266965656002%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=sDZoynnT1mQ5cNnmdJq2uZ%2FpXkdQdbyUJ4MNDiHfOGA%3D&reserved=0>  to highlight the rights and needs, but also the dreams of refugees around the Globe. This year is the 20th time World Refugee Day will be marked, and 70 years since the signing of the UN Convention Relating to the Status of Refugees on June 20th 1951. According to the UNHCR, at the end of 2019 almost 80 million <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.unhcr.org%2Fuk%2Ffigures-at-a-glance.html&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cee671f79d2434ce8183808d92b2691c0%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637588266965665996%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=3yaB7TQIqW9H%2FphukxHIhq3Zh5C2BU2hSKCde6xK5NI%3D&reserved=0>  people were forcibly displaced from their homes. This includes international refugees but also internally displaced people.
PCS Ofgem will be marking World Refugee Day with an event on Monday 21 June (we don’t expect you to show up on a Sunday). The event features speakers from two organisations doing work with refugees:

column2: Safe Passage <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.safepassage.org.uk%2Fhow-we-work&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cee671f79d2434ce8183808d92b2691c0%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637588266965665996%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=FIIjiOT1LiGpbHUVPQN4eb5v3VPRGFa9OTie0oSwdW4%3D&reserved=0>  supports unaccompanied child refugees who arrive in Europe. Almost half of child refugees travel without an adult companion and so are at risk of being abused, trafficked, or left to navigate the complex and hostile asylum systems on their own. Safe Passage provides direct support to child refugees, and also campaigns for safer routes for refugees. Lowri from Safe Passage will speak about the work that they do, and its connection to the trade union movement.

The Central and West Integration Network <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.cwin.org.uk%2Fabout-us%2F&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cee671f79d2434ce8183808d92b2691c0%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637588266965665996%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=kkRBuetP2oHfuleCX6S28Oru6X%2FbBW11gSF9Lx8FhJo%3D&reserved=0>  is a charity in Glasgow and Central Scotland working to help refugees, asylum seekers and migrant workers to connect to local communities and help them gain full and equal access to resources and support. CWIN’s focus is strongly on grassroots organising with local communities to empower and connect people. Firdaus from CWIN will speak about CWIN’s work in Glasgow, and how maybe you can become part of it.

column1: Branch News
What’s on with Ofgem

column2: Ofgem have come back to us with their office risk assessments, which we're taking to our next Joint Negotiating Committee with Ofgem.

We've had a number of conversations this week about the treatment of working from abroad, including with HR. Our understanding is still the same as when we last asked about it (that there are tax/legal blockers that kick in after about 8 weeks, and some countries you just can't take your work stuff to) but it's implementation by HR should be consistent - the message has been communicated to HR, but we expect what they can do to allow it to be more limited. Keep us informed if you're having trouble.

Today (Thursday 10th) and Sunday are our Group and National conferences - Laura and Frank will be dialling in to vote on all manner of things. We'll keep you updated of the most exciting bits over Yammer <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Df518f59631%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cb3b1c550751a44053d5908d92c064c69%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637589228271765955%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=tQ1iW43nZLDmZFmIePrzwDDK4d5MsIxMPaYxvYyylUA%3D&reserved=0> .

Following on from last week’s article <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Df6fc17f50f%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cb3b1c550751a44053d5908d92c064c69%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637589228271775949%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=0vU6wtAo%2BcKT8weF36KDhUQL0rm9fNGKc8t%2BGeoV0pQ%3D&reserved=0>  by the World Health Organisation where it was found that across the globe working long hours leads to has detrimental health effects. If you would like to work a 4 day week (for full 5 day pay!) and would like to volunteer to make this happen get in touch with us by emailing pcs@ofgem.gov.uk!
DVLA action: Donate to Strike Fund

DVLA strike action over Covid safety continues this week (7-12 June) after ministers scuppered a deal last week that could have led to agreement. Disruption to DVLA customer service continues and whilst backlogs grow some members have been exercising the right to work to rule in refusing to take calls instead of their usual duties. Read more about the action and how to support here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dbe27e2dcef%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cb3b1c550751a44053d5908d92c064c69%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637589228271775949%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=tko4R3Dd2nFHPY3RCDWRLktmJFWV1wbGeKpvj8WYrv4%3D&reserved=0> . Are you an EU, EEA or Swiss national?

Following the UK’s exit from the European Union on 31 December 2020, we are approaching the end of the grace period (to 30 June 2021) by which EU national colleagues can apply for the EU Settlement Scheme (EUSS). If you or any of your family members are EU, EEA or Swiss citizens, and were resident in the UK by 31 December 2020, you need to apply to secure the right to continue to work, study, and access free healthcare and benefits in the UK after 30 June 2021. If you haven’t already applied, please do so now. Further information available here. <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D6f93b27659%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cb3b1c550751a44053d5908d92c064c69%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637589228271795941%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=CCgPf8u3PgA3G90emAtMfdSbbHTO68BGdFFlZLc2U70%3D&reserved=0>

World Refugee Day – 21st June Lunchtime event

June 20th is World Refugee Day. World Refugee Day is a UN designated international day <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D8bcd431ff9%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cb3b1c550751a44053d5908d92c064c69%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637589228271795941%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=wORsS9LrZNF11NbTLccGoHjUg2v9TT6lac41s2%2BQfoY%3D&reserved=0>  to highlight the rights and needs, but also the dreams of refugees around the Globe. PCS Ofgem will be marking World Refugee Day with an event on Monday 21 June with two great speakers from the following organisations:

column2: Safe Passage <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D7154ff81f5%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cb3b1c550751a44053d5908d92c064c69%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637589228271805934%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=xkn55RoBuAN7pYGMECq414mbijojtl2THCmhjVNSY6M%3D&reserved=0>  - provides direct support to child refugees, and also campaigns for safer routes for refugees. Lowri from Safe Passage will speak about the work that they do, and its connection to the trade union movement.

The Central and West Integration Network <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D653a698a74%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cb3b1c550751a44053d5908d92c064c69%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637589228271805934%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=tVyYFWy%2F2MrZCICPfMGwFPY1VGMF69%2F4j%2F28EtDMo4k%3D&reserved=0>  is a charity in Glasgow working to help refugees, asylum seekers and migrant workers to connect to local communities and help them gain full and equal access to resources and support. Firdaus from CWIN will speak about their work in Glasgow, and how maybe you can become part of it.

column1: To support the efforts of both charities, we will be collecting via a money pool available here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D4c21131f0c%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cb3b1c550751a44053d5908d92c064c69%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637589228271815930%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=3lzBY33Kn%2FJZCAiM724LBXvi2ooXLgaK4KMC2NSuM5I%3D&reserved=0> . column1: Branch News
What’s on with Ofgem

column2: This week members of the BEC attended the Joint Negotiating Committee with members from Ofgem HR and reps from the FDA (the other recognised Union active in Ofgem).

Much of the discussion focused on PCS’s feedback on the Hybrid working policy that forms part of the transformation project. While we see a lot of positive opportunities for staff in this policy we are concerned around the informal nature of it, and the heavy caveats for line mangers to request staff come into the office at their discretion. After almost a year and a half of remote working we feel that there is limited justification for a line manager to require staff to be in the office where they would prefer to work from home and we have requested that the policy be looked at again to provide a better, more clearly articulated set of expectations for both staff and line managers.

We've had a number of conversations this week about the treatment of working from abroad, including with HR. Our understanding is still the same as when we last asked about it (that there are tax/legal blockers that kick in after about 8 weeks, and some countries you just can't take your work stuff to) but it's implementation by HR should be consistent - the message has been communicated to HR, but we expect what they can do to allow it to be more limited. Keep us informed if you're having trouble.

As we are (still) censored from wire publication please fill out and pass on the following survey to your teams so we can hear how best to communicate with members and non-members: The Wire is dead. Long live...well, what? <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D62e0d88376%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C9d2776a689904419e95f08d931ac91ca%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637595439522620432%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=JMfrsoyTDgLW%2BmD7Yf9vQdVm0uA9BlP48%2B4QfLzwbHA%3D&reserved=0>

DVLA action: Donate to Strike Fund

DVLA strike action over Covid safety continues this week (7-12 June) after ministers scuppered a deal last week that could have led to agreement. At Conference we adopted a motion expressing solidarity with the Uyghur minority in China’s Xinjiang’s province. They are subject to repression, torture and ‘re-education’. Opt out of your GP records being sold: deadline 23rd June:
NHS patients’ GP records are the most detailed and sensitive medical records that exist, containing the history of events in an individual’s lifetime impacting their physical and mental health.

NHS Digital – the health and social care system’s information and technology partner – will be able to take the following <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Df3b66877c1%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C9d2776a689904419e95f08d931ac91ca%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637595439522640425%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=NLNNLZllkHK2V6C7JrRemd8e%2BX1QVaBbBBGeSlKQnMI%3D&reserved=0>  from GPs’ records: “Data about diagnoses, symptoms, observations, test results, medications, allergies, immunisations, referrals, recalls and appointments, including information about physical, mental and sexual health.” This will also include data about “staff who have treated patients”, and data “on sex, ethnicity and sexual orientation”, as well as other sensitive data <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D12c72856cb%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C9d2776a689904419e95f08d931ac91ca%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637595439522650418%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=wxUgu1c6MWHgBBEGXcW4pdqdVD%2B4eVl%2F%2BhpmJzA0Jfg%3D&reserved=0> .

Although NHS Digital states that patients’ data will be extracted from GP systems across England “from 1 July 2021 <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dd6b2b0e028%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C9d2776a689904419e95f08d931ac91ca%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637595439522650418%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=ElHfL05G%2BoOQyIM5H6%2FyPtfD8yXfJ7MRndetPLaUbTk%3D&reserved=0> ”,  its privacy notice states that individuals have until 23 June 2021 to opt-out <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D7bc1167da8%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C9d2776a689904419e95f08d931ac91ca%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637595439522660410%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=rK355B3fdx5AyBI%2B62%2BsH2Y2VOSBYg0%2F6mNY7uRLBxk%3D&reserved=0> .

https://bylinetimes.com/2021/05/19/the-government-wants-to-sell-your-gp-medical-records-heres-how-to-opt-out/ <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dbd9988845d%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C9d2776a689904419e95f08d931ac91ca%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637595439522660410%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=8DDIjRcQ%2FNrgnCB6H%2Fiam06F4NfUEtGf%2FDI%2BY5Z2U0M%3D&reserved=0>

World Refugee Day – 21st June Lunchtime event

June 20th is World Refugee Day. World Refugee Day is a UN designated international day <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D37681d380e%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C9d2776a689904419e95f08d931ac91ca%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637595439522670408%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=WxbKvcmuBgoSBzrRKjuvZwVrX2LaKKK9ZtW0CBAxgCQ%3D&reserved=0>  to highlight the rights and needs, but also the dreams of refugees around the Globe. PCS Ofgem will be marking World Refugee Day with an event on Monday 21 June with two great speakers from the following organisations:

column2: Safe Passage <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Deea8b89acc%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C9d2776a689904419e95f08d931ac91ca%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637595439522670408%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=1xzbj7ayhQBJFb6E2NiKM6nIh3UZF%2BQzurnDAZnyJrg%3D&reserved=0>  - provides direct support to child refugees, and also campaigns for safer routes for refugees. Lowri from Safe Passage will speak about the work that they do, and its connection to the trade union movement.

The Central and West Integration Network <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D9108748cbd%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C9d2776a689904419e95f08d931ac91ca%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637595439522680404%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=jIVjZG4q2j8r%2BA4lFjoi%2B6eGeUKDI0Rq7WrPdx%2FjFKU%3D&reserved=0>  is a charity in Glasgow working to help refugees, asylum seekers and migrant workers to connect to local communities and help them gain full and equal access to resources and support. Firdaus from CWIN will speak about their work in Glasgow, and how maybe you can become part of it.

column1: To support the efforts of both charities, we will be collecting via a money pool available here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3De012592637%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C9d2776a689904419e95f08d931ac91ca%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637595439522680404%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=0OkZkPFybuLfrTdfS5R1kLcRCNIfif30Ec3hP4xIH1c%3D&reserved=0> . All money collected will be split equally between both organisations. You can also make a donation to either organisation directly. This event is open to members and non-members so do share the event with your colleagues and teams :)!
Stories from Windrush: A Multimedia Celebration

The Civil Service Race Forum, in collaboration with the MHCLG BAMENet, BEIS Faith and Minority Network and DfT Black Staff and Allies Network are pleased to present our joint event to celebrate Windrush Day 2021.

The event celebrates the Caribbean men and women who arrived in Britain on 22 June 1948 on the ship Empire Windrush, and other settlers who contributed to the rebuilding of the UK after World War II. Windrush Day was given national importance by the British government in June 2018 to celebrate their contributions to Britain's prosperity and modernity.

This event will bring together colleagues across government to learn more about the history behind Windrush: who were the Windrush generation, why did they come to the UK, and how have they and their descendants contributed to wider UK society? Join us for stories and reflections from the Windrush Foundation <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D0e5d20a3ad%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C9d2776a689904419e95f08d931ac91ca%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637595439522690394%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=rg%2B2pV%2BF3zwnQwmkR0iXL0sjNMWEa2vIIaz5bRbm3s4%3D&reserved=0> , including a poem and calypso performance by Alexander D Great <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dee0fa95e6b%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C9d2776a689904419e95f08d931ac91ca%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637595439522690394%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=PGxmJHrF7vx5zSRzWJr5RsajvB1%2FnvE9QGcUza9Rt4k%3D&reserved=0> .

What’s that McKinsey Malarkey?

Well, we don’t really know either why Ofgem has engaged McKinsey, and so far management has been rather tight-lipped in response to any questions. What we do know though, is that McKinsey comes with rather a reputation… A decent overview of it’s inglorious achievements is available here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D3fd53cb69b%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C9d2776a689904419e95f08d931ac91ca%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637595439522700388%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=ookbgaBcIarzIuC2onDw5GiaUbhQnmbsywPSgXTyS3U%3D&reserved=0> .
From trade unionist to president

It sounds like a fairytale, with someone from humble beginnings becoming (or turning out to be) a prince or princess. Or in this case a president. After an incredibly tight race, Pedro Castillo, a teacher, farmer and active trade unionist, was elected president of Peru <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dab99ba63cf%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C9d2776a689904419e95f08d931ac91ca%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637595439522700388%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=oxYUnzP7rvX%2FJMffkxO9IRw7tuypl4JjiQnz3wGiVXk%3D&reserved=0> . On such a tight margin he definitely has his work cut out for him, but it does show that for anyone of us, these first steps on the path of trade unionism could lead to greatness! ??

column1: Branch News
What’s on with Ofgem

column2: We kicked off early engagement this week with Jonathan and HR n the transformation programme consultation. The meeting focussed on the consultation process and objectives, and we'll continue to engage throughout the process. Watch out for more information and workshops coming into members' calendars.

Our Vice-Chair Alex and Equalities Officer Cheral hosted an event for World Refugee Day on Monday and despite some zoom hiccups (lessons have been learnt!) we had a rather empowering time hearing from speakers for two organisations: Safe Passage <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D481834ae3b%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cbe81be4911954359071d08d93711155f%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637601368789480825%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=c6G5NgEt8iKL2%2FN62cFlxjD0jaUHywK7A9in6XTScxg%3D&reserved=0>  (political and grassroots campaigning extraordinaires) and the wonderful community organising-based Central and West Integration Network <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D5e8cb4648d%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cbe81be4911954359071d08d93711155f%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637601368789480825%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=%2FF04KaqRAyRAbXWqKZkk7xqdhugr4qHTZvT2%2BvAYrII%3D&reserved=0> . Cheral is writing up the event for hopefully a wire article, and in the meanwhile to thank the organisations please donate to this paypal pool <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D345c5d92d9%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cbe81be4911954359071d08d93711155f%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637601368789490820%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=TDU%2B6NzBc8XrM95EC83nqI9%2F7eiwoSsK%2B9hY7cVnmhM%3D&reserved=0>  we have set up to support their great work.
