column1: Campaigns & News
PCS back in dispute with OCS over failure to adhere to pay settlement
As of 22nd June 2021, PCS has issued a formal notice to OCS confirming that a trade dispute exists between our union and OCS.
This action comes as a result of an attempt by OCS to renege on the two-year pay settlement agreement reached during intense dispute resolution talks.

To read the full article please see here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D2c7210281f%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cbe81be4911954359071d08d93711155f%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637601368789490820%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=avgdHqEzHrG3DaYqTEnfuxrs6DClzZdXhvshJ61rDv8%3D&reserved=0>
Organizing for Power

As seen in our TOTW our Equalities Officer Cheral had the utmost privilege at attending the Organizing4power course over the last 6 weeks. Patrick our H&S rep also joined, and we got to hear about organisations worldwide about their current campaigns: from our very own NHS nurses, to hearing from Albanian comrades who are hoping to set up their only current trade union! The course reaffirmed all workers are the union and we are inspired to keep holding Ofgem accountable and ensure everyone has dignity at work. A final thing to share is a great Organizing for power playlist on Spotify <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D4cc5390209%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cbe81be4911954359071d08d93711155f%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637601368789500820%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=TOyrXBkhn59Bujybm%2Fmt3%2BwAuX1fO5PGu7Y0rmVZi6w%3D&reserved=0> , it truly has a little something for everyone, do have a listen!
Events
Fighting for positive mental health in the workplace – sign up for PCS training
Stress, depression, or anxiety are now the greatest cause of work absence in the UK. Trade unions have a key role to play in ensuring employers provide healthy workplaces.

In 2018, it was revealed that 26% of all sickness absence in the civil service was due to mental health conditions. Our PCS Mental Health in the Workplace training course can give you the knowledge and confidence to help members to challenge where policies may be being breached or employers are unaware of employment rights, and to campaign for good mental health in the workplace.

To register and to find more details on the courses, please see here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3De3cf1e8443%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cbe81be4911954359071d08d93711155f%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637601368789500820%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=YAwRdmBk8mTEFK1mi4rOjvtqfIE%2F4HEoIG8%2BjlHODrY%3D&reserved=0>
Supporting the People's Assembly demo this Saturday
PCS supports the People’s Assembly rally in London on 26 June 2021 and encourages our London-based members to support it if you can do so safely and within Covid regulations.
This demonstration resonates with PCS members who have suffered years of pay freezes and cuts, along with attacks on pension rights.

PCS will have a presence on the day and anyone who wants to join us can contact campaigns@pcs.org.uk <mailto:campaigns@pcs.org.uk>  in advance to find the PCS meeting point. We wish to stress again that members should only attend if you feel safe to do so.

To find more information on this demonstration please refer to the People’s Assembly website National Demonstration - (thepeoplesassembly.org.uk) <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D94e5ffc7fa%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cbe81be4911954359071d08d93711155f%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637601368789510807%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=uKsqsuJMpLBFN8N3RdLK%2FY%2FK2uN%2FE7N%2BGyLcVMouDh4%3D&reserved=0>

The PCS National Disabled Members' Forum (NDMF) is holding two separate events (the same event held at different sessions) which aim to increase neurodiversity awareness and to discuss why it's important to encourage neurodivergent members to get involved in union activity.
The speakers include:

•         Adele Potten-Price, TSSA union
•         John Hegney, NDMF member

Restructure: PCS member’s priorities (request for input) [OFFICIAL ],"Dear PCS member,

By now you will all have had the opportunity to see the briefing on the transformation project’s restructure consultation. For reference, the documents are on the intranet here <http://ofgemintranet/StrategyAndActivities/OD/Pages/DocumentsAndResources.aspx> . We think you’ll agree that it’s significant, and we want to make sure we engage and represent members as best we can. To that end, we’ve set of the details below of what we have already done; our membership engagement strategy over the consultation period; and how you can best share your views. As a PCS member, you have an effective voice and the branch committee will represent your views directly to Jonathan and HR.
What we’ve already done

We were briefed on the restructure last week, and have provided written commentary and feedback to JB and HR ahead of the consultation. We made clear where we expect there to be significant membership concern, requested numerous clarification, and set our expectation to continue to feed-in PCS views throughout the consultation. HR have offered us multiple direct meetings throughout the consultation period, including directly with Jonathan, in order for us to represent our memberships views.
Our proposed membership engagement strategy

There’s a lot to take in and share your views on. PCS have broken down the proposed changes into a series of themes. We want you to tell us which themes are most important to you, and we’ll run workshops on these to discuss the proposals and gather feedback which we’ll then write up and send on a rolling basis to HR throughout the consultation period. This means that we can cover more information; share views and influence early in the process; and give you the opportunity to comment on the themes that are most important to you.
At each of the workshops, we’ll provide some opening views from our engagement with Ofgem so far and any updates and clarifications from HR, but will primarily seek your views and input.
At the end of the consultation period, we’ll compile all feedback into a final consultation response on behalf of the membership.
Possible themes are:

column2: Consultation process – including the time HR are taking to review the consultation responses; the way Ofgem are deciding on the outcomes of the consultation; and the transparency of the consultation.
Flexible resourcing – including the model for deployments around Ofgem; the management processes to deliver flexible resourcing; and what happens if you don’t want to change deployment

Implementation process – including the processes for voluntary exit; job evaluation against the new grade scales; the selection process for new posts; and what happens to colleagues on fixed term or agency contracts
Organisational structure/Career model – including the new hierarchy; the expert track and the management track; professions; how line management works; and how decisions are signed off
Pay – including in-band pay progression and the reduction in the number of colleagues eligible for bonuses
Performance management – including the appraisal framework and performance reviews
Rationale for the re-org – including why the re-org is being done; and whether cultural change will flow from it
Recruitment – including how recruitment will work with the new organisational structure
Other – please suggest any other themes

column1: Please vote for the themes that you want to talk about using the ‘like’ function on the Easy Retro board here: EasyRetro - PCS Workshops <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Feasyretro.io%2Fpublicboard%2F4nB2DME6UhWWGwuLJHLGDua5i592%2Ff9ba8e07-e05e-4e85-8c21-784d4625e831&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C791567f34522496f67e108d93c7c003c%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637607325543024374%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=z8N%2FEyER%2BTftzRiRsWj3YT7Fmfjvvbo9xlhn%2Fao%2BMq0%3D&reserved=0>  Please and add any further themes you think are important. Please do this by the end of this week so that we can decide which themes to run workshops on/condense multiple themes to one workshop etc. and send workshop invites next week.
The Easy Retro board has space for comments - please use this for comments on the workshop content rather than your overall views, since we have a separate board for wider feedback (see below).
Other ways you can feed-in views
We’ll try to run as many workshops as needed, but there are other ways of giving us feedback to share with HR:

column1: Branch News
What’s on with Ofgem

The Transformation Project consultation has now been published and we’ve sent a separate Transformation email on these proposals and how we will feed into the consultation process collectively as a Union.

So we can best represent you we have decided some relevant themes and by letting us know which themes are most important to you we will proceed to run workshops to discuss the proposals, gather feedback, then send to HR during the consultation.

column1: Campaigns & News
ISS staff in BEIS deliver impressive ballot result

Cleaners, security guards and other support staff employed by contractor ISS are one step closer to taking strike action after delivering a resounding yes vote in a PCS industrial action ballot. Our comrades at BEIS voted 97.3% in favour of strike action on an impressive 82% turnout. Read on about the issue and the Union demands here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D61516e7ec8%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C56743902420b4dd5ae8908d93c948a37%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637607430941013268%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=1BRYlfKpnFxCRNSA1k45BmhNodEjQZMRTtQ9Mk%2BvfDQ%3D&reserved=0> .
Continued success of strike action at DVLA

Strike action in the Swansea DVLA contact centre has been well supported, providing a strong start to this week’s targeted strike action. Members in other parts of DVLA will be joining in the strike action this week in the continuing campaign over Covid safety. Whilst negotiators have made continued in-roads, risks remain as positive cases continue to rise in the area. Read on here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D5f760ae68f%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C56743902420b4dd5ae8908d93c948a37%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637607430941023261%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=FtrfyTG9TVS8CO4KZ6TUj%2FzYXOf7rtg3OQrGtykM2K8%3D&reserved=0>  and here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dee4880cda3%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C56743902420b4dd5ae8908d93c948a37%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637607430941023261%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=M2nAX3gY0CDtnEw%2FS%2FgXRKxNBvjAp5e1bDvivjRBTK4%3D&reserved=0> . Reminder: Come along to PCS National Disabled Members' Forum

There is still time to attend the PCS National Disabled Members' Forum (NDMF) which aim to increase neurodiversity awareness and to discuss why it's important to encourage neurodivergent members to get involved in union activity.
The speakers include:
•         Austin Harney, NDMF member and TUC Disabled Workers' Committee Officer
•         Adele Potten-Price, TSSA union
•         John Hegney, NDMF member

Register online here - Wednesday 7 July 12pm - 1.30pm on MS Teams <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D178f8da487%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C56743902420b4dd5ae8908d93c948a37%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637607430941033258%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=HiRiLMuKs3012Tg3hCmgIgHSkLh3ffcJjbeoHEEOs2c%3D&reserved=0>

A BSL interpreter and speech to text captioning will be available. Both events will be recorded. Please submit any reasonable adjustments requests as part of the registration process. In addition, there is an option to submit a question ahead of the events or you can ask a question during the event. If you have any queries, please email: equality@pcs.org.uk.

This is an invitation to the first of our sessions with members to discuss the organisational restructure consultation. column1: Restructure News

We continue to engage with Ofgem on the restructure proposals, based on your input. We encourage everyone to attend Ofgem’s own feedback sessions, and will also continue to organise our own. Our next session is on Tuesday 13 July and will focus on the proposals for pay.

Our priority at the moment is to get more information out there to help you understand and assess the proposals. It’s becoming really clear that your questions aren’t being answered in either the slides or the all staff meetinsg, so we will press Ofgem to do better.
Restructure hot or not

(We’ll use this feature to very briefly highlight what we think are the pros and cons of the proposals, based on our engagement with Ofgem, your feedback, and PCS’s wider policies).Please see the Consultation document here, <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D37da2f8002%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C92289f8d63ba4a3233be08d942200d77%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637613527702930292%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=jvqBWgZbHd3LXB7WpdQjQvlhKJAsMvEzusBZS5dnjxo%3D&reserved=0>  and the FAQ’s provided by Ofgem here. <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D6abed8002f%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C92289f8d63ba4a3233be08d942200d77%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637613527702930292%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=Schl1Gqg%2B2jZllKXR5PnqlOOgvuHWP6e9NEBUMkPbHk%3D&reserved=0>

column1: Rep's Needed

Throughout the Organisational Transition Consultation and beyond, both members and non-members will have questions and queries important to them. It is more important than ever to enure that everyone in the organisation feels heard and we need volunteers to act as local reps to continue to spread our message and encourage more people to join the union! If interested in becoming a local rep for your Team please contact us by emailing PCS@ofgem.gov.uk <mailto:PCS@ofgem.gov.uk>  or by Contacting Frank Hemmes.
Branch News
As you might expect, the restructure is consuming most of the BEC’s attention. But we’re keeping our eyes on the other balls out there as well, including:

column2: Risk assessments: We’ve received updated risk assessments from Ofgem as part of the return to the offices. We still think they can be better, with more attention on location-specific risks, and clearer ownership and accountability for the mitigating actions.

Wire access: In response to a formal letter from our Full-time Officer (a PCS employee who we can call on to help out our branch in times of need), Ofgem has now said we will retain Wire access and be allowed to post articles, provided we pass them by Comms first to ensure consistency with Ofgem’s comms policies. We have asked Ofgem to set out the exact process to us, so that we can get back to getting our news out there with a minimum of hassle and intervention. Thank you everyone who expressed concerns to Ofgem about this, this has certainly helped to achieve this.

column1: Campaigns & News
DVLA strikes continue

Action at the Driving and Vehicle Licensing Agency (DVLA) continues as management still refuses to bring back the negotiated deal to make the office more Covid-secure, which was removed at the last minute. Mitie Members win delay to damaging pay changes

PCS Members employed by Mitie Group, formaly Interserve, have won a delay in damaging pay changes that Mitie proposed to ex Interserve employees following a threat to “Fire and Rehire” staff and PCS membership increasing as a result. Fighting for equality at the Royal Parks

PCS members employed by Just Ask Estates Service Ltd are being balloted for industrial action as part of their campaign for equal pay and conditions with their Royal Park employed colleagues. The main driving factor would be the issue of the outsourcing of workforces leaving a two-teir structure which leaves inconsistencies in Private and Public sectors causing discrimination and lack of advancement opportunities for those employed by Just Ask Estates. You can read more on this issue here. <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dfc22498f8d%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C92289f8d63ba4a3233be08d942200d77%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637613527702950279%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=Yt2TuYfVnd4Z%2F4fRN4%2FC6jKwnQhRKgpVHyohjLvj3b8%3D&reserved=0>

10-11 August or 8-9 September
register on PCS Digital or ask us how!

Some people are autistic, dyslexic, dyspraxic, ADHD, or another atypical condition. PCS fights for all members - especially those who face disadvantage and discrimination in the workplace, and in wider society. PCS - Session 4 on OD: SCS/Band E/Band D impacts,"Good afternoon everyone,

This invite is for the fourth PCS session we are running to gather views on the Organisational Design programme. This session is aimed specifically at those in SCS, Band E or Band D roles who are impacted by the proposal to replace existing leadership grades with the new Portfolio, Workstream and Team Manager roles.

We have sent this invite to all members as we cannot 100% accurately determine who is and isn’t impacted, and we also don’t want to exclude any other members who may have views on this issue. Still, the focus will be on the proposals that impact SCS, Band Es and Band Ds in leadership/management roles. Other parts of the restructure are covered in our other sessions, so keep a lookout for invites for those. We will in all likelihood also schedule a session specifically for Band Ds, so the invite for that should follow shortly.
If you cannot attend, do feel free to send your thoughts via email to pcs@ofgem.gov.uk <mailto:pcs@ofgem.gov.uk> .
Cheerio,
Frank

PCS Event - 4 Day Week Campaign,"Dear members and other comrades,

I’m pleased to invite you to the next instalment in our series of PCS  Ofgem events. Our upcoming event will discuss the benefits of moving towards a 4 day week as a society, including the impacts on the environment, mental health and productivity. Joe Ryle from the 4 Day Week Campaign <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.4dayweek.co.uk%2F&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cd0a358980cbe45de80a708d9461439c4%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637617874952419269%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=iV72QGM32TfmXlXfQuIKBWHDgavOVHZ2xpB4zVCm45c%3D&reserved=0>  will speak to us about the work the campaign does, the arguments for a 4 day week, and recent successful trials (such as this one <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bbc.co.uk%2Fnews%2Fbusiness-57724779&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cd0a358980cbe45de80a708d9461439c4%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637617874952419269%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=ptjgarv1UxfEtPfdYmhtsme6Kjxm8Q0P4UE0KTn7XoQ%3D&reserved=0>  in Iceland). There will then also be opportunity to ask questions.
Ahead of the event, we also want to ask you to consider the following: “What would you do if you had to work one fewer day per week?”.
This event is hosted via Zoom, details are below:

Event Link: https://us02web.zoom.us/j/82727144592?pwd=S2pmWllVbGJOOW9sdFV1Q0VDclFmUT09 <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fus02web.zoom.us%2Fj%2F82727144592%3Fpwd%3DS2pmWllVbGJOOW9sdFV1Q0VDclFmUT09&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cd0a358980cbe45de80a708d9461439c4%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637617874952429263%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=YebLbPsxpd2QttHM1DTtZBkFcM%2FaqIvjOrOoFKQ9%2FVc%3D&reserved=0>
Meeting ID: 827 2714 4592
Passcode: 336844
Please note you do not have to have Zoom installed on your computer, it will work in your browser. Zoom will give you this option if you decline to install the browser client.
This event is open to PCS members from other branches in Canary Wharf and Glasgow. If you are a rep from a branch other than Ofgem, please advertise this to your members in the most appropriate way.

If you want to look at some of the arguments for a 4 Day Week ahead of time, I can recommend the resources on the 4 Day Week Campaign’s website here: https://www.4dayweek.co.uk/reports <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.4dayweek.co.uk%2Freports&data=04%7C01%7CRory.McCabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cd0a358980cbe45de80a708d9461439c4%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637617874952429263%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=1IsaRNaItrOHwaXIRE10V1Rjy2O8mnPsHMS9yRvoY38%3D&reserved=0>

PCS - Session 4 on OD: SCS/Band E/Band D impacts,"Good afternoon everyone,

This invite is for the fourth PCS session we are running to gather views on the Organisational Design programme. This session is aimed specifically at those in SCS, Band E or Band D roles who are impacted by the proposal to replace existing leadership grades with the new Portfolio, Workstream and Team Manager roles.

We have sent this invite to all members as we cannot 100% accurately determine who is and isn’t impacted, and we also don’t want to exclude any other members who may have views on this issue. Still, the focus will be on the proposals that impact SCS, Band Es and Band Ds in leadership/management roles. Other parts of the restructure are covered in our other sessions, so keep a lookout for invites for those. We will in all likelihood also schedule a session specifically for Band Ds, so the invite for that should follow shortly.
If you cannot attend, do feel free to send your thoughts via email to pcs@ofgem.gov.uk <mailto:pcs@ofgem.gov.uk> .
Cheerio,
Frank

Restructure concerns

Branch News
Restructure News

We continue to engage with Ofgem on the restructure proposals, based on your input. We encourage everyone to attend Ofgem’s own feedback sessions, and will also continue to organise our own. Our next session is on Wednesday 21 July and will focus on the proposals for flex resourcing and organisational structure.
We also have a session on Friday 23 July to focus on the role changes affecting SCS1/Band E and some Band Ds, but is of course open for other members to attend.

Our priority at the moment is to get more information out there to help you understand and assess the proposals. It’s becoming really clear that your questions aren’t being answered in either the slides or the all staff meetings, so we will continue to press Ofgem to do better. We hope to have answers to the consolidated Pay and Progression questions in next week’s newsletter.
Restructure hot or not
(We’ll use this feature to very briefly highlight what we think are the pros and cons of the proposals, based on our engagement with Ofgem, your feedback, and PCS’s wider policies).

column1: Rep’s Needed

Throughout the Organisational Transition Consultation and beyond, both members and non-members will have questions and queries important to them. It is more important than ever to enure that everyone in the organisation feels heard and we need volunteers to act as local reps to continue to spread our message and encourage more people to join the union! If interested in becoming a local rep for your Team please contact us by emailing PCS@ofgem.gov.uk <mailto:PCS@ofgem.gov.uk>  or by Contacting Frank Hemmes.
Branch News
As you might expect, the restructure is consuming most of the BEC’s attention. But we’re keeping our eyes on the other balls out there as well, including:

column2: Risk assessments: We’ve received updated risk assessments from Ofgem as part of the return to the offices. We still think they can be better, with more attention on location-specific risks, and clearer ownership and accountability for the mitigating actions.

Wire access: In an interesting turn of events this very morning (Thursday 15 July) Ofgem has once again doubled back on their promise to restore our Wire access: in short, we are permitted to advertise our existence and our meetings alone. We are investigating potentially setting up a website, but we would just like to remind you of Jonathan’s response to this point in a recent all staff call:

column1: ‘All that has changed is that, as part of a general tightening up of publishing rights and procedures on our intranet, content from the PCS now needs to be submitted to the internal communications team for it to publish - rather than being directly published by the PCS itself.’ Make of that what you will.
Campaigns & Events
Hands Off British Council campaign
PCS has launched a #HandsOffBritishCouncil campaign against the slash and burn cuts announced at the end of June.

British Council workers feel betrayed after suffering the uncertainty of 2020 and a pay freeze which has meant they have not received any cost of living increase since 2019. They now face compulsory redundancies following the announcement of over 2000 job cuts across the globe. Please read the article <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dff1697f29f%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cd8d967b29e444671408608d947a73add%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637619605854174055%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=%2BQdQXx9LN1X17GC7rqoQc3WeLSVE8rTj%2BHprKBaIqDA%3D&reserved=0>  and sign the petition <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D619fda5c14%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cd8d967b29e444671408608d947a73add%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637619605854184049%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=jfxvyl6ztaIc31z8GHAn0gT5na5el9DMddUo3eu1DbM%3D&reserved=0> .
DVLA strikes continue

Action at the Driving and Vehicle Licensing Agency (DVLA) continues as management still refuses to bring back the negotiated deal to make the office more Covid-secure, which was removed at the last minute. Our members in the DVLA are still on strike, and need your support. You can help them by making a donation <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3De6b00e2570%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cd8d967b29e444671408608d947a73add%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637619605854184049%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=Ptd0qZsl7n%2FDceaKc%2BEFiKYzQiWi1T6BNHFYLXnXXzk%3D&reserved=0>  to our collection for their strike fund, which will compensate them for loss of pay while on strike. Our e-action also continues. The most recent update on the campaign is here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D137daf6991%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cd8d967b29e444671408608d947a73add%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637619605854194041%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=t54l79%2FqnrDOYGE%2BvUDSqnBFwqf%2Ftwb3o0OBUAE4yz8%3D&reserved=0> . We donated £155 to the DLVA Strike Fund (in addition to the £135 we donated earlier). We also collected £135 after World Refugee Day, which I split £63 to Safe Passage and £62 to CWIN.
PCS condemns end of Covid restrictions and sets out safety demands

PCS believes Boris Johnson’s decision to end Covid restrictions in England on 19 July is wrong and we have made a series of demands to the Cabinet Office with the aim of ensuring staff and workplaces are safe.

Given the rising numbers of cases caused by the Delta variant of the various and because the vaccination programme is incomplete we believe it is premature to end restrictions. PCS has made 8 demands <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D6e71781d19%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cd8d967b29e444671408608d947a73add%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637619605854194041%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=tsm1ucnu1hHxH7UXXqTUuPxQrcnpVYH79IdcJ2K6MTA%3D&reserved=0>  of the cabinet office.

10-11 August or 8-9 September

column1: Branch News
Restructure News

We continue to engage with Ofgem on the restructure proposals, based on your input. We encourage everyone to attend Ofgem’s own feedback sessions, and will also continue to organise our own. Our next session is on Friday 23 July to focus on the role changes affecting SCS1/Band E and some Band Ds, but is of course open for other members to attend.

Our priority at the moment is to get more information out there to help you understand and assess the proposals. It’s becoming really clear that your questions aren’t being answered in either the slides or the all staff meetings, so we will continue to press Ofgem to do better. We hope to have answers to the consolidated Pay and Progression questions in next week’s newsletter.

We are also running a mid-consultation survey <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D9a0b3ca0fc%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C67f00c7b4bd4479ac05208d9500f6b15%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637628849424993148%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=qhuuT5Xog9tR2yk6DgjdZ4lWHb53XbMaaeV78tsJTns%3D&reserved=0>  for members and non-members to collect your views covering how you feel about the consultation right now, if your understanding has improved or not over the past few weeks, and what you see as the main opportunities and concerns in the proposals so far. This survey isn’t exclusive to PCS members, so you can share this with your colleagues.

Please see the Consultation document here, <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dffed0f6395%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C67f00c7b4bd4479ac05208d9500f6b15%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637628849425003141%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=1oqEYOepCXCLNcMsxQ%2FCgCPRHhWIiwdfVeI%2FhIpxpaY%3D&reserved=0>  and the FAQ’s provided by Ofgem here. <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D25b8251e96%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C67f00c7b4bd4479ac05208d9500f6b15%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637628849425003141%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=WRPYlUA0R%2F8OBCdMrGGhQyacYJr7RQMC1QM6p1n5n1c%3D&reserved=0>

column1: Rep’s Needed

Throughout the Organisational Transition Consultation and beyond, both members and non-members will have questions and queries important to them. It is more important than ever to enure that everyone in the organisation feels heard and we need volunteers to act as local reps to continue to spread our message and encourage more people to join the union! If interested in becoming a local rep for your Team please contact us by emailing PCS@ofgem.gov.uk <mailto:PCS@ofgem.gov.uk>  or by contacting Frank Hemmes.
Branch News
As you might expect, the restructure is consuming most of the BEC’s attention. But we’re keeping our eyes on the other balls out there as well, including:

column2: Risk assessments: We’ve received updated risk assessments from Ofgem as part of the return to the offices. We still think they can be better, with more attention on location-specific risks, and clearer ownership and accountability for the mitigating actions.

Real Living Wage: Whilst the initial promises by Ofgem seem encouraging regarding their commitment to paying the Real Living Wage to all staff we will keep pressing for this to be actioned. The proposed reorganisation pay bands do not currently pay the Real Living Wage so until this is confirmed do continue to sign and share our petition <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D4a0c0c9bf1%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C67f00c7b4bd4479ac05208d9500f6b15%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637628849425013146%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=f7maUK82ir8LZncC2sM2tO4NBe%2BK1ge6vr0KJvU5cr8%3D&reserved=0> .

column1: Campaigns & Events
Ministers exposed as having scuppered deal to end DVLA strike at select committee

Transport minister Baroness Vere admitted to the parliamentary transport select committee that she interfered to stop a comprehensive deal to end DVLA dispute from being put in place. In a day of testimony  <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D50784da987%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C67f00c7b4bd4479ac05208d9500f6b15%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637628849425013146%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=xEa3fGnfHnOVVdhM6bdkE8rkwfaqt8q1p4yHsPeGHkc%3D&reserved=0> which included PCS General Secretary Mark Serwotka, PCS DVLA Branch Chair Sarah Evans, Baroness Vere and DVLA CEO Julie Lennard, it was clear that the deal to end the dispute was scuppered by ministerial interference. Please read the article <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D1c2403769b%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C67f00c7b4bd4479ac05208d9500f6b15%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637628849425023134%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=PktA3yuH2KgRWsXmfilrSSgkswUKVJ%2BmC32EU1Nv1dg%3D&reserved=0> .
Working in high temperatures

Read this article <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dcd52455ac9%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C67f00c7b4bd4479ac05208d9500f6b15%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637628849425033137%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=cGazTW%2FEBiNk7x5FH04vwpcDePGbL74bDqgTfrcnfcU%3D&reserved=0>  about your rights in the workplace while working during the current high summer temperatures. If you are working from home you should speak to your health and safety rep or your manager if you are having problems because of the heat. Heat stress can cause severe problems so should not be ignored.
PCS condemns end of Covid restrictions and sets out safety demands

PCS believes Boris Johnson’s decision to end Covid restrictions in England on 19 July is wrong and we have made a series of demands to the Cabinet Office with the aim of ensuring staff and workplaces are safe.

Given the rising numbers of cases caused by the Delta variant of the various and because the vaccination programme is incomplete we believe it is premature to end restrictions. PCS has made 8 demands <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D102836a808%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C67f00c7b4bd4479ac05208d9500f6b15%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637628849425033137%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=9%2Fy0%2FGq0BQcEtzQqCb2gyIvQcnFo9%2F0kkpEd%2FUEg1%2BY%3D&reserved=0>  of the cabinet office.

10-11 August or 8-9 September

Hello All,
Many of you have come to our workshops, emailed us or engaged with us in other ways.

We’ve been trying our best to get answers to the questions you have raised and we want to take some time to go through what we do have since we have reached the roughly half way mark in this “consultation”.
Topics to be covered include Pay and Benefits, Flexible resourcing and overall organisational design.
I can’t promise to have all the answers, I can not perform miracles, but we will try and tell you what we know and hopefully it will be helpful.
Many thanks
Flo

column1: Branch News
Restructure News

We continue to engage with Ofgem on the restructure proposals, based on your input. At the moment our focus remains getting more clarity, because your main feedback is that the proposals are still unclear and you’re unsure how they will actually work out for you. We shared a list of specific questions with Ofgem this week and expect answers by Friday. Those who attend Thursday’s feedback session have had a sneak preview of some of the answers.

We are also formulating a list of concrete recommendations for changes to the proposals, which we will communicate to Ofgem via formal letter. We will share this with you shortly, and encourage you to circulate this within your teams to help your colleagues see what PCS is doing. Our survey is also still live (here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D2b91a6b902%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C374e6c6dc21e402916cc08d952a27b9a%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637631680080786245%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=18ruvSzOsscYBuHysT3rVhT2%2FO8x%2FrQ7qGrhKFSaex4%3D&reserved=0> ). If you haven’t done so already, please respond to it. The survey can be circulated to your colleagues. Findings so far are:

column2: Over half of you don’t’ have enough time to engage with the OD.
More than half of you feel negative about the proposals, and over 60% is now more sceptical about the proposals than when they were launched.
Better opportunities for career progression is most widely recognised as a benefit of the proposals. Knowledge not being recognised as a valuable asset is the most widespread concern.

column1: Rep’s Needed

Throughout the Organisational Transition Consultation and beyond, both members and non-members will have questions and queries important to them. It is more important than ever to enure that everyone in the organisation feels heard and we need volunteers to act as local reps to continue to spread our message and encourage more people to join the union! If interested in becoming a local rep for your Team please contact us by emailing PCS@ofgem.gov.uk <mailto:PCS@ofgem.gov.uk>  or by contacting Frank Hemmes.
Branch News
As you might expect, the restructure is consuming most of the BEC’s attention. But we’re keeping our eyes on the other balls out there as well, including:

column2: Risk assessments: We’ve received a second update to the risk assessment for 10SC. This version is much better, with the mitigation actions and their owners clearly specified. We have been promised a similar update for the Commonwealth House Risk Assessment, which we look forward to reviewing. Overall we think the risk assessments are now in a much better place, ensuring safer offices when we do start to go back in.

Scotland regional AGM: Laura attended the PCS Scotland Regional AGM on Wednesday. All 8 motions brought forward were carried, including on topics such as consideration of Scottish member definitions of political blackness, menopause at work, and COP26 climate action affiliation.

4 Day week Event: On Tuesday Joe Ryle from the 4 Day Week campaign explained their work to us, as well as all the good arguments for a 4 day week. We asked everyone there what they would do with a longer weekend, and maybe surprisingly ‘life admin’ and sorting out the household chores was quite popular, followed by doing more exercise or sport, and taking up hobbies. If you missed the event but are interested in this campaign, you can find more information on the 4 Day Week Campaign here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D7c52cbfd6b%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C374e6c6dc21e402916cc08d952a27b9a%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637631680080806236%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=bMfanIGMEaokbhp2ISWhySVCJaefZbyCsqjcSvDadBA%3D&reserved=0> , and sign up for their newsletter here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Deb2c82d1db%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C374e6c6dc21e402916cc08d952a27b9a%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637631680080806236%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=I%2Fk0k7X4d3%2BPeMlGfPdPp%2Ba12UPPHswRkBLuqvRRb4c%3D&reserved=0> .

column1: We also want to keep the debate on the 4 Day Week going here at Ofgem. If you’re interested to be part of that, email Frank.
Campaigns & Events
Royal Parks strike fund collection

Outsourced cleaning staff at the Royal Parks, represented by both PCS and UWV, are taking strike action on 30 July to get equal pay and rights with directly employed workers. At the moment, outsourced workers, who are predominantly BAME, are on second rate contracts compared to the Royal Parks' own workforce. Your contribution will help strikers recover from loss ofpay. More information, and the option to make a donation directly, is available here: https://www.crowdfunder.co.uk/end-discrimination-at-the-royal-parks <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Da2e14ffde6%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C374e6c6dc21e402916cc08d952a27b9a%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637631680080816233%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=MMB%2FCjhM92RfIsSYc5mQ7kEbbQ%2ButJBM4HeAKMfSFec%3D&reserved=0>

Neurodiversity in the Workplace Stage 1 –
10-11 August or 8-9 September
register on PCS Digital or ask us how!

Some people are autistic, dyslexic, dyspraxic, ADHD, or another atypical condition. PCS fights for all members - especially those who face disadvantage and discrimination in the workplace, and in wider society. Opportunities need to be widened and support strengthened, not cut back under the excuse of 'austerity'.
Sign up for out two day course and become a PCS Neurodiversity Champion.If you have any queries about this course, please contact us at organising@pcs.org.uk <mailto:organising@pcs.org.uk> .

13 July and 30th July 1200-1300

PCS - Rebooting our green and equalities work [OFFICIAL Internal Only],"Good afternoon everyone,

I know that the OD is at the forefront of everyone’s mind, but as we mentioned in last week’s newsletter, we are still managing to engage on other important issues as well. That is why we have recently written to Ofgem to reboot our environmental and equalities work. There was a lot happening in both these areas before the pandemic, but as the response to Covid took over, this was all put on the backburner. With the offices slowly reopening and things beginning to return to normal, we thought it a good time to refresh both topics.
I have attached the letters we sent to Ofgem, drafted by our amazing Equalities Officer (Cheral Govind) and Green Rep (Samantha Wood). A summary of the items for each letter is also below:
Equalities

column2: Ofgem has signed up to the Employer Initiative on Domestic Abuse (EIDA). EIDA has a lot of good practice available for employers, and so we are asking Ofgem to implement this as much as possible.

The TUC have a charter called ‘Dying to Work’, which commits employers who are signed up to it to put in place protection and support for workers with a terminal illness. We are asking Ofgem to sign up to the Charter and implement its good practice.

Before Covid, Ofgem had committed to providing free period products in our offices. Estates was just making arrangements with the building managers when we were all sent home, so we are now checking in to see what the state of play is as we go back to the offices.

The recent PCS Conference adopted a motion calling on all branches to negotiate menopause policies for their workplaces. Because while the menopause affects many women, there is still a lot of stigma and silence around it, and hence lots of people don’t get the support or understanding they need. The Trade Union Congress (TUC) has just put out some menopause best practice policies that we are keen to work with Ofgem on.

We appreciate the recent update about the Equal Group report that was given on the last all staff call, but we think Ofgem should go further and release the report to all staff, so that everyone knows what is in it.

It has been a longstanding aim of both PCS and EnAble to get passports for staff with reasonable adjustments, so that they do not have to renegotiate these every time someone changes team or line manager. With the move to flexible resourcing this will become even more important, and so we are pushing for these to be introduced, and to also cover a broader range of adjustments, such as working patterns or caring responsibilities.

column1: Environment

column2: We are calling on Ofgem to conduct an environmental audit of its offices and operations, as a starting point for reducing our environmental impact.
Now that we are all on Teams, the need for travel is reduced, but some will still take place. We want Ofgem to commit to a ‘trains first’ policy, with flights only used in exceptional circumstances.

As a tenant in all our locations, Ofgem doesn’t have direct control over many aspects of the buildings we occupy. But Ofgem does have influence with our landlords or tenant committees. So we think Ofgem should use this to push the building owners and managers to do as much as possible to reduce the environmental impact of our offices.
If not already the case, Ofgem should ensure all our energy is 100% renewable.
Although Ofgem doesn’t do a lot of catering, we do think that when we order any, it should be meat free.

Before the pandemic there was a Sustainability Working Group composed of staff interested in making Ofgem more environmentally sustainable. It seems the SWG may have gone on pause during Covid, so we’re asking Ofgem to restart it, with our green rep on board, of course.

Many of you work at Ofgem because you care about the environment, and that can also mean going to demonstrations, events, rallies or protests. We are asking Ofgem to explicitly affirm that such activities are acceptable under the rules for political engagement set out in the Civil Service Management Code.

Ofgem answers to PCS questions and upcoming JB discussions [OFFICIAL Internal Only],"Morning all,
Please see attached our updated questions to Ofgem and responses received, now with added comments. I’ve also reattached our mid-consultation letter sent to ExCo last week.

Jonathan Brearley is joining the PCS-OFgem weekly consultation meeting tomorrow for half an hour. In the interest of time, we’ve selected for discussion the following issues highlighted in the letter:
#1 – Real Living Wage: Ofgem to update the proposed pay levels to reflect its commitment to start paying the Real Living Wage.
#4 – Comprehensive grade mapping: Map staff to new grades based on more than their current wage.
#7 – Expert & Managerial paths: Provide more detail on the Expert and Managerial paths and their interaction.

#15 - Role assessments: Ofgem must evidence the need for managers to reapply for managerial roles through the use of comparative role assessments. Where a difference of greater than 25% cannot be demonstrated, roles must be slotted in where reasonably practicable.

#21 - Corporate services capability: We ask Ofgem to provide assurances that it has the operational processes, systems and capacity to run flexible resourcing adequately. Ideally this is demonstrated via an independent audit.

#24 - Equality Impact Assessment: Conduct and publish an Equality Impact Assessment of the proposals, including mitigations where the proposals either exacerbate historic discriminatory impacts, or generate new ones.
#26 - Mid-consultation stocktake: Ofgem to do a mid-consultation stocktake, which should include amendments to the proposals based on staff feedback.
We’ll aim to get something in the diary before the end of the week to report back on these discussions and agree our next steps.
Best,
Laura

PCS - Mid-consultation response to Ofgem [OFFICIAL Internal Only],"Dear members,

Now that we are entering the second half of the consultation period, we believe that the time for clarifying and explaining is over, and we now need to see some meaningful changes to the OD proposals. Ofgem cannot hold off on this until after the consultation period is over, because unless we see the OD proposals change in real time in response to staff feedback, meaningful consultation and dialogue is impossible. To kickstart this process, we sent our provisional PCS consultation response to HR and ExCo yesterday. This response covers 28 concrete recommendations on how to change the proposals, based on your input and feedback. We have asked Ofgem to respond to each of these points by 11 August, so that there is time left for further dialogue afterwards.

Because you were instrumental in putting this together, you of course also deserve to see the end product. So we have attached our letter to Ofgem. It’s comprehensive and hence a bit long, so if you just want to know what the 28 recommendations are, you can jump to the annex. Of course, we would like all staff about this as well. So while we remain banned from the Wire (boo!), we do encourage you to forward this to colleagues.

column1: Restructure News

Yesterday some of the Branch Committee met with our CEO Jonathan Brearley, you will have received an email outlining the points we selected from our mid-consultation letter for discussion. As a reminder these included:
#1 – Real Living Wage
#4 – Comprehensive grade mapping
#7 – Expert & Managerial paths
#15 - Role assessments
#21 - Corporate services capability
#24 - Equality Impact Assessment
#26 - Mid-consultation stocktake

Look out for an event in your calendar for us to feed back to you about the discussions and agree our next steps. We also emailed out all current responses we have received to your questions gathered during the workshops.
As a reminder our mid-point survey is still live, if you haven’t given your views yet, do so by clicking the button below. This is also open to non-members so please share widely!:

Click here to complete our mid-consultation survey <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D7efd86fb58%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cdaa5b06c727f4ecde6b008d95d911e5b%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637643700597174479%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=gwIrN%2FTrpGqBU3DrXGYeMvq9LPXaWQ5AEJpUvZwtQeY%3D&reserved=0>

column1: Branch News
BEC Update

column2: Our Treasurer (Evan), Green Rep (Sammie Wood) and Equalities Officer (Cheral) joined the joint negotiating committee to discuss pay, environmental and equality issues. The letters sent to Ofgem detailing the environmental and equalities issues discussed were emailed to you yesterday and do read these and feedback to us if you have any comments! As we work with Ofgem to action the issues you’ll hear back on our progress as we go.

We have also provided further comment on Ofgem’s proposed new ‘Hybrid Working Policy’, but are pushing back against pressure to agree to the current draft while the OD consultation is also still ongoing.

Cheral has also written a Wellbeing Wednesday <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Debedaa1ca2%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cdaa5b06c727f4ecde6b008d95d911e5b%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637643700597194392%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=k%2BkGs9J2ayuhXBr6CGQYFKSN2LcjehElghyaKjsY76g%3D&reserved=0>  piece published the Wire, thanks to the Mental Health Network for their great pieces as of late. The article focuses on the power of “Strength in Numbers” and we hope you enjoy reading if you manage to!

column1: Rep’s still needed!

Throughout the Organisational Transition Consultation and beyond, both members and non-members will have questions and queries important to them. It is more important than ever to ensure that everyone in the organisation feels heard and we are always in need of volunteers to act as local reps to continue to spread our message and encourage more people to join the union! If interested in becoming a local rep for your Team please contact us by emailing PCS@ofgem.gov.uk <mailto:PCS@ofgem.gov.uk>  or by contacting Frank Hemmes.
Campaigns & News
PCS responds to inaccurate media reports about civil servants and returning to the office

Throughout the unprecedented global Covid-19 pandemic, PCS has always prioritised the safety of its members. At the height of the pandemic which led to more than 150,000 deaths in the UK alone, we came up with 5 safety tests <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D1de9a51470%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cdaa5b06c727f4ecde6b008d95d911e5b%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637643700597204346%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=GZ68nIPkeFZ8rN8AGH4Y%2FnbrxikrD7q6TzEh7Me3O60%3D&reserved=0>  and negotiated homeworking for the majority of our members. Where civil servants could not work from home and attended the workplace, both sets of workers have indeed served the public and kept society functioning. PCS firmly disagrees with some journalists comments about hardworking and diligent civil servants as somehow “shirking” or “twiddling their thumbs” because they are currently working from home. Read on here. <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D3548cf862d%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cdaa5b06c727f4ecde6b008d95d911e5b%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637643700597204346%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=V8ogp1pDvfuxIFIO3IM48W1eRy%2Bx8ql9BhheDM5%2FGCY%3D&reserved=0>
PCS warns of action if ministers try to cut pay of civil servants over office opening

Anonymous briefings over the weekend to the press have suggested civil servants' pay could be docked if staff refuse to return to the office. Responding to the reports, a PCS spokesman said: ""It is the height of cowardice for ministers to anonymously brief the media about docking civil servants' pay for not returning to the office. Read further in this article <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D5a015f5b40%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cdaa5b06c727f4ecde6b008d95d911e5b%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637643700597214303%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=ueBZ8ICQlR%2F6Xt6XwewfdDD5DYrf%2Bsgj1jdNwsGVw%2B4%3D&reserved=0> .
Help support Royal Parks workers taking strike action

PCS members working for Just Ask Services at the Royal Parks are going on strike from 16 to 30 August. They are demanding no job losses (current plans are that a third of them be made redundant) and that their sick pay and other terms and conditions be the same as those employed directly by the Royal Parks. In taking strike action, these low paid workers are making a real financial sacrifice. PCS is providing strike pay but each extra pound raised <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D9e706c9dbf%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cdaa5b06c727f4ecde6b008d95d911e5b%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637643700597214303%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=%2BCDr6P2rzFMau%2Bbfun27LWYpMYZ9ZMyuw1IdXl2q7y4%3D&reserved=0>  helps lessen the losses our members face. We have also set up our own paypal pool <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D9d869a8f80%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cdaa5b06c727f4ecde6b008d95d911e5b%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637643700597214303%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=EMfNSjtt4CkENq%2F2rg1PcPbQ4zcg5iZavQ%2ByTkgVyAY%3D&reserved=0>  if you are able to and would like to contribute to our branch collection for the strike fund.
Events
Neurodiversity in the Workplace Stage 1 –  8-9 September
register on PCS Digital or ask us how!

Some people are autistic, dyslexic, dyspraxic, ADHD, or another atypical condition. PCS fights for all members - especially those who face disadvantage and discrimination in the workplace, and in wider society. Opportunities need to be widened and support strengthened, not cut back under the excuse of 'austerity'.
Sign up for out two day course and become a PCS Neurodiversity Champion. If you have any queries about this course, please contact us at organising@pcs.org.uk <mailto:organising@pcs.org.uk> .
Entertaining the children on a budget

The summer holidays can be expensive when you have kids. The cost of holidays, days out and extra childcare all add up. PCS has put together some links on how you can find inexpensive, fun and often educational activities for your kids. Not every idea will work at every age or with every child, but hopefully you will find a few things that will work for you and your kids. Click here for some summer holiday ideas for you and your family! <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D0d2c34522f%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cdaa5b06c727f4ecde6b008d95d911e5b%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637643700597224254%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=Y7MNeViNeJdoQN1gttywS0tXl0%2Bg8imt6gzcuW1q3u4%3D&reserved=0>

column1: Branch News
Restructure News

This week we held OD workshops aimed at Bands A:C, and D separately, as well as a D&I specific one and it was great to see many of you in attendance and sharing honest thoughts and concerns - if you ever have additional comments feel free to email the inbox or contact the BEC.

Now we are at the mid-way point of the consultation we have sent 28 recommendations of improvement for the OD proposals and a copy of the letter has been sent to all members and the network chairs too – check you inbox and feel free to distribute within your teams.

The mid-point survey is still live, please share with colleagues and fill it out if you haven't had a chance to do so yet. PCS mid-consultation stocktake <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D69433bab50%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cec70f55b310f40026a7f08d958c7e078%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637638437760241709%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=%2FyKpKBWkUcOb8GpAGVATjOMA%2FOk9FegpUTyKPRt5Sbc%3D&reserved=0> .
Restructure hot or not

column2: Hot: Getting on with your work because your team now has all the staff and skills it needs through flexible resourcing.
Not: Not actually getting on with your work because Ofgem is chronically understaffed and we just end up moving vacancies around.

column1: Rep’s Needed

Throughout the Organisational Transition Consultation and beyond, both members and non-members will have questions and queries important to them. It is more important than ever to ensure that everyone in the organisation feels heard and we need volunteers to act as local reps to continue to spread our message and encourage more people to join the union! If interested in becoming a local rep for your Team please contact us by emailing PCS@ofgem.gov.uk <mailto:PCS@ofgem.gov.uk>  or by contacting Frank Hemmes.
BEC Update
As you would expect, most of our time is going into the OD right now. But that doesn’t mean we’re sitting still on other matters of importance. Here is what else is going on this week:

column2: Environment: We are rebooting our campaign to make Ofgem itself more sustainable. We have written to Ofgem, reminding them of our ideas on how to reduce Ofgem’s environmental footprint so we can lead by example, and asking to reboot the Sustainability Working Group. If you’re interested in being a part of this, get in touch with Samanta Wood.

Equality: We have also written to Ofgem asking for an update on the equality initiatives we were progressing before the pandemic. This includes initiatives on domestic abuse, support for terminally ill employees and free provision of period products. But we have also updated this to include newer demands, such as for Ofgem to share the Equal Group review of our D&I strategy, and introduce ‘reasonable adjustment passports’. If you want to know more, speak to Cheral Govind.

Flexible working: With the OD going on, you’d think Ofgem had enough on their hands. And yet, they are also looking to revisit the flexible/smart working policy. We don’t mind this, but we want to do this right and consult you on what you think. So rather than slapping a few comments on a draft in a matter of days, we have asked for this work to be delayed until the OD has progressed and we have more time.

column1: Campaigns & News
Royal Parks strike fund collection

Outsourced cleaning staff at the Royal Parks, represented by both PCS and UWV, are taking strike action on 30 July to get equal pay and rights with directly employed workers. At the moment, outsourced workers, who are predominantly BAME, are on second rate contracts compared to the Royal Parks' own workforce. Your contribution will help strikers recover from loss ofpay. More information, and the option to make a donation directly, is available here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dbb33b178e4%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cec70f55b310f40026a7f08d958c7e078%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637638437760246682%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=V0gTHzT5r2cpONHdAbngm9vlhRX1ByHnhGWAuYlrBwI%3D&reserved=0> .

87% of Scottish Government workers support a four-day week
Most workers want to see a four-day working week pilot implemented across all business areas of Scottish Government, according to a scoping project of more than 2000 employees.

These results are included in a new report out last week from the independent think-tank Autonomy and supported by PCS in Scotland. You can read more about this here. <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dacd2fe4ac5%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cec70f55b310f40026a7f08d958c7e078%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637638437760256638%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=ZG%2FO3h0Ywsf58ZeG%2FRq5wGjmKVAHLYTdvjv9%2BDT4n8g%3D&reserved=0>

OD Consultation - Further PCS engagement with Ofgem [OFFICIAL Internal Only],"Good afternoon everyone,

We’re staying strong on the engagement with Ofgem, and have fired two more formal letters their way this week. As always we think you should have sight of what we do, so they’re attached for you to have a read through, and you are free to share them with colleagues as well. In this case, we allied ourselves with the FDA and jointly submitted the letters. What they cover is respectively:

column2: Our contention that Ofgem has not adequately demonstrated the need for staff in managerial roles to reapply for their jobs, and that we expect Ofgem to deal with this to comply with trade union legislation and civil service protocols.
The request to conclude and publish the Equality Impact Assessment on the proposals as soon as possible, given the risk of existing inequalities being baked into the new structure from the start.

column1: We are however concerned that we are now running out of time for Ofgem to address both issues while still allowing meaningful consultation, so we also call for the OD consultation to be either delayed or extended, maybe partially, to give us all more time to work through these critical elements.
As always, if you have any questions, do not hesitate to contact us.
Cheerio,
Frank
PS. Unfortunately we have not yet received a detailed response to our 28 recommendations, so sadly no update there. We will let you know as soon as we have it.
[Internal Only]

column1: Restructure concerns and survey
column2: We would also like to ask members to share their specific concerns with us as it helps us give specific examples in our discussions with Ofgem. Please send us your concerns to  PCS@ofgem.gov.uk <mailto:PCS@ofgem.gov.uk> .

column1: Restructure News

We are now about to enter the last week of the consultation. You will hopefully have seen the further letters we sent Ofgem, jointly with the FDA, to express concern about the absence of en Equalities Impact Assessment so far, and the need to mitigate against potential redundancies. You can share those letters with your colleagues. We have been promised a response, plus also a response to our 28 recommendations, by the end of this week.

It is fair to say that we are disappointed with where we are at this moment. Crucial details of the proposals have not been provided, and we had expected to see more examples of how the proposals changed in response to your feedback. We will consider all this as we draft our final consultation response next week.

Wire: Following further engagement with Ofgem and Comms, we believe we now have an arrangement where we can again publish on the Wire via Comms, just like everyone else at Ofgem. We hope to get a number of articles up next week about the work we’ve been doing during the consultation, so watch this space!

Pay: We have received the pay offer for this year from Ofgem. As we expected, it adheres closely to the Treasury Pay Remit, which imposes a pay freeze across the civil service. In the absence of much room to negotiate, and with the OD going on at the same time, the BEC has decided we will not ballot members this year and instead formulate our response informed by the overall position of the union.

column1: Rep’s still needed!

Throughout the Organisational Transition Consultation and beyond, both members and non-members will have questions and queries important to them. It is more important than ever to ensure that everyone in the organisation feels heard and we are always in need of volunteers to act as local reps to continue to spread our message and encourage more people to join the union! If interested in becoming a local rep for your Team please contact us by emailing PCS@ofgem.gov.uk <mailto:PCS@ofgem.gov.uk>  or by contacting Frank Hemmes.
Campaigns & News
Remembering the slave trade and its abolition (23rd August 2021)

PCS supports the International Day for the Remembrance of the Slave Trade and its abolition. PCS campaigns against the legacy of slavery and work to continue to fight against the rise of racism in our workplaces and wider society. To read more on the Remembrance please read on here. <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D2679119ada%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cddd68105933146c730d708d963a68a71%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637650389217724831%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=TJmN1nh12q4iU0ruXVfwqr6XA29Ef6BPa482bpfQTq4%3D&reserved=0>
Call for Ministers to accept refugees from Afghanistan

As the situation in Afghanistan has becoming increasingly concerning for the safety and well being of the Afghan people. It has been requested by MP’s and charities that the UK government resettles at least 20,000 Afghan over the next 2 years (in addition to those already being evacuated under the Aghan Relocations and Assistance Policy). The government announced yesterday the acceptance of only 5,000 refugees over the next year, with 15,000 over future years. The charity Safe Passage (who spoke with Ofgem for World Refugee Day) has called for people to send an email to their MP to show the gravity of the situation. For further information and to send an customisable email to your local MP click here. <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D76e22b82d9%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cddd68105933146c730d708d963a68a71%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637650389217724831%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=AUv2dldrl8xGIx%2F0xr9bQaFKLo7SueTvmvtNGeNCaaA%3D&reserved=0>
Help support Royal Parks workers taking strike action

PCS members working for Just Ask Services at the Royal Parks are going on strike from 16 to 30 August. They are demanding no job losses (current plans are that a third of them be made redundant) and that their sick pay and other terms and conditions be the same as those employed directly by the Royal Parks. In taking strike action, these low paid workers are making a real financial sacrifice. PCS is providing strike pay but each extra pound raised <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Da494f9f4e9%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cddd68105933146c730d708d963a68a71%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637650389217734785%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=M92Aefw9u8z4pJLshbPhR7WVCM95yGGbqYVH5s6TA1M%3D&reserved=0>  helps lessen the losses our members face. PCS Analysis of the proposed pay increments [OFFICIAL Internal Only],"Good morning everyone,

With only a few days left in the OD consultation, we want to share with you our analysis of different scenarios for the proposed in-grade pay increments. We had hoped that Ofgem would have given us a sneak preview of the likely value of the increments by now, but lacking that, we’ve just gone ahead and had our own look at it.

In our provisional response to the consultation we recommended that Ofgem set the in-grade increments at one third of the pay span for a grade (the difference between the minimum and maximum wage). Now that we have conducted our analysis, we are even more convinced that this is the most sensible option. Our analysis suggests that if the increments are set much lower, for example at 10% of the pay span, the overall reduction in grades will actually lead to worse outcomes for staff, especially over the longer term.

I’m mindful that we have a lot of very experienced economists and other analysists in our membership. So if after reading this you think we’ve missed a trick or got it totally wrong, please do be in touch before we submit our final response on Friday ??
We encourage everyone to share this document with teams and colleagues.
While you’re here

We have made good progress in getting a local rep in many teams in Ofgem, but we’re still a way off from having one in every team. If you’re looking at an ‘entry level’ way to get involved in PCS, this is most certainly the role for you. If you’re interested, please contact Frank Hemmes.

We had hoped that Ofgem would have given us a sneak preview of the likely value of the increments by now, but lacking that, we’ve just gone ahead and had our own look at it.

In our provisional response to the consultation we recommended that Ofgem set the in-grade increments at one third of the pay span for a grade (the difference between the minimum and maximum wage). Now that we have conducted our analysis, we are even more convinced that this is the most sensible option. Our analysis suggests that if the increments are set much lower, for example at 10% of the pay span, the overall reduction in grades will actually lead to worse outcomes for staff, especially over the longer term.

I’m mindful that we have a lot of very experienced economists and other analysists in our membership. So if after reading this you think we’ve missed a trick or got it totally wrong, please do be in touch before we submit our final response on Friday ??
We encourage everyone to share this document with teams and colleagues.

PCS member engagement summary [OFFICIAL Internal Only],"Hi all,
Hope you’re doing well.

Attached is a summary of all written responses and session notes we’ve gathered from you over the course of the past two months. It’s from this input that we’ve pulled together our mid-consultation and final responses from the union, with the latter due in your inboxes tomorrow. Thank you once again for putting forward your thoughts so eloquently! It’s really helped us make our messages heard.

You may have also noticed that a number of directors have been sharing and supporting our mid-consultation response. Please do share the final letter with your colleagues/managers if you’re comfortable doing so.

A further side note: although formal consultation may have come to an end, we’ve agreed with Ofgem to continue weekly OD engagement to stay on top of progress. We’ll continue to report back in the weekly newsletter.
Best,
Laura Hutton
