column1: Restructure News

PCS’ mid consultation response to the organisational design proposals <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D896f6b161c%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C0e1da8a2ead3494e8c1a08d9695b438a%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637656662972533367%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=IDqOyTqUQusu4Ps0Fcn6i9A2UZfr59tPnTQh6X8Shf8%3D&reserved=0> ?

Public and Commercial Services Union (PCS) have undertaken extensive membership engagement and drafted our mid-consultation response covering the topics that are important to you. We shared this response with Ofgem on 3 August to inform the second part of the consultation and trust it will carefully consider this, as it has committed to do with all staff feedback received until the end of the consultation period.

We have provided constructive feedback where we believe the proposals can be enhanced and sought further clarification where we think more detail would benefit members' understanding of the proposals. We will continue to engage with members and will provide a full consultation response as the consultation draws to a close.

We have provided 28 suggestions and questions to Ofgem, which are outlined here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dc891f45d47%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C0e1da8a2ead3494e8c1a08d9695b438a%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637656662972533367%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=9LcUoVrlJZKOHkZSQFt6fy%2F3hAia6TnGglCsosxyvTY%3D&reserved=0> .

BEC Update

First off we are still very busy managing the response to the OD Transformational programme which is really tanking the time we have available for wider Union matters. If there are people out there with capacity to get involved then please let us know because support would be really welcome.

Other than that we are pleased to say that we are back on the Wire <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D5a10a2a1bc%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C0e1da8a2ead3494e8c1a08d9695b438a%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637656662972553282%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=a5GPw2vGZPdVIttIQo%2FjrsniTIkTBaGt9rrXC11FMDM%3D&reserved=0> , although we are still engaged in negotiations on how visible this will be, with Comms not entirely keen on putting our articles on the home page.
Rep’s still needed!

Throughout the Organisational Transition Consultation and beyond, both members and non-members will have questions and queries important to them. It is more important than ever to ensure that everyone in the organisation feels heard and we are always in need of volunteers to act as local reps to continue to spread our message and encourage more people to join the union! If interested in becoming a local rep for your Team please contact us by emailing PCS@ofgem.gov.uk <mailto:PCS@ofgem.gov.uk>  or by contacting Frank Hemmes.
Campaigns & News
Call for Ministers to accept refugees from Afghanistan

As the situation in Afghanistan has becoming increasingly concerning for the safety and well being of the Afghan people. It has been requested by MP’s and charities that the UK government resettles at least 20,000 Afghan over the next 2 years (in addition to those already being evacuated under the Aghan Relocations and Assistance Policy). The government announced yesterday the acceptance of only 5,000 refugees over the next year, with 15,000 over future years. The charity Safe Passage (who spoke with Ofgem for World Refugee Day) has called for people to send an email to their MP to show the gravity of the situation. For further information and to send an customisable email to your local MP click here. <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dd84b2ffe63%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C0e1da8a2ead3494e8c1a08d9695b438a%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637656662972553282%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=pUKTe%2BG3IJiT7rGiJ4XMeDHGm5RqU%2FMi7CdmFdnB7hQ%3D&reserved=0>
Royal Parks: First week of strike action ends on a high

After a week of industrial action, workers at Just Ask remain determined to win. Planning more campaign activities next week, ending in a large public protest on bank holiday monday. The strike is over 6 issues, the key ones being possible staffing cuts later this year and winning the same sick pay as staff who are directly employed by the Royal Parks.

People can support the Just Ask strikers by supporting any of the below events, or contributing to their strike fund. <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Db2a963907b%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C0e1da8a2ead3494e8c1a08d9695b438a%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637656662972563231%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=AvEp3Yv96KZYD2kVb6%2FvlwoEBoaVyC1qEnXY%2F3eDQrY%3D&reserved=0>

PCS A to Z: Anti-racist and anti-fascist campaigning

Each week we are going through the alphabet with the PCS A to Z to look at why government workers should join and get involved in PCS – A is for our anti-racism and anti-fascism campaign work. PCS has a proud history of campaigning against racism and fascism <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D1c7c59a1da%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C0e1da8a2ead3494e8c1a08d9695b438a%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637656662972563231%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=B%2F4rTgjNfSzcBgaYupW0pPjDbXd9%2FkqmY4qU7qNjgjQ%3D&reserved=0>  and it is our agreed policy to oppose racist and fascist organisations in our workplaces and communities.

Where individuals are found to be union members and exhibit values that are racist or fascistic, members should report individuals to their branch officers and seek advice from their PCS headquarters official or the equality department. As part of our anti-racism and anti-fascism strategy where reps believe racist/fascist behaviour and actions are occurring in the workplace, such issues should be raised with management at the appropriate level.

Each workplace represented by PCS, whether in the core civil service or in the commercial sector should have an appropriate departmental or employer code. This should include equality provision with discrimination and harassment policies derived from the civil service code of conduct.

TUC Congress 2021
Congress is a key moment for trade unionists to connect with one another, to set the TUC’s agenda for the year, and to showcase the contribution and importance of trade unionism.
Due to Covid, congress will take place online this year.
Congress sessions will be:

column2: Sunday, 12 September, 2-4pm
Monday, 13 September, 9.30am-12.30pm and 2.30-5pm
Tuesday, 14 September, 9.30am-12.30pm.

PCS final OD consultation response and Ofgem pay 'offer' [OFFICIAL Internal Only],"Good morning everyone,

As the OD consultation drew to a close last Friday, the PCS branch executive submitted our final response. It did not change massively compared to our mid-consultation response, and we stand by our original 28 recommendations. In this final response, we have however focused more on items that are particularly urgent, important, or where disagreement with Ofgem remains. We have been promised continued engagement while Ofgem is digesting the responses to the consultation, and we will keep you informed about what comes out of this.

At the same time, we have also engaged with Ofgem on this year’s pay ‘offer’. Which isn’t really an offer as such as Ofgem is bound by the civil service wide pay freeze instituted by Treasury. This means no pay adjustment for everyone earning over £24,000, and a small increase of up to £250 for workers earning less than that. Of course, with inflation not at 0%, this means an effective pay cut for most of us, on top of the below-inflation pay adjustments we have had over the last decade. Ofgem will still pay performance payments, in the same way as last year. This means performance pay for both ‘achievers’ and ‘high performers’, with Bands A-C getting a bit more relatively.
While you’re here

column2: If you’ve been wondering what’s happened to our weekly newsletter, it may be going into your spam folder. We’ve not made any progress yet with IT on solving this issue, so for now, you will have to tell Outlook that our newsletter isn’t junkmail if you want it to go into your inbox.

We are making good progress on getting local PCS ambassadors in each portfolio in Ofgem, but there are a lot of teams that don’t have one yet. If you’re interested in a low key way of helping us build the union, this is probably the role for you. Interested? Then get in touch with Frank Hemmes.

column1: Restructure News & Survey

PCS’ final consultation response to the organisational design proposals <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D0ba1a7fece%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C5e16f0dca9a5473b6cbb08d96eb10327%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637662528824681574%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=JaDDEjrJrk518zKucNHkkwAdpA5qZNZ1kBe7enW4cTs%3D&reserved=0>

?As the consultation closed last week, we submitted our final response, based on the extensive engagement we’ve had a union branch. The focus of the final response was on urgent changes that are needed, and where we disagree with the proposals. We’ve also undertaken analysis of the new pay levels and sub-levels, and concluded that the sub-level steps (2a/b/c etc.) need to be set at at least 25% of the pay level to see any benefit from the current pay progression structure.

Engagement will continue while Ofgem looks through the masses of feedback they’ve received from you. This means there is an opportunity for us to feed in how staff are feeling about the proposals now that the consultation has ended. To this end, we’re running another survey, similar to the mid-consultation one, to see how you feel about the proposals, what your expectations are going forward, and which changes you really want or don't want to see. You can complete it here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D8a08253f98%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C5e16f0dca9a5473b6cbb08d96eb10327%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637662528824681574%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=l%2F40jZKHAU9n9XerNLTwLLfAnGEfbqkGr2FLONVw6Wc%3D&reserved=0> , and please also share it with non-member colleagues. The results of the mid-consultation survey are on the Wire here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dc91f397639%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C5e16f0dca9a5473b6cbb08d96eb10327%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637662528824691566%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=mkkmWDNn6s2ux6UcfPtoIMNYYXXmdA4V8K8OU6Le1ro%3D&reserved=0> .

Consultancy Fees
McKinsey & Co – transformation programme consultancy

Ofgem has spent a grand total of £750,000 on McKinsey’s consultancy services supporting the transformation programme since March 2021. This is vast sum of money on consultancy which has produced, as is widely agreed, an OD proposal severely lacking detail. We’re going back to HR to try and understand the work completed and how the rationale for the OD was put together. Watch this space.

For those interested, the breakdown of all consultancy fees over £25,000 in a month paid by Ofgem is publicly available here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D0482f23a3c%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C5e16f0dca9a5473b6cbb08d96eb10327%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637662528824701560%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=tpCrl2oRe%2FVOUpjZfwIPABmaQWi36t2BKJP%2Bbx3bWyE%3D&reserved=0> .
Pay Remit
The pay remit has been confirmed for 2020-21 pay. This information is for PCS members only, and shouldn’t be circulated.

Unfortunately, Ofgem are bound by the Treasury pay freeze, meaning there are no adjustments for colleagues base pay for anyone earning over £24,000. With inflation not at 0%, that’s effectively a pay cut. Central PCS are do not agree with Treasury over the pay freeze, and effectively PCS Ofgem branch have stated that we expressly do not agree with the proposal, though appreciate that it will be taken forwards.
For those earning less than £24,000, there is an underpin salary increase of £250.
For performance related pay, the same proposal as last year was presented, which is differentiates by pay band, meaning bands A-C see a slightly higher percentage bonus than bands D and E:

column2: Bands A-C: 5% of actual salaries for ‘High Performing’, and 2.5% of actual salaries for ‘Achieving’
Bands D-E: 4% of actual salaries for ‘High Performing’, and 2% of actual salaries for ‘Achieving’

column1: Branch News
BEC Update
BEC Update

First off we are still very busy managing the OD Transformational programme which is really tanking the time we have available for wider Union matters. If there are people out there with capacity to get involved then please let us know because support would be really welcome.

Other than that we are pleased to say that we are back on the Wire, although we are still engaged in negotiations on how visible this will be, with Comms not entirely keen on putting our articles on the home page.
Rep’s still needed!

Throughout the Organisational Transition Consultation and beyond, both members and non-members will have questions and queries important to them. It is more important than ever to ensure that everyone in the organisation feels heard and we are always in need of volunteers to act as local reps to continue to spread our message and encourage more people to join the union! If interested in becoming a local rep for your Team please contact us by emailing PCS@ofgem.gov.uk <mailto:PCS@ofgem.gov.uk>  or by contacting Frank Hemmes.
Campaigns & News
PCS Welcomes the first female General Secretary of Unite
PCS general secretary Mark Serwotka has written to Sharon Graham to congratulate her on her general secretary election victory and becoming the first woman to lead Unite.
Mark’s letter to Sharon says:
“Workers up and down the country need unions like never before and I have no doubt that under your leadership, Unite will be ready to face the challenges ahead.

“We share the view that the workers who have kept this country going during the pandemic shouldn’t be the ones who pay the price. It’s clear members of our unions have issues in common and as we navigate the turbulent months and years ahead, I look forward to working with you to strengthen the union movement and empower workers.”
Sharon replaces Len McCluskey, who has been Unite general secretary since 2011.  She was the clear winner in the leadership ballot, with 37.7% of the vote.
DVLA Action: Last Day of Targeted Strike Action
The Strike by Drivers Medical staff ran for the whole of August with strong support.  Staff we chosen strategically to impact backlog reduction and other key roles.
PCS has written to the DVLA’s Chief Executive about the impact of their decision to to avoid the subject for three months, and the impact that has had to the DVLA’s ability to serve the public.

Interestingly, the strike action may have helped reduce the recent massive upsurge in covid cases on site. PCS A to Z: Bullying – How PCS can help.
Each week we are going through the alphabet with the PCS A to Z to look at why government workers should join and get involved in PCS – this week B is for Bullying.
PCS demands that their members have the right to be treated with dignity and respect in a working environment free from bullying, harassment or discrimination.

Unfortunately, bullying takes many forms, all of which are unacceptable, especially in the workplace.  Bullying can vary from obvious abuse to small comments that leave you feeling uncomfortable without quite knowing why, something most of us will experience at some point in our working lives.

Fortunately PCS is always here to help, even if you just want to check in and discuss something that is making you uncomfortable.  Bullying can be a sensitive subject to discuss when it is a part of a workplace relationship so we’re here to listen without judgement and be reassured that PCS will never take further action without your consent.

PCS is currently offerening training on recognising bullying in the workplace, find out about this and other courses available to PCS members here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D8ca336b7b3%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C5e16f0dca9a5473b6cbb08d96eb10327%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637662528824731547%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=E29cuFUPe06MyyeoOrbjeJWeTXEiH0vwZ9MnY2Mo348%3D&reserved=0>

Some people are autistic, dyslexic, dyspraxic, ADHD, or another atypical condition. Opportunities need to be widened and support strengthened, not cut back under the excuse of 'austerity'.

TUC Congress 2021
Congress is a key moment for trade unionists to connect with one another, to set the TUC’s agenda for the year, and to showcase the contribution and importance of trade unionism.
Due to Covid, congress will take place online this year.
Congress sessions will be:

column2: Sunday, 12 September, 2-4pm
Monday, 13 September, 9.30am-12.30pm and 2.30-5pm
Tuesday, 14 September, 9.30am-12.30pm.

column1: Branch News
Well, the BEC is taking a bit of a break after all that exciting OD activity. You can’t write lengthy consultation responses every day, after all. Still, there is enough to report on:

column2: OD: Yes, we are still engaging with Ofgem as they wrestle themselves through the masses of feedback they’ve received. This includes matters such as the challenge process and the new ‘Hybrid Working’ policy.
Wire: Yes, we’re back on the Wire with updates on our environmental and equalities work. More info further down this newsletter, so read on McDuff!

Learning: We’re getting a lot of info now from PCS about various union-run courses and workshops. We will circulate this to the best of our ability, but it remains tricky without a Union Learning Rep. So, if you have always wanted to develop that inner coach of yours, now is the time to tell us ??

Black History Month: Difficult as it is to accept, we’re getting closer to October. So, we have started our thinking on activities for Black History Month, to meet the high bar we’ve set over previous years. If you’d like to be involved, do get in touch with Cheral.
COP26: Likewise, we’re thinking about what activities we can do to coincide with COP26. Our Green Rep Sammie is already full of ideas, but if you have some of our own, let us know!

column1: Post-OD Stocktake

We are still running our survey to understand how you feel now that the formal OD consultation is over, and the outputs of that will feed into our weekly engagement with Ofgem. We’re looking to get a critical mass of responses so that we can share something robust with HR before they complete their analysis of the consultation feedback, so that we can continue to influence the process. We’re well over 50 responses now, but ideally we want to get at least 200. So help us out by completing it, and sharing it with your colleagues.

PCS opposes Universal Credit cut
PCS opposes the removal of the £20 a week uplift of Universal Credit, particularly at a time when unemployment is likely to increase as a result of the end of the furlough scheme.
In real terms, the government intends to cut Universal Credit payments by between 15% and 25% to all claimants at the end of this month.
PCS welcomed the introduction of the uplift in April 2020 as a measure to support people whose income was impacted by the pandemic.

Many thousands of PCS members working in DWP, the government department responsible for the delivery of UC, are paid so poorly that they are forced to claim it. They are subject to a public sector pay freeze so the cut in UC, the increase in National Insurance payments on top of the pay freeze will mean that they will take three separate hits from the government in a short space of time.

PCS Restarts discussions on Environmental and Carbon impact items

As most of us are aware, our world is deteriorating due to mankind's abuse of fossil fuels and the destruction of our planet's natural resources. Being the energy regulator with a key role in net zero, Ofgem should look to reduce its own carbon footprint as much as possible.
As such PCS as looking for Ofgem to make firm commitments on how it will do this.

As always, PCS welcome any comments you may have and our pcs@ofgem.gov.uk inbox is always open. In addition to this restarting of discussions, our Green Rep (Sammie) has created a Yammer community for any eco-minded colleagues to discuss any and all things climate and sustainability related, open to all, so feel free to see what we're up to and join us here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D73356d6726%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C943ddd6e09344d697ad008d9743abdc9%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637668617925690445%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=9IJFFhxxPs4olPvMf32%2ByAvylElrwrYxzcuzCJ7pzNk%3D&reserved=0> .

Unions write to health secretary over job losses
At least 20% of staff at the Medicines and Healthcare Products Regulatory Agency (MHRA), which licenses Covid-19 vaccines in the UK, are threatened with job cuts.

PCS General Secretary Mark Serwotka has written a joint letter with the general secretaries of Prospect, FDA, UCU and the assistant general secretary of Unite, to Sajid Javid, secretary of state for health and social care.

This is in response to the announcement of staff cuts of at least 20% at MHRA. Lots of MHRA staff are actually our ‘neighbours’ in 10SC, and so we will look at what we can do practically to show solidarity with them in any action they take.

TUC Congress 2021

Congress is a key moment for trade unionists to connect with one another, to set the TUC’s agenda for the year, and to showcase the contribution and importance of trade unionism. Due to Covid, congress will take place online this year.
Congress sessions will be:

column2: Sunday, 12 September, 2-4pm
Monday, 13 September, 9.30am-12.30pm and 2.30-5pm
Tuesday, 14 September, 9.30am-12.30pm.

column1: Unions will nominate delegates to participate at congress. Delegates will be contacted separately about the registration process from their union.
In addition to union delegates, anyone is welcome to observe all the open sessions of congress live on the TUC website.

column1: Branch News
Post-OD Stocktake

We are still running our survey to understand how you feel now that the formal OD consultation is over, and the outputs of that will feed into our weekly engagement with Ofgem. We’re looking to get a critical mass of responses so that we can share something robust with HR before they complete their analysis of the consultation feedback, so that we can continue to influence the process. We’re well over 50 responses now, but ideally we want to get at least 200. So help us out by completing it, and sharing it with your colleagues.

Yes, I’ll give you a piece of my mind <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D4be664bb0c%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cacca4223837841b48be608d9790f2816%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637673928277450783%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=qYdHRnZiz0f7KvqdtGjyWeqYNaPqRqhg1nBSohQ47x8%3D&reserved=0>
Campaigns and news
Unions must work together to fight cuts

PCS General Secretary Mark Serwotka told an online People’s Assembly pre-TUC Congress rally at lunchtime that unions must come together to fight racism, inequality, the climate emergency, and cuts to pay and pensions.

Sarah Woolley, general secretary of the Bakers, Food and Allied Workers' Union, said there has “never been a more critical time to come together and fight back. Claps don’t pay the bills and a minimum wage of £15, decent sick pay and ending of zero-hours contracts would go some way to rewarding key workers,” she said.

She urged workers to: “Organise your workplace and your community to grow our movement and improve the lives of our movement and our class.” To read the article in full please see here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dab5e0f3f8d%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cacca4223837841b48be608d9790f2816%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637673928277450783%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=zB%2FsYaiZJ%2FNAQNXNHvaaTbkkK9l%2BJs6%2BLXxnBFU9j%2F4%3D&reserved=0> .
Tackling structural and systematic racism

?Further action and campaigning are agreed by the TUC to deal with the continuing racism within our institutions. Motion 45: Tackling the widespread epidemic of structural and systematic racism <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dd75e9fc7a7%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cacca4223837841b48be608d9790f2816%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637673928277450783%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=N4KhSSJ4ZIgEiikRCC2Pe%2FTzbV7YF9jyGcly%2FHunI74%3D&reserved=0>  was moved by Susan Matthews of the TUC Black Workers Conference. Congress called on the General Council to support unions to ensure the health, safety and welfare of Black workers are taken seriously and supported as a collective issue and not individualised.

It also called for a campaign to change the national curriculum to include Black history, the slave trade and the colonial empire and its impact and to campaign for the under-representation of black people in political life. And employers should be required to conduct regular mandatory equality impact assessments. Read more about the motion here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dcdc04aa1d7%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cacca4223837841b48be608d9790f2816%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637673928277460776%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=m6TC43ibo5L6KB9dOCwVKplw96eld9tMy8XQsGTrOlg%3D&reserved=0> .
Defending democracy, trade unions and the right to protest

Congress resolves to campaign to prevent further attacks on our rights including the repeal of all anti-trade union laws. The motion attacks on our rights: defend democracy, trade unions and the right to protest <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D8916054cb6%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cacca4223837841b48be608d9790f2816%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637673928277460776%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=7H7iH%2FQP3ua7LgDJhtB9qBvfP%2B9zJhMTG4Myqv1SQkU%3D&reserved=0>  was moved by the FBU and Unite and supported by PCS. The motion warned that “the increasingly authoritarian legislation introduced by the Conservative government poses a threat to the UK’s democracy, and our fundamental civil and human rights”, mentioning in particular the Police, Crime, Sentencing and Courts Bill and the Covert Human Intelligence Sources (Criminal Conduct) Bill. Read on about the motion here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D0c23d535c4%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cacca4223837841b48be608d9790f2816%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637673928277470773%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=c5KNxbNqZSaXMoKD0XyFhb2gjUtE5Rgs0H3gDpj42o8%3D&reserved=0> .
Events
Show Racism the Red Card Workshop – Wednesday 6th October – 5-6.30pm

The PCS Scotland Black members network have organised an anti-racism online workshop on Zoom which will be held by Show Racism the Red Card (SRtRC) - the UK’s leading anti-racist education charity. This workshop will combine engaging activities and thought-provoking discussion points that will empower PCS members with increased knowledge and confidence tackling racism and inequality. It will include:

column2: Key information on recognising racist incidents in the workplace, exploring how to respond most effectively in all workplaces.

Understanding of discrimination, bias, systemic inequality and the barriers they create for Scotland’s workers. See our short-film, Challenging Racism in the Workplace <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dcf772cfbaf%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cacca4223837841b48be608d9790f2816%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637673928277470773%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=bT69A16jonxHknhX2CrsQ4U%2FD647BCUb%2BtPpZ88YVYc%3D&reserved=0> .
Discussion on the ways participants can embed anti-racism into their daily practices.
Knowledge on reporting racism at work and awareness of employer and employee duties in relation to equality, diversity, and inclusion.

Empower – PCS young members’ seminar 2021
Empower, formally known as the annual PCS young members' seminar, will be a one-day event held via Zoom on Saturday 23 October 2021. The seminar will begin at 10am and finish no later than 4pm.

This year the theme is Empowering young workers - rebuilding the young members' network. We will be looking at how young workers positively contribute to organising campaigning and winning in the workplace.

There will be a vibrant and informative agenda with workshops, breakout sessions and guest speakers followed by a social at the end for an opportunity to get to know the network better and have a chat. column1: Branch News
BEC Update

This week your reps met with HR to discuss the new Hybrid Working and Anti-Bullying and Harassment policies…notably after they had already signed off some key details with ExCo, including changes to core working hours. Some of our concerns included the continued reliance on your line manager for the agreement of informal working arrangements, despite the OD consultation’s adamance that there will be far fewer line managers with lots more reportees to look after. Please note that our edits have not yet been accepted, and we have to reserve our comments until the final version is in place.
We also met with our full-time officer at PCS to discuss our plan of action for the outcomes of the OD, and support mechanisms for any casework arising from it.
PCS analysis of proposed in-grade steps

A core element of Ofgem’s OD proposals is to redesign the future grade structure, and to replace advancements with ‘capability-based pay’. Ofgem didn't provide proposals for this, so we published our own analysis and recommendations for in-grade pay steps on the Wire <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3De15ce76676%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C040546db028341788a3e08d97e93b21c%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637679995086427143%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=%2BHEcVOLMrarWrPywVzypa2Pd5zA54SMzaz1JOVaZZh8%3D&reserved=0> . This analysis supports our original recommendation to Ofgem that the pay steps should be set at a third of the pay range for a grade. It also supports the PCS position that your union would not support any progression steps set lower than a quarter of the pay range for a grade which would result in worse pay outcomes for staff, especially over the long term.
Campaigns and news
PCS A to Z Counselling support service

With the current energy crisis, the last couple of weeks have been very stressful for many of you. All of this is on top of the ongoing pandemic. If PCS members feel they need specialist stress counselling and health advice they can access this as part of their membership through our partner Health Assured with a 24-hour helpline and health and wellbeing portal.

As a PCS member if you need advice or support relating to issues in your workplace the first person you get in touch with should always be your rep. You can find out who they are by logging in to PCS Digital <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D04c3f6c337%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C040546db028341788a3e08d97e93b21c%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637679995086437141%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=dGkpivaPwHrd4QrBWPad%2BpfGipgRB1eb%2FwoRY2ocO04%3D&reserved=0> , or on this wire page <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D2bff7ad115%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C040546db028341788a3e08d97e93b21c%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637679995086437141%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=XmUzWzscSONVvoABHi8%2FiU95NOOj7BW9BEcAp1R%2FvJ4%3D&reserved=0> .

column1: Gen Z battles to bring back unions, one Starbucks at a time

Young workers across the United States are reviving trade unionism – go Gen Z! <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D2c268fa9e8%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C040546db028341788a3e08d97e93b21c%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637679995086447140%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=8soo%2BPkwVkhq%2B9uVVOO7LqDzragj8HzwbjPUm6wezdw%3D&reserved=0>  The United States has a long and under-represented history of trade unionism and social justice dating back to the Industrial Revolution. The strong links between the labour movement and civil rights movement led to the end of Jim Crow laws and racial segregation. In recent decades, union membership and organised labour has declined but rates are now bouncing back as young workers, with the backing of the majority of the public, organise to improve working conditions and pay. We love to see it.
Events
Celebrating Black History Month – 4 weekly sessions

Overcoming barriers to under-representation and help with career progression are among the subjects of a series of one-hour events during October to celebrate Black History Month, round off with a Facebook live event.
Sessions organised by the PCS Black Members’ Committee that will be covered are:

column2: 5 October – PCS National Executive Committee black members discussing under-representation and overcoming those barriers.
13 October - Personal lived experience of an inspirational speaker (more details to follow)
21 October – a webinar on the civil service recruitment process – Success Profiles. Help with career progression and applying for roles, run by Iain Hower, Workers’ Educational Association tutor.
28 October – Facebook like event celebrating BHM hosted by the Chair of the NBMC Mohammed Shafiq, with PCS General Secretary Mark Serwotka and PCS President Fran Heathcote.

The fight for union rights at GCHQ

On 25th January 1984, the Conservative Foreign Secretary announced that trade unions would be banned from the Government Communication Headquarters (GCHQ). This decision marked the start of one of the most intensive campaigns for the union movement, especially after 14 workers at GCHQ were sacked after refusing to take a government bribe and give up a basic right at work.
Hear from those involved in the long campaign to restore union rights and reinstate the sacked workers at GCHQ.

Empower – PCS young members’ seminar 2021
Empower, formally known as the annual PCS young members' seminar, will be a one-day event held via Zoom on Saturday 23 October 2021. The seminar will begin at 10am and finish no later than 4pm.

This year the theme is Empowering young workers - rebuilding the young members' network. We will be looking at how young workers positively contribute to organising campaigning and winning in the workplace.

There will be a vibrant and informative agenda with workshops, breakout sessions and guest speakers followed by a social at the end for an opportunity to get to know the network better and have a chat. To sign up follow the links on this page <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D4ec19285d6%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C040546db028341788a3e08d97e93b21c%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637679995086457128%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=RcEiPKTumCsw2ff7uqp12t%2FPB7LRDBxSb7msMfD3NXg%3D&reserved=0> .
Mobilising for COP 26, Tuesday 28th September

COP 26 is scheduled to take place in Glasgow in November – where thousands of dignitaries, diplomats and heads of state will arrive in the city to discuss how to tackle the ongoing crisis of climate change.

Join us on Tuesday 28th of September from 5pm – 6pm to hear from speakers in Scotland about COP 26 and what we can do to mobilise members in support of a green economy which benefits workers and our communities.
Speakers will include Sam Mason, PCS FTO, Stuart Graham from Glasgow Trades Union Council and Francis Stuart, STUC Policy Officer.
This event is open to all members across Scotland and for access to the Zoom link for this event, please contact Alex Lawrie on alex@pcs.org.uk.

PCS updates following today's OD announcement [OFFICIAL Internal Only],"Dear member,

We think you’ll agree that the OD process is an interesting one. Certainly it’s keeping us busy. It’s fair to say we’re disappointed in much of the announcement and the consultation response document HR have written, and have made this clear.
But to let you know about our immediate actions and updates:
Members meeting on Friday 1 October

It’s your union. We want you to inform us on what you want our next step to be. We’ve set up a meeting tomorrow to listen to your thoughts and concerns following today’s announcement, and to define our next steps.
Meeting invite for 12pm should be with you shortly.
New survey live

We’ve set up a new survey to collate your feedback following today’s announcement. This will help us present evidence back to HR/OD. Please share your views, and circulate it to your colleages, PCS member or not.

column1: Branch News
BEC Update
After the All-Staff call on 30th September, BEC are processing the announcements and additional documents. We are currently formulating our immediate response.
Black History Month 2021

The month of October is Black History Month in October, a celebration and remembrance of the African and Caribbean (and for some, also any non-white) diaspora. The month aims to honour the often-unheralded accomplishments of Black Britons throughout history and for any colleagues who joined us after October 2020 Cheral’s wire article <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3De29b6a4924%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C8bd3940ad50d4edaceca08d987d962e1%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637690190011411740%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=LzfG%2BiWo3zWlVX3mx%2B38NDIz0Lak%2Fwj7S6EAdOwGOQ8%3D&reserved=0>  on this last year is a great read!
This year we’re happy to be hosting our own branch events, and signposting to other events ran by Embrace, the national PCS group, and the Civil Service Race Forum.

column2: Cross Network Black History Month Launch: Monday 4th October 10am-2pm a joint event by 13 different civil service race networks (including Ofgem’s own Embrace for the Black, Gay and Proud fireside chat) and fantastic speakers. PCS Show Racism the Red Card Workshop <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D7a1483e794%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C8bd3940ad50d4edaceca08d987d962e1%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637690190011421739%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=OqNLXh%2FI%2FIHkVr%2B8KOAQKAiZOGPvA6Qu1QR4eG%2F8tXo%3D&reserved=0>  - Wed 6th Oct (5 – 6:30pm): Engaging activities and thought-provoking discussion points that will empower participants with increased confidence in challenging racism.

PCS Celebrating Black History Month <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D1bc23bb343%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C8bd3940ad50d4edaceca08d987d962e1%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637690190011421739%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=22lHNTnJjwVkRJZq2JyEPcdhBTw6ULeC2hWSU48iHIk%3D&reserved=0>  – Join the national executive committee Black members in any of 4 weekly sessions as they reflect on BHM, and what the Union is doing to overcome barriers to representation, a webinar on Success Profiles, and more.

In our own branch, we’ll be hosting a “listen to a podcast <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D2dde0fc125%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C8bd3940ad50d4edaceca08d987d962e1%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637690190011431730%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=D26fE3BJPuGa3sxxw6siLoIhNpbX5gUfGzrwe9gZ%2FOY%3D&reserved=0>  and chat” – not just any podcast however, but an interview with the ancestors of a West-Indian born Briton who fought (and succeeded) to become the first non-white train guard at London Euston in 1966. Look out for zoom information in your inboxes soon!

Cheral and some reps will also reflect on environmental racism in hopefully a wire article (especially relevant with COP26 around the corner) and may be welcoming a speaker too so do keep your eyes peeled there too!

Cheral and the gang will also aim to share a BHM resource every day over on our @PCS_Ofgem <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D7d36a2d19a%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C8bd3940ad50d4edaceca08d987d962e1%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637690190011441723%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=A7MRsIE%2B0cUGtrsmOMO1zK7bM1107WpMa4Ku0pKu00c%3D&reserved=0>  Twitter page – any recommendations will be happily taken on board!

PCS A to Z Counselling support service

With the current energy crisis, the last couple of weeks have been very stressful for many of you. All of this is on top of the ongoing pandemic. If PCS members feel they need specialist stress counselling and health advice they can access this as part of their membership through our partner Health Assured with a 24-hour helpline and health and wellbeing portal.

As a PCS member if you need advice or support relating to issues in your workplace the first person you get in touch with should always be your rep. You can find out who they are by logging in to PCS Digital <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D7e394d0116%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C8bd3940ad50d4edaceca08d987d962e1%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637690190011441723%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=UPu6Kc8laY%2FTehywXJoJO1p2jB8g5xd82HG5Q1%2FKOm0%3D&reserved=0> , or on this wire page <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dd1c867b9bb%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C8bd3940ad50d4edaceca08d987d962e1%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637690190011451717%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=ptbUm5A84SbLpKluPZ%2BltD1GueqkhwOQZKyi1Vd4kjc%3D&reserved=0> .

column1: PCS boycotts civil service people survey in MOJ
Following a debate and agreement of motion A8 at the 2021 PCS MOJ Group Conference PCS are recommending that Ministry Of Justice members boycott the civil service people survey.
It is the PCS view that the employer desires a high participation rate to demonstrate that staff engagement is high rather than addressing the issues and concerns highlighted by the survey responses.
Join the Young Members’ National Committee
The PCS National Young Members’ Network is the voice of young workers in PCS.

The work of the network is coordinated and supported by the PCS National Young Members’ Committee (NYMC). The Committee advises, informs and supports the work of branches, groups, regional committees and the NEC on young members’ issues.

The officers of the Committee are elected annually at the young members’ seminar for the post of chair, vice-chair and equality officer. To this end we are seeking nominations from young members across PCS and young members are asked to complete the nomination form on this link: Young members' committee nomination form
Nominations deadline noon on Friday, 15 October.
Should you require any further support, please contact Equality@pcs.org.uk <mailto:Equality@pcs.org.uk>  or Clairem@pcs.org.uk <mailto:Clairem@pcs.org.uk>
Police Spies Out of Lives

The Investigatory Powers Tribunal today handed down its ruling in Kate Wilson’s epic ten-year legal battle over the use of undercover police against protest movements. The detailed, ground-breaking, 156-page ruling identified a “formidable list” of breaches of fundamental human rights by the Metropolitan Police without lawful justification in a democratic society. Read more about it here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D4fd25e928c%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C8bd3940ad50d4edaceca08d987d962e1%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637690190011451717%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=srqH3LkDD8vJWeYshSHXzA7f2ePQBaQ%2BsS4M%2FBCvgf8%3D&reserved=0>
Events
Celebrating Black History Month – 4 weekly sessions

Overcoming barriers to under-representation and help with career progression are among the subjects of a series of one-hour events during October to celebrate Black History Month, round off with a Facebook live event.
Sessions organised by the PCS Black Members’ Committee that will be covered are:

column2: 5 October – PCS National Executive Committee black members discussing under-representation and overcoming those barriers.
13 October - Personal lived experience of an inspirational speaker (more details to follow)
21 October – a webinar on the civil service recruitment process – Success Profiles. Help with career progression and applying for roles, run by Iain Hower, Workers’ Educational Association tutor.
28 October – Facebook like event celebrating BHM hosted by the Chair of the NBMC Mohammed Shafiq, with PCS General Secretary Mark Serwotka and PCS President Fran Heathcote.

Empower – PCS young members’ seminar 2021
Empower, formally known as the annual PCS young members' seminar, will be a one-day event held via Zoom on Saturday 23 October 2021. The seminar will begin at 10am and finish no later than 4pm.

This year the theme is Empowering young workers - rebuilding the young members' network. We will be looking at how young workers positively contribute to organising campaigning and winning in the workplace.

There will be a vibrant and informative agenda with workshops, breakout sessions and guest speakers followed by a social at the end for an opportunity to get to know the network better and have a chat. To sign up follow the links on this page <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D9ff284079d%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C8bd3940ad50d4edaceca08d987d962e1%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637690190011461712%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=1142OC51rgiKXW9E9hVDN9tqYGby%2B3GWlCUpxje%2Bz%2Fo%3D&reserved=0> .

column1: Branch News
BEC Update

Apologies for the small hiatus in newslettering – us authors are as susceptible to some fatigue with everything going on too! Here’s a (rather long but hopefully interesting!) update of what we’ve been up to over the past couple of weeks:
Black History Month 2021

Black History Month is ongoing and hopefully you’ve had chance to scroll our @PCS_Ofgem <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D03f33ca74c%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cd7cb59db92534783d30508d9947d6770%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637704088608220017%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=EEf%2FtCicpGZ43jLTvsMrkmaSR4Q2cmO6jrabfm%2BIDOw%3D&reserved=0>  Twitter page where (near) daily resources are being shared – do feedback on any you’ve enjoyed! Also coming up:

column2: PCS Celebrating Black History Month <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D2301a954b3%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cd7cb59db92534783d30508d9947d6770%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637704088608230012%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=aW%2BJHqWRxVzZFjT5NBNKwObK0Rkj%2BHepFU4%2BDedzwC4%3D&reserved=0>  – Join the national executive committee Black members in any of the weekly sessions as they reflect on BHM with a webinar on the civil service recruitment process (21st Oct)- help with career progression and applying for roles, run by Iain Howie, Workers’ Educational Association tutor. And on the 28th October Join the Facebook live event celebrating BHM hosted by Mohammed Shafiq, chair of the National Black Members Committee alongside PCS general secretary Mark Serwotka and PCS president Fran Heathcote.

In our own branch, we’ll be hosting a “listen to a podcast <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D9c53109c14%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cd7cb59db92534783d30508d9947d6770%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637704088608230012%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=ekSKn4faNNMdLLsWiHG2wrm25aOS1IVqP1d8acUHNV8%3D&reserved=0>  and chat” – not just any podcast however, but an interview with the ancestors of a West -Indian- born Briton who fought – and won – to become the first non-white train guard at London Euston in 1966. Look out for a Zoom invite in your inboxes soon!

column1: Working in Retail?

In the BEC we have seen (and some have experienced!) the high levels of fatigue and stress experienced by our fantastic colleagues in Retail who truly put consumers ahead of themselves. We want all colleagues who are overworked to reach out any time with any comments. Thanks to those who attended our Retail drop ins and for sharing your experiences and concerns. Please share the below tips widely if it would be helpful in your teams:

column2: Log the hours you have been working – this tracker <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D48d62bca3a%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cd7cb59db92534783d30508d9947d6770%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637704088608240007%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=wFgQSfnFCR8e2uac8QJ0gsy0VkfWd0JIpYHF%2BfwjWqs%3D&reserved=0>  is particularly helpful to keep a tally of time spent working over the hours you are meant to, and can help to reconcile flexi/overtime.

The Pay and Reward <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D3d849017d2%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cd7cb59db92534783d30508d9947d6770%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637704088608240007%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=AChmvYIgqbnjwUAvPf9YTPYoGCvckn4Dq1HMPdG4GXg%3D&reserved=0>  policy outlines how to claim overtime, and we wholeheartedly will challenge that the overtime must have required prior authorisation. We encourage colleagues to at least log any overtime on MyHR as Ofgem may not pay for overtime/and it cannot be logged on MyHR if it has been more than three months after the fact.

column1: Organisational Design

Out of everything going on members may enjoy that Ofgem's very own Organisational Design has been mentioned in the news on this page <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dde31167c6e%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cd7cb59db92534783d30508d9947d6770%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637704088608250007%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=MEOxPXbVrXgHc08Vz2w3GCS%2FeMOWrdfuXuiT6RRndT0%3D&reserved=0>  (Under Ofgem self-harm). I feel it captures the mood well and I honestly feel like I could have wrote this myself.
Looking for ‘Local’ organisers

For the last few years Frank has helped out in the PCS ‘Local’ for 10SC, known as the ‘Canary Club’. He is now stepping back, and somewhat quicker than expected because of the situation in Retail. Ofgem has always been one of the more active branches in the Canary Club, and we’d like to keep it that way. So we’re looking for someone who’s enthused about working with other branches to set up activities and support each other across 10SC. If you’re interested or would like to know more, just contact Frank.
Campaigns and news
Blog: Why I'm striking in the Royal Parks

For those not in the know, Royal Parks have been striking after demands for fair sick pay have not been met. The last few weeks have seen numerous attempts in the right-wing press to blame some of the country’s woes, such as the chaos in Afghanistan or the HGV driver shortage, on civil servants. Brutal cut to Universal Credit - PCS demands reversal

On the 6th October we saw the government’s decision to withdraw the £20 uplift to Universal Credit (UC) implemented; a decision that will plunge millions into serious financial hardship and many into poverty. For some of us these cuts are compounded by the current pay freeze, the forecast rise in inflation, and proposed hike in National Insurance contributions from April. All of which will see our members' income significantly reduced. Read on <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D23f1fad1fe%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cd7cb59db92534783d30508d9947d6770%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637704088608279989%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=4vjZUwbZ3Vun7YgdW8beGr6TEJvyZtVZ8eB4zqq6ZYM%3D&reserved=0>  about the effects of these cuts and our call for a reversal.

Empower – PCS young members’ seminar 2021 – THIS SATURDAY

Empower, formally known as the annual PCS young members' seminar, will be a one-day event held via Zoom on Saturday 23 October 2021 for PCS members aged 27 or younger. The seminar will begin at 10am and finish no later than 4pm.

This year the theme is Empowering young workers - rebuilding the young members' network. We will be looking at how young workers positively contribute to organising campaigning and winning in the workplace.

There will be a vibrant and informative agenda with workshops, breakout sessions and guest speakers followed by a social at the end for an opportunity to get to know the network better and have a chat. To sign up follow the links on this page <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D53da66fd63%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cd7cb59db92534783d30508d9947d6770%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637704088608279989%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=x5EVhA3nHoGMPUYvGtjwNCvUoXr3r1v6o8g2W76S%2BIw%3D&reserved=0> .

BEC Update

column2: This week the BEC submitted a Freedom of Information request to Ofgem (available for you to read here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dee7ff5d3bc%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C45f4b08c715345ff393608d99ac58edd%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637710995570737231%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=tfMo7goq7ELKekNUDz3IoHeDNPOUyopU7AizuD2ZUjE%3D&reserved=0> ) seeking publication of the Equal Group's report on the state of Diversity and Inclusion in the organisation, which Ofgem has refused to provide to us in joint negotiations. A near identical FOI submitted by union members over at the Competitions and Markets Authority not long ago was successful in making public its own equalities report (it was not good news).
Otherwise, the BEC has been working through Ofgem's new Anti-Bullying and Harassment Policy. We have many points to debate before we would consider it ready for release.

column1: Update on Equalities Actions:

Following the Equalities Action items we raised with Ofgem <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D2e09cfa889%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C45f4b08c715345ff393608d99ac58edd%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637710995570747226%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=jdBH15oEg8xUbbt%2BAuOYQDy%2FCSCNgSrvAYp%2BiKxQJRY%3D&reserved=0> . We have received responses summarised below:

column2: Implementation of the EIDA best practice: Whilst stating the Domestic Abuse guidance which sign posts to other resources for help and support. Employees may also request special leave for unforeseen circumstances, and we will recommend clarifying that special leave may indeed be used for domestic abuse situations.

Signing up to Dying to Work: Ofgem found they already provide some of the recommendations by the TUC Dying to Work charter – and since existing Civil Service guidance was not advocating centrally signing up to the charter Ofgem will not be taking it further. We will encourage Ofgem to reconsider this.

Provision of period products: This action is complete for now as free period products are available in London and Glasgow offices and supplies to Ofgem staff will be sent to Cardiff staff colleagues. We are thrilled about this as we have called for this pre-pandemic.

Menopause Policy: Ofgem have confirmed they would be happy to engage with PCS guidance when creating a Menopause policy Ofgem are planning to create as part of the Ofgem Health and Wellbeing Strategy. Again we are delighted to move forwards with Ofgem on this to support colleagues.

Disability/Reasonable Adjustment Passport: As our colleagues may be aware, Ofgem will be implementing a Reasonable Adjustment passport as part of the OD. Again we are happy to see this taken forwards as we have similarly called for a disability passport as for some time.

column1: Campaigns and news
PCS’s response to Rishi’s spending review.
Chancellor Rishi Sunak delivered his spending review and budget on Wednesday, promising to level up, grow the economy and lift the public sector pay freeze.

However, Mr Sunak who has been suggesting the freeze would end, produced few details, saying it would be ""fair and affordable"" and that there would be a ""return to the normal independent pay setting process.""

Responding to the Spending Review, PCS general secretary Mark Serwotka said: ""For all the talk of lifting the public sector pay freeze, when it comes to the crunch, the Chancellor has shown his promises are merely fake news. With inflation running at 3.1%, with some forecasts predicting 5% by early 2022, any lifting of pay below that level, is akin to real terms cut. None of today's rhetoric will do anything to alleviate the real economic hardship our members are experiencing every day.”

Read the full response here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D333dca28ce%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C45f4b08c715345ff393608d99ac58edd%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637710995570757220%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=sETXkW1Qg2cM7JgP2XEjf4225Fa2cwl6jjiRBvWOV5Y%3D&reserved=0> .
PCS Celebrates Young Workers Month.

Young Workers' Month in November is a key opportunity for PCS to highlight and campaign on the most important issues for young workers. PCS young members have successfully held their first virtual seminar and will now focus on Young Workers' Month.

This is a great opportunity for PCS to highlight and campaign on the most important issues for young workers, and that is why we are keen to hear from you. This year we focus on organising young workers, young workers' mental health and how the comprehensive spending review will affect PCS young members. We want to hear from PCS members aged 27 years or under, about the issues that affect you in your workplaces.

To find out more and get involved click here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D0f7dfaebb8%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C45f4b08c715345ff393608d99ac58edd%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637710995570757220%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=RJXJ%2BHuopgLHeFd4MTM7iw8MTmp5dv7qKw52Gtq5E1o%3D&reserved=0>  for contact information.
PCS agreed to freeze subscription costs for 2022.

Each year it isn’t uncommon for subscription fees to increase to cover higher costs rising from inflation and to keep the same level of services for members. This year the National Executive Committee have recognised the extremely difficult year many members have experienced, as well as the public sector pay freeze, and have agreed to freeze subscription costs for 2022 <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D5bc5e6101e%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C45f4b08c715345ff393608d99ac58edd%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637710995570767215%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=0uZCAf%2FIR2aXpV5jfdtJD79dCL%2Fd%2Bz5ly0tiIO7MQQs%3D&reserved=0> .

COP26 Global Day of Action.

World leaders meeting in Glasgow from this weekend are failing on the measures needed to tackle climate change, both in the UK and globally. The UK government’s recently published net zero 2050 strategy is meaningless without a plan for how this will be achieved and how they intend to provide protections for workers and communities as we transition to a new decarbonised economy.

To make our demands heard, we are calling on all members to take part, in Covid-safe ways, in the national demonstrations planned in Glasgow and across the country on 6 November. More details on actions near you can be found on the COP26 coalition website <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D5f70015135%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C45f4b08c715345ff393608d99ac58edd%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637710995570767215%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=CE%2F%2FMcmpkxflcV6Mw3fyT18JHecqyQgboxANWrASxRw%3D&reserved=0>  or for more trade union specific information, including trade union blocs on the demonstrations visit the WorkersClimateAction  <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D867f654ea8%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C45f4b08c715345ff393608d99ac58edd%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637710995570777208%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=I2AgvtcLJGDHrrHKleFDPJVOe18TftCfHQplGNHNISs%3D&reserved=0> website.

Birkbeck Free Courses: Management taster course
Tuesday 9 November – Tuesday 7 December 6-7:30pm

This free, online, 5-week programme is for those with an interest in management and business principles who might like to study those subjects at university. All are welcome, regardless of your previous educational experience. The course is designed for those who have had a break from education. This edition of the taster course will draw from the BSc in Management at Birkbeck, University of London. Book your free place <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D5571499135%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C45f4b08c715345ff393608d99ac58edd%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637710995570787201%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=W5jqMLWaZ7SNI9VfpPt%2FAWV%2FpBNomy9aipvOrzaNVKw%3D&reserved=0> .
Workers’ Stories Exhibition (Glasgow) // Wednesday 10th of November

Over the last 18 months, the Workers' Stories project has collected stories about COVID-19 from across Scotland. They’ve published stories from care homes, hospitals, supermarkets, trains and from furloughed workers. Cheral even went along to a Worker’s Stories photography workshop and published a wire article <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D196b78ea53%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C45f4b08c715345ff393608d99ac58edd%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637710995570797196%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=s6%2B7kE34VEve2ggZDraX%2F3XFF4WtTGGbYSEgSoVmlbM%3D&reserved=0>  about it.

Their first in-person exhibition will be held at GalGael on Fairley Street in Govan and the exhibition will include a selection of images and texts, as well as brief talks by some of the contributors and others who have assisted with the Workers' Stories project. Light food and drink will be available and all are welcome to attend. Some of the Ofgem branch committee are coming along too so do come say a hello! column2: With COP26 now underway, the environmental footprint of countries and businesses is under the microscope. We are putting pressure on Ofgem to commit to sourcing 100% renewable energy and practice what we preach about decarbonisation. If you’d like to get involved with this contact our Green Rep @Samantha Wood
Cheral Govind will be joining PCS Union block for the COP26 Global Day of Action Rally. Send her an email or teams message if you’d like to join!

We would like to bring your attention to the temporary update to Ofgem overtime policy in this wire article <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D22437f82ab%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Ce043752191cf405aa62a08d9a043c69d%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637717035228935635%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=LhiVQyqi0FJM23AsEsOWDoTErAVKOIlgNzVcYzkIXhY%3D&reserved=0> . column1: Happy Diwali and Sal Mubarak from PCS Ofgem!

This branch are wishing all celebrating a very happy Diwali and New Year this week to all celebrating – we hope the upcoming year is auspicious and that we keep the light inside of us amongst what seems like such darkness!
Campaigns and news
Scotrail RMT reached pay deal

For those of us up in Glasgow we may have been aware of our comrades at ScotRail who threatened to cripple rail services in Scotland as they began strike action during COP26. After months of protracted negotiations and destroyed industrial relations the strike and proceeding well deserved pay agreement is a warm welcome to staff. Read on here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dc81f1b8cde%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Ce043752191cf405aa62a08d9a043c69d%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637717035228945628%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=TTwhHNZxSYtLjnTd%2Bnd68nmtQhrPVGRG4rUn7EhQ0ZA%3D&reserved=0> .
Glasgow refuse staff and street cleaners begin strike action

Continuing the theme of striking industries for COP26, a strike by refuse staff and street cleaners in Glasgow began this week <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D40af85610a%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Ce043752191cf405aa62a08d9a043c69d%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637717035228945628%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=gWkfcRz4AuaP6aTSw0aZT45dOBwgqctXQq83fXEQmfM%3D&reserved=0> . For 10 months key workers have been trying to reach a settlement and are taking a stand against being disrespected and undervalued for so long. We are standing with you and particularly tweets on the Glasgow GMB twitter page <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D464a241dce%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Ce043752191cf405aa62a08d9a043c69d%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637717035228955627%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=ayPW3BLJthdzyX8n2fsSe4BSIdjlhUBqm5nqMCTvxFY%3D&reserved=0>  is bursting full of solidarity that we love to see!
Union leaders write to leaders of the COP26 nations

COP26 negotiations involve government leaders and officials but largely exclude workers and worker representatives. General secretaries of PCS, Unite, FBU, the NEU and ten other unions have written to the leaders of the COP26 nations pointing out that “Workers keep our economies going. Without workers, there will be no transition to the economy we need for the future. Read further here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Db35264207f%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Ce043752191cf405aa62a08d9a043c69d%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637717035228955627%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=iX49cwSYyBor9jXNMuD4tOk%2FXIGfdtci%2FJ9kT8KlLUM%3D&reserved=0> .
Events
COP26 Global Day of Action.

World leaders meeting in Glasgow from this weekend are failing on the measures needed to tackle climate change, both in the UK and globally. The UK government’s recently published net zero 2050 strategy is meaningless without a plan for how this will be achieved and how they intend to provide protections for workers and communities as we transition to a new decarbonised economy.
To make our demands heard, we are calling on all members to take part, in Covid-safe ways, in the national demonstrations planned in Glasgow and across the country on 6 November.

More details on actions near you can be found on the COP26 coalition website <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D4d2d9032f6%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Ce043752191cf405aa62a08d9a043c69d%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637717035228965618%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=4XDArnWt39YuUqarfR0l84D6HS0Hz1113uVnS3L0enc%3D&reserved=0>  or for more trade union specific information, including trade union blocs on the demonstrations visit the WorkersClimateAction  <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D9a6dafbc07%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Ce043752191cf405aa62a08d9a043c69d%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637717035228965618%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C1000&sdata=suw4vl0cXqB0w5RiVmA2fYxapkfCtySvHrrmAvt67b0%3D&reserved=0> website.

Reminder: Birkbeck Free Courses: Management taster course
Tuesday 9 November – Tuesday 7 December 6-7:30pm

This free, online, 5-week programme is for those with an interest in management and business principles who might like to study those subjects at university. All are welcome, regardless of your previous educational experience. The course is designed for those who have had a break from education.
