Demand Ofgem powers our offices with 100% renewable energy

Following our letter <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D48d7032788%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C9e7cdaa61a61424e7ad608d9a5c514e2%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637723089034409555%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=BsubdeoXwUti5pqtJouLDVjKWuvnj%2FoHfcnP7w%2B7fuE%3D&reserved=0>  to Ofgem in September, we continue to put pressure on Ofgem to commit to sourcing 100% renewable energy and practice what we preach about decarbonisation. While Ofgem has a big impact as an energy regulator, we can also make a difference more directly as an organisation. We call on Ofgem to commit to powering all our offices with 100% renewable energy by 1 April 2022. Support our demand, by signing and sharing this petition <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Ddc980c18e6%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C9e7cdaa61a61424e7ad608d9a5c514e2%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637723089034409555%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=eICuC5ZGGNyyF3PK3387ZliZHDZhTURrrx7oNRHYOjI%3D&reserved=0> .
Donate to Glasgow's Spirit of Christmas

Glasgow's Spirit of Christmas is back! For those who don't know, Glasgow's Spirit of Christmas (GSOC) is a group that has been running since 2014 to co-ordinate with charities across Glasgow and the wider surrounding areas to provide presents for children who might otherwise have nothing to open on December 25th. Campaigns and news
Pensions robbery – make your voice heard

A cut in employee pension contributions, that’s now worth more than £1,000 for many, should have brought in nearly 3 years ago. The government wants to rip up the rules so it would never be obliged to pass benefits on to scheme members in this way again – known as ‘cost-sharing’ provisions.

PCS has begun legal action to challenge the government blocking its own cost sharing provisions. The list of unions making a challenge includes FBU, PCS, POA, GMB and Unite. Employee contribution rates have remained unchanged in 2019, 2020 and 2021 – see how much this has cost you by using our calculator <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dfa3ae7a00b%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C9e7cdaa61a61424e7ad608d9a5c514e2%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637723089034429545%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=%2FvLe%2F5fJo%2FPdxR1zTJ%2FxAajvhfRUJgCfh0DMzsv9pK4%3D&reserved=0>  and share your loss on social media using the share buttons on the calculator page. Use our campaign action <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dc8d1d482f4%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C9e7cdaa61a61424e7ad608d9a5c514e2%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637723089034429545%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=aebDZ%2BDb%2BRgtukwGqk94ez1CKqGh%2FN3plgU2e1NjMOw%3D&reserved=0>  to email your MP telling them how much you have lost.

On Saturday climate activists, including some from our very own branch, joined the Global Day of Action where an estimated 100,000 rallied to bring attention to Climate Justice. Despite the miserable weather spirits were wonderfully high, and this blog post <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D953f19bb12%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C9e7cdaa61a61424e7ad608d9a5c514e2%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637723089034449533%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=7fXdeMCO5gSesbjjjPmh9WBnQ9UBbqLIx63oay%2FNhLA%3D&reserved=0>  written by Lynn Henderson (Senior National Officer of PCS) succinctly highlights why climate action and trade unions go hand in hand.
DVLA staff vote to strike but anti-trade union laws curtail action
While 79% voted for action the mandatory 50% turnout threshold was not reached.

The DVLA dispute began earlier this year and staff have taken numerous days of strike action due to government ministers scuppering a deal <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Db704cdf6c1%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C9e7cdaa61a61424e7ad608d9a5c514e2%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637723089034459529%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=Kkg6XuFohPUSzpoJ3zfM9Ye3fohrUfjuWC6dtVBM4LQ%3D&reserved=0>  to end the dispute in June.

A PCS spokesman said: “It is frustrating for members who have voted for industrial action that they have been denied their democratic right to strike, due to some of the most repressive anti-trade union laws in Western Europe.
“Our members are our number one priority, and we will continue to campaign for their health and safety at DVLA and across the civil service.”

column1: Branch News
Pressuring Ofgem on their commitment to the Real Living Wage

This week is Living Wage Week <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Deb340295f0%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C7970a2a467404440581908d9aa9e78c9%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637728421356751419%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=GDWX0ZpRwi8W1cGjPOHOFi3va4TzI3Jp8f0lrrxaboQ%3D&reserved=0> . We’ve had a longstanding campaign to get Ofgem to pay staff a Real Living Wage. Despite Ofgem’s verbal commitment to a Real Living Wage, we haven’t seen as much of it in the OD as we would expect. We are continuing to pressure Ofgem to live up to their commitment and pay staff a wage they can afford to live on.
Disappointing response to our green letter

After COP26, there is more and more focus on actions rather than words. Whilst Ofgem encourages consumers and industry to decarbonise, we are not going on that journey ourselves. Ofgem has failed to commit to conducting an environmental audit which is essential to know areas where we are doing well or need improvement. We will continue to pressure Ofgem to recognise the climate emergency and take appropriate, and urgent, steps.

Disability History Month
Disability History Month (DHM) starts on 18 November and continues until 18 December. The theme is Disability and Hidden Impairments.

The PCS national disabled members’ forum has put together a DHM poster <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dfd0b61549d%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C7970a2a467404440581908d9aa9e78c9%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637728421356761416%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=OOP%2BDcnvHei5ut%2FEZcw%2FxnQ5kpLMvUK%2BeOt%2F%2BQILqQE%3D&reserved=0> , 10 facts poster <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D43db05082f%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C7970a2a467404440581908d9aa9e78c9%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637728421356761416%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=5t4ikI8QUf%2FfObRvXtwV%2Fs87nCW5kRQ%2FFCEqvr57N%2BU%3D&reserved=0>  and photo op card <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D0a49f7a9ff%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C7970a2a467404440581908d9aa9e78c9%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637728421356771409%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=BnkHbBXDJif%2Fi3DlVc50knukpKNuBqw65DdOVvLxFEo%3D&reserved=0>  for members to use to promote this important month. The DHM 10 facts poster reflects on 100 years in disability history and delves into some of the key developments, legislation, and people from the 1920s until the 2010s, one for each decade, who have made a positive impact on disabled people’s lives.
National campaign to fight the cost-of-living crisis
This week PCS have ramped up our fight against the cost-of-living crisis. We wrote in the Newsletter last week about the Great Pensions Robbery.
The fact that UK prices are soaring at the fastest rate for almost 10 years underlines the urgent need for the government to act on civil service pay as many PCS members face a bleak winter.

As fuel and energy prices surge <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dae9de53579%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C7970a2a467404440581908d9aa9e78c9%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637728421356771409%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=G%2FReHFLhncK8fig9vU27RTtnkwxjAXCgYRdzzwYmE5U%3D&reserved=0>  and the cost-of-living crisis deepens our members are feeling the pinch more than ever. The more of us who get involved in PCS’s national campaign, the more impact we can have to right these wrongs.

It is time for action, years of pay cuts and the pensions robbery are taking their toll. Get involved <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D48f8f1f32e%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C7970a2a467404440581908d9aa9e78c9%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637728421356781404%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=K5oe5VGsrlmVGHv4T7PoezXCcG31NQvjNgkZA9KylWk%3D&reserved=0>  with your union to make your voice heard.
Life-changing legal win: ‘PCS was with me every step of the way’
PCS Ministry of Justice member, Tina (not their real name), was awarded more than £135,000 in compensation after being badly injured in a fall at work and turning to the union for help.

Tina, who is now retired and lives alone, says she could not have entertained the idea of financing her own legal case: “I cannot fault PCS for the support they gave me… they were with me every step of the way. Without them, I couldn’t have afforded to have done this. I just didn’t have any money. I would have risked losing my flat to pay for it. I’ve always said you need your union behind you.”

PCS MOJ Group Secretary Laura Bee said: “Our member’s injury could have been easily avoided had the MOJ just fixed the faulty door, but now her life has been changed forever. Her PCS membership gave her access to expert legal services free of charge, which meant her employer was held accountable and she’s kept 100% of her compensation.”

You can read more about Tina’s victory here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D811aeecb43%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C7970a2a467404440581908d9aa9e78c9%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637728421356791401%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=xK33WlUTiKo1eZCUNS4TemZqzyUZwJA7iVf7mUAP7pY%3D&reserved=0> .

column1: Branch News
Ofgem spend on McKinsey is up £1.34million.

That’s right, up to September £1,340,000.00 has been paid to McKinsey whilst we are still waiting on tangible answers to their organisation redesign. We are looking to move productively forwards and get answers we are desperately lacking. Members: please get in touch (email pcs@ofgem.gov.uk <mailto:pcs@ofgem.gov.uk> ) if you hear anything concerning around the OD!
Equal Group Report
Ofgem honoured the FOI request for the Equal Group Report to the union Branch Executive Committee, and we are currently digesting the contents and hope to chat over our findings with the D&I team.
Campaigns and news
Disability History Month
Disability History Month (DHM) starts on 18 November and continues until 18 December. The theme is Disability and Hidden Impairments.

The PCS national disabled members’ forum has put together a DHM poster <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dc26a0f1641%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Ced0972534faa4fd3427808d9b0e15133%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637735304887160146%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=qvN%2BgnAXqDPUtrP0Ec6RGkVUrW%2Bd8FYN5QyDgKQjI5U%3D&reserved=0> , 10 facts poster <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D1ceff0d813%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Ced0972534faa4fd3427808d9b0e15133%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637735304887170127%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=E27N6Wed%2FhrqxDW%2FJvPRyKHX3xSm8DiHJQYW2X3YgLk%3D&reserved=0>  and photo op card <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Da54f231fcb%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Ced0972534faa4fd3427808d9b0e15133%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637735304887170127%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=C0mJrIvHAKy0zaWX0I6GvoEVkCTMzL6FmgK%2FFJtXElE%3D&reserved=0>  for members to use to promote this important month. The DHM 10 facts poster reflects on 100 years in disability history and delves into some of the key developments, legislation, and people from the 1920s until the 2010s, one for each decade, who have made a positive impact on disabled people’s lives.
PCS responds to tragic deaths of migrants trying to cross the Channel

27 people drowned last night after trying to reach the UK in a small boat. PCS general secretary Mark Serwotka said: ""The deaths of 27 people in the channel trying to reach the UK, is an absolute tragedy. It is shocking that the government is suggesting Border Force staff turn boats back, which will clearly be against international law and morally reprehensible. PCS is reviewing all its options, including taking out a judicial review against Priti Patel's plans and a possible industrial response."" Read the whole statement here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D5be53ebe5a%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Ced0972534faa4fd3427808d9b0e15133%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637735304887180121%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=1bppArC8UdfSEWEsQrLkeK%2F6Jv2sP84n%2BPJqrdGPsy8%3D&reserved=0> .
Get involved in the PCS National Pensions Campaign
Despite being the government’s own workers many members are struggling financially. Unless we see a significant pay rise in the region of 10% their living standards are set to go backwards.

Our members are feeling the pinch more than ever as the cost-of-living crisis deepens, on payday we are asking you get involved in our campaign to raise pay, pensions and living standards. Campaigns and news
PCS joins legal action against government plans to pushback boats

PCS, the union representing Border Force staff, has joined Care4Calais in their legal fight to prevent Home Secretary Priti Patel from pushing back migrant Channel boats. PCS general secretary Mark Serwotka said:

“Our border force members are aghast at the thought they will be forced to implement such a cruel and inhumane policy. If the government does not abandon this appalling approach, we will pursue all legal avenues including a judicial review. PCS will not rule out all forms of industrial action, including disrupting the implementation of the Pushback policy if the Home Secretary insists on going ahead.”

Read the whole statement here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dddee671082%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cf2811c27df6441ba523f08d9b591aa6b%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637740459512988179%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=X%2BrjgC%2FodfjpmwCu7H7Sa%2FkGB6nyORv5i3GNjYZLpEI%3D&reserved=0> .
Solidarity to striking UCU comrades!

Three consecutive days of strike action hit 58 universities today after university bosses and their representatives refused to withdraw pension cuts or address falling pay and worsening working conditions. Further detail is outlined here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dabcf64ecdd%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cf2811c27df6441ba523f08d9b591aa6b%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637740459512988179%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=h%2Fs9qjnvZ%2FlQ8bYrgjb2Q%2Fw4txtxc%2BLuG5r6HyMEhjE%3D&reserved=0>  and notable statistics are:

column2: Staff pay has fallen <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D281721ffdf%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cf2811c27df6441ba523f08d9b591aa6b%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637740459512998178%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=Q9Ly9GGnvF2hZaRFZUxMrGMmjZOAW72HI%2BZA3lnDQz4%3D&reserved=0>  by 20% after twelve years of below inflation pay offers.

90,000 academic and academic-related staff are employed on insecure <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D9291f41f76%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cf2811c27df6441ba523f08d9b591aa6b%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637740459512998178%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=sh2ME1w6imgsfs8SjccR055At86aYS9fbW0BCpJBSZw%3D&reserved=0>  contracts.
The gender pay gap in UK universities sits at 15%, whilst the disability pay gap is 9% and the race pay gap is 17%.

Staff are also experiencing a crisis of work-related stress with over half showing <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D8b687a5958%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cf2811c27df6441ba523f08d9b591aa6b%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637740459513008168%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=bmBDDmfEgTSR51E0Jlch8dSzg9B4L8DC1NYJ7V8Dhq4%3D&reserved=0>  probable signs of depression.

Available now: Winter 2021 edition of PCS Activate online now

With a difficult winter ahead, the need to increase and broaden involvement in our national campaign has truly never been more pressing. Taking on the myriad issues causing the cost-of-living crisis is an unenviable task, but we truly have the power to bring about change. Check out these resources for activists <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D6ff2a2eb8f%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cf2811c27df6441ba523f08d9b591aa6b%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637740459513018161%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=wcOLxWCcIy0%2By7t4ZLS4qkSKuEKnXzeWTyX4%2FqLb4Zk%3D&reserved=0> .
Events
Winter programme – come along to some training!

The 2022 PCS training courses are now available for online registration and cover a range of courses from introductory advocate training, courses on equality issues: including neurodiversity, sexual harassment, racism, menopause, mental health, bullying, domestic abuse, green reps and climate justice, and the PCS women’s course. Courses are hosted over zoom given by PCS own staff or Trade Union Congress (TUC) college partners and they’re a great way to meet likeminded folk in other civil service organisations! Information on how to sign up can be found here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Ddbd7d92579%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cf2811c27df6441ba523f08d9b591aa6b%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637740459513028157%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=R6oi4ZIF857Yjcoy6P0w%2BHJleu%2FnSLOGHDWlq5kG%2BWs%3D&reserved=0> .
PCS National Disabled Members' Seminar Sessions
Thursday 2 December at 12pm (Teams) and 6pm (Zoom),
Tuesday 7 December at 12pm (Teams) and 6pm (Zoom).

Thursday 2nd December sessions will examine disability discrimination cases, what your employer should be doing to support disabled members in the workplace and how to get more involved in your union. Members will hear from three speakers - Angela Grant, National Disabled Members' Forum (NDMF) and NEC member, Keith Brand, Senior Solicitor at Thompsons Solicitors and Austin Harney, National Disabled Members' Forum (NDMF) and NEC member.

Tuesday 7 December sessions will reflect on 100 years of disability history to celebrate this year's Disability History Month and explore the theme - Disability and Hidden Impairments. Members will hear from speakers including: Karen Foster, PCS Head of Equality, Judy Hunt, Author of No Limits: The disabled people's movement - a radical history and Luke Beesley, Disability Rights Activist.

The seminar sessions are open for all members to attend. For more information and to register please go to the Eventbrite page. <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D9fd18b65c6%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cf2811c27df6441ba523f08d9b591aa6b%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637740459513038154%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=0OsZhb6TWJ0arlk0J%2BTzygxA8LGnLB%2FVSW%2FSotoA%2BH4%3D&reserved=0>

Campaigns and news
PCS slams outsourcing of Turing Student Exchange scheme to Capita
The British Council previously ran the £110m scheme but was stripped of the contract according to the Guardian in favour of the private consultancy company.

The council has helped hundreds of thousands of young people find work and study placements abroad. There are now major fears the expertise of British Council’s long experience with international educational exchanges will be lost. Read the whole statement here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D596df5e87a%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C5a917b9b1d8b43575aeb08d9bc0524fe%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637747553717393125%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=PVtEJ0UwvyqgiDshV%2B9JiOgFdSGTDj4%2FH9lLQMqIH64%3D&reserved=0> .

Winter programme – come along to some training!

The 2022 PCS training courses are now available for online registration and cover a range of courses from introductory advocate training, courses on equality issues: including neurodiversity, sexual harassment, racism, menopause, mental health, bullying, domestic abuse, green reps and climate justice, and the PCS women’s course. Courses are hosted over zoom given by PCS own staff or Trade Union Congress (TUC) college partners and they’re a great way to meet likeminded folk in other civil service organisations! Information on how to sign up can be found here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3Dd11b7d11e0%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C5a917b9b1d8b43575aeb08d9bc0524fe%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637747553717413117%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=mcFGMhKJVonfA1fHDB5aTT3uhiAlaAIGDcDgyAhU4og%3D&reserved=0> .
a:gender Trans and Intersex Inclusion Workshop – Multiple dates available
Anyone working for a government department or agency is welcome to join us for a workshop covering the following topics:

column2: Understanding what the terms ‘trans’, ‘intersex’ and ‘nonbinary’ mean,
How to use appropriate terminology and language,
A brief overview of relevant legislation,
Recognising the issues that trans and intersex colleagues might face in the workplace and wider society, and
Exploring how to support trans and intersex colleagues in the workplace.

column1: This workshop will be presented by members of a:gender, the national cross-government network for trans and intersex staff.

If you’d like to attend, please register here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D5b99b4b9fe%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7C5a917b9b1d8b43575aeb08d9bc0524fe%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637747553717423107%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=OxKeBoKErk6y7GEmONJ9vDAagzI8q8DyNMPa%2FwTYtRg%3D&reserved=0> . PCS OD Update - Freedom of Information request results and draft statement [OFFICIAL Internal Only],"Dear members,
(Resending as the encryption seems to disable the voting buttons. That means I’m just expecting all of you to behave nicely ??)

Apologies for the slight lack of updates from the branch over the last few months. It has been a busy time for many of us. However, we have not been idle, and we have recently obtained a lot more material on the OD by way of a Freedom of Information request.

As this information is now considered in the public domain, we are preparing to share this with you imminently. Mainly so you can help us analyse all of it ??. We also want to use this as an opportunity to set out an updated position on the OD, in light of the materials we have already reviewed, and the developments over the last few months.

We are very mindful that we have not had a lot of engagement about the OD recently, but as the branch executive committee, we do need to make sure we represent your views, not just those of the committee members. So with that in mind, I have attached the draft statement we intend to circulate ahead of the all staff call on Thursday morning. This is draft and not for wider circulation. The purpose of sharing it now is to give you the opportunity to tell us if you endorse the statement or not. We will only issue it if we have sufficient support from the branch.

Unfortunately we do not have time to make extensive changes to the statement, and so we cannot work it out with all of you until we have a consensus version. Instead, I ask that if you broadly agree with the statement, you use the ‘Approve’ voting button. If you are broadly unhappy with it, please use the ‘Reject’ voting button. If there are particular bits of feedback you would like us to know, please do email them, and we will take those into account as best we can. We will also run a members meeting tomorrow (Tuesday 14/12) over lunch to discuss the FOI, the statement, and our next steps.
If you have any questions, speak to one of us or drop us an email.
Cheerio,
Frank

column1: Branch News

Thanks to all members who joined the call on Tuesday about the OD and the Ofgem/McKinsey FOI response. We’re finalising the statement and will be circulating the docs shortly! There’s a lot of info to go through, so we’re crowdsourcing analysis.
Please do join in and infill your findings and analysis in the spreadsheet we have set up. Any specific points you want to share with us, email pcs@ofgem.gov.uk <mailto:pcs@ofgem.gov.uk>
On a more positive note, we could indicate that we've seen the grade pay levels plan and, without giving details, say it has taken into account the analysis we produced.
Campaigns and news
PCS seeks joint judicial review over pensions robbery

On the 14th December 2021, PCS and 5 sister unions applied to the High Court for a judicial review to force the government to give public sector workers the 2% cut in civil service pension contributions that they are owed.

This followed the 2016 valuation of the civil service pension scheme; however, the government blocked the agreed cost-sharing mechanism and PCS members have been forced to overpay into their civil service pensions over the past couple of years and have ‘lost’ on average £1,000. The legal action seeks to force the government to change its decision.

FOI material - McKinsey presentations - OD transformation statement [OFFICIAL Internal Only],"Dear members,

Earlier this week, we circulated a draft statement on our recent Freedom of Information request to Ofgem on McKinsey’s work. We have updated our statement, which is now being sent directly to Ofgem, and is attached. You will also find attached some core McKinsey material from the FOI, as explained in the following:

PCS is both pleased and disappointed to inform members that we have recently obtained, through a Freedom of Information request, more information about the Organisational Design project. We are pleased, because it has been a common complaint of staff that they have had insufficient information and insight into the OD and its drivers to meaningfully engage with it. Yet we are also disappointed that we had to resort to an FOI to obtain this information, much of which we believe Ofgem could and should have shared proactively with staff in the interests of transparency and facilitating meaningful consultation with staff.

We will share all material with PCS members. We are doing this for two principal reasons: First, we believe that there is information that colleagues deserve to know about. The OD has had, and continues to have, a vast impact on our working lives. We believe that providing information on the OD is in all colleagues’ interests, and we believe that staff are capable of processing the material with regards to the context and materiality of proposals. Second, PCS is a democratic organisation. We have a mandate and obligation to work on behalf of our members. We have come into information provided for a public sector organisation, procured through public funding, that is relevant and of interest to members, and are not willing to censure what is made available to interested parties.

We do, however, recognise our responsibility in taking this decision, and that there may be unintended consequences to the sharing of information. For instance, we are aware that the materials cover a long period of time and that the OD has evolved, so that earlier material does not necessarily reflect the OD as it stands today. Still, we think even the evolution of the OD provides good insight into the thought processes that have directed it, and helps to illustrate how the OD got here.

The structure of the information, as shared by Information Rights, is pretty chaotic. As the BEC, we’ve tried our best to look through stuff for pertinent and important information for members. A lot of people have told us that they have limited time to engage with transformation materials because their day jobs continue to be incredibly busy. Unfortunately, at present, looking through the files includes wading through duplications and taking time to try and piece together the order that they should go in. We are, therefore, very grateful to those who have come forward to volunteer to help us organise the files and we will start doing this straight after we’re back from the holiday break. We will organise so that they are ordered chronologically and index them in order to make them more usable for our members, as our experience of navigating these documents is one of frustration.

We informed Ofgem HR of our intention to publish the full FOI materials, and proposed a method of information sharing that we believe is in our members interests. We are going to take a phased approach to releasing detailed documents, giving us time for organising them and pressing Ofgem HR to provide some accompanying information, ‘right to reply’ style. This should provide further transparency, detail and analysis from Ofgem HR alongside the slides, providing you, PCS members, with richer information to analyse. It will also provide more clarity and transparency on where early options were considered and discarded, when and why, mitigating against propagating outdated information.

Today, we are releasing ‘end of phase’ slides from McKinsey, covering a significant volume of information and decisions through the course of the OD to date. This is to be followed in the new year by more detailed materials leading up to those decisions.

We continue to seek volunteers to help us analyse the FOI material, so that we can define batches of detailed slides for sharing. If interested in helping out, please contact us at pcs@ofgem.gov.uk <mailto:pcs@ofgem.gov.uk> .
Best,
PCS Ofgem Branch Executive Committee

PCS statement on the OD selection process [OFFICIAL Internal Only],"Dear members,
Welcome back from your holidays.
Statement on Selection Process

The end of 2021 saw attention shift from abstract design principles to the lived experience of the OD, with quite some uncertainty and unhappiness on the proposed selection processes for team managers.

This week, we’ve kicked off our 2022 ExCo engagement with an open letter setting out seven clear requests to learn lessons from the portfolio manager selection process in order to improve the team manager selection process.
Please find attached the letter sent on behalf of members. We will, of course, keep you updated on developments.
McKinsey Freedom of Information material
At the end of 2021, we circulated the ‘end of phase’ slides from McKinsey.
We are working with volunteers to sort the McKinsey FOI materials into some semblance of order so that we can share the outputs and so that you can draw information from them.
If you’d like to volunteer to help us do this, please reach out to Evan Williams, and if you already have we will be in touch soon!
Best,
PCS Ofgem

Happy new year from PCS Ofgem - come volunteer with us :)! [OFFICIAL Internal Only],"Happy new year to our PCS members!
We hope you’re returning to work rested and well - personally I’d take another month off but that’s me ??.

I don’t know if anyone predicted 2021 going like this and all of us should be so proud of what we’ve achieved at work (be it big or little!) working remotely, during a full blown energy crisis and juggling the organisational design.

You may be aware that this branch committee are forever looking to expand and engage with you to productively listen to concerns and work with Ofgem to make the workplace better for all of us. The whole work force is the union and if anyone’s new years’ resolution was to get involved with something different, there is no better time to help your branch - as frequently or infrequently you can like.
Below are some upcoming areas/positions we are hoping you may be interested to do – if you’d like a chat about anything just reply to this email and we’ll be in touch!

column2: Health and Safety rep (10SC): Do you care about the safety and wellbeing of your colleagues? Do trip hazards, inadequate ventilation and uncomfortable furniture really get your goat? Then you’re an H&S Rep in the making! To complement the brilliant work our Glasgow H&S rep does, we are looking for a London-based rep to help keep H&S at the forefront of what Ofgem does. The work H&S reps do is invaluable and time off on Ofgem’s time is permitted to complete training.

PCS Ofgem Equalities Committee: So much of what Ofgem does may directly or indirectly affect folk with protected characteristics (and characteristics less acknowledged!). And while Ofgem is now trying harder on D&I, history shows that it is the energy and ideas of staff that actually make the greatest difference. That is why we are rebooting our Branch Equalities Committee, with members representing the full range of protected characteristics. If you consider yourself to be from an under-represented group(s), you can help us identify concrete improvements we can bargain, negotiate and campaign for at Ofgem, alongside our friends in the staff networks.  Don’t hesitate to speak to Cheral Govind by teams or email if you have any questions!

Local reps: Last year we set our sights on having an ambassador for PCS in each portfolio, to connect with our members and spread the word about the good work we do. We’ve made good progress, but there are still many portfolios left to cover (particularly in Analysis & Assurance, Corporate Services, Communications, ESMS, Enforcement, General Counsel, Networks, Retail and Strategy & Decarbonisation). If you enjoy chatting with your colleagues and are proud of what the union does, then this is a very easy way in which you could help us out.

Union Learning Reps: Love learning new things and wish you could do more of it here at Ofgem? Then the Union Learning Rep (ULR) role might be the one for you. As ULR, you will contribute to shaping Ofgem’s L&D offering, link up with the world of union learning, and help members navigate the L&D available to them (and there is certainly plenty!).

Assistant Organisers: Like organising events, run campaigns, conduct surveys or just generally enjoy getting more people involved in our PCS community? Then it sounds like you’re an organiser at heart. You’ll have a lot of freedom about what you can get involved in with this role, so speak to Frank if you’d like to know more.

OD Researchers: Missing those uni days when you got to really sink your teeth into an essay or research project? If you want help us digest the McKinsey documents we receive by an FOI, or even just interested in gauging what will be involved then reply to this email as soon as possible to be added to the list of researchers who have already kindly agreed to help.
Other ways to help: Does none of the above appeal to you, but you’d still like to be more involved in the union? Nae worries! Speak to Frank about what else is possible. ??

column1: Branch News
Organise with your union

Last week we put out a call for volunteers to take part in your union as we organise to make Ofgem a fairer and better place to work. It's never too late or too soon to get involved, we have a number of roles ranging in commitment, experience, and skills. Being an active part of your union can build our collective voice at work whilst also allowing you to up skill, re skill, earn qualifications and meet a new network of people in your workplace, around the country and across the world.
Ofgem apologise for OD mistakes

There have been a number of high profile apologies this week. On the all staff call on Tuesday, we heard and apology a shift in tone in acknowledging the issues you have been raising with us about the OD. Whilst there is still considerable work to be done to rebuild trust and morale across the organisation after a draining pandemic, the biggest energy crisis in over 40 years and a badly managed restructure, there is a window of opportunity and we will continue to always positively represent your interests in discussions with Ofgem.
Raise an IT ticket to whitelist PCS Newsletter

Last week we also mentioned how we need you to raise an IT ticket to get the newsletter whitelisted. Thank you to those who have already done this. Many of you are still not receiving the weekly newsletter via Mailchimp as it is being sent to the junk folder. You can tell Outlook we’re not junk but it doesn’t solve the issue for new members or those who haven’t got around to updating Outlook. See step-by-step guide below on how to do this:
<https://mcusercontent.com/5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd/images/8de62993-ba71-0c9b-c80a-286a923c0eb0.png>
Campaigns and news
Update your details on PCS Digital ahead of PCS national ballot

Ahead of the PCS national ballot from 14 February to 14 March to support our campaign to raise pay, pensions and living standards, we want all our members to review and update the personal details we hold for them.
This is not a strike ballot. It will ask members what action they would be prepared to take. A statutory industrial action ballot might follow later.

To review your details, you will need a PCS Digital account <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D817c9419a8%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cd97e456dec7847051ba908d9d6941605%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637776754385485692%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=2OkzYPK5S%2BhLcwDj0Ni%2FRlZbpJRjIrAtVsDwYBA3MJU%3D&reserved=0> . If you haven’t registered for PCS Digital all you need to do on the online form is enter your surname, your first name and then your PCS membership number, which has 7 digits and starts with a P (you'll find it on any emails you've had from us). You then enter your personal email address and click on the sign-up button. You will then receive an email from us with instructions on how to set up your password.
Sign the petition to support Tracy Scholes

Tracey Scholes has been a bus driver at the Queens Road depot for the past 34 years. When Tracey started her journey as a bus driver in 1987 she was the first female bus driver employed at the Queens Road depot.

The industry back then was very male dominated and a woman taking a driving position was challenging to say the least however Tracey took the challenge and has had the full respect of all her colleagues.

Over the years Tracey has been instrumental in paving the way for other women to take up positions within the passenger sector. Go North West Ltd have refused to consider proposals from Tracey and her Unite trade union reps to keep her in employment. This has resulted in her unfair dismissal from Go North West Ltd for capability to fulfil her role a PCV driver.
The company’s only resolution is to offer Tracey a position in the company that would see Tracey’s pay and hours cut significantly leaving her in financial hardship.

You can sign the petition here. <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D1d56fc44e4%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cd97e456dec7847051ba908d9d6941605%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637776754385485692%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=1bT36l868Bs8yvPQqBaE6b2ISaLUep5Ko%2F4cB0gikj4%3D&reserved=0>
Events, training and courses
Value my skills workshop
Tuesday 18 January, 12:00-13:00
Join the PCS Value My Skills online workshop run by experienced employability tutor, Jane Walton, from the WEA (Workers Educational Association).
Are you considering a change of job or promotion, doing a course or some voluntary work, or simply want to review what you can offer to the jobs market?

This workshop will help you identify your transferable skills. All of us have experiences and skills from different areas of our lives - learn how to identify your strengths and areas for development.

Register here <https://eur02.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fpcs-ofgem5416764354.us19.list-manage.com%2Ftrack%2Fclick%3Fu%3D5b3186863c55fecfdfed2efbd%26id%3D12d04a3b3b%26e%3D83e756501f&data=04%7C01%7Crory.mccabe%40ofgem.gov.uk%7Cd97e456dec7847051ba908d9d6941605%7C185562ad39bc48408e40be6216340c52%7C0%7C0%7C637776754385485692%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000&sdata=KKR2J1rKyaM6mCq27MsZrqMGEhNC%2F76%2FEx05LS8nvxQ%3D&reserved=0> .
